Description: This beautifully composed wine tastes complex, flavorful but elegant at the same time. Enticing black-cherry and black-currant aromas are followed by warm and layered fruit and baking-spice flavors that fill the palate and linger nicely on the finish. It shows a fine balance between exuberant fruit and subtle oak spices, all nicely framed by soft tannins.
Name: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Lot No. 87 Tempranillo (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Excellent fruit concentration and a deft touch of spicy oak make this full-bodied well-balanced wine tempting and delicious. It's the first vintage from Starfield's estate vineyard, and was aged in 50% new French and American barrels. The stand-out wine marries layers of black cherry and black currants with mild cinnamon and nutmeg nuances on a velvety-smooth texture.
Name: Starfield 2016 Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a full-bore full-bodied wine that is not at all shy about its oak spiciness and potent ripe fruit core. Cedar, vanilla and cinnamon nuances in the aroma lead to vibrant black-cherry and dark-chocolate flavors while, a velvety coat of tannins forms a big but smooth texture.
Name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)

Description: This broad rich wine shows plenty of spicy mellow fruit and oak character and a melt-in-your-mouth texture. It spent an extra-long 34 months in older barrels and tastes like warm cherry pie with a touch of brown sugar, yet without the sweetness.
Name: Spann Vineyards 2015 Lake Family Tempranillo (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a fresh take on an often hearty and rustic grape, beginning with lively aromas of blackberry, wet gravel and roasted wood on the nose. The palate is bright yet tense, offering boysenberry and rose-petal flavors while remaining light on its feet.
Name: Morgan 2017 Tempranillo (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is beautifully balanced: fresh and spicy, showing lots of blackberry and black-cherry flavors, a lively mouthfeel and medium body. It will be easy to drink and a snap to pair with food from Korean barbecue to fried chicken.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2016 Tempranillo (Yolo County)

Description: Aromas like grilled beef and black pepper lead to gutsy fruit flavors and a firmly tannic texture in this full-bodied, flavorful but not overripe wine. Smoky spicy notes prevail and the wine's balance favors a bit of restraint.
Name: Toca Madera 2015 Reserve Estate Bottled Tempranillo (Madera)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full in body and wonderfully plummy in flavor, this medium- to full-bodied wine feels warm and broad and has uncomplicated, persistent fruit flavors that are easy to appreciate. A light wrapping of fine-grained tannins adds to the texture.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Reserve Verbitksy Vineyard Tempranillo (Fair Play)

Description: Black pepper and cedar aromas and fresh grapey plummy flavors make this light-bodied wine likeable and a bit distinctive. It has mild tannins to keep the texture smooth and velvety.
Name: Toca Madera 2016 Estate Bottled Tempranillo (Madera)

Description: Rich aromas of black currant, kirsch, cold-brewed coffee and loamy soil show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is thick with tannins that are both chunky and polished, carrying very dark-black-fruit flavors.
Name: Bushong 2016 Spanish Castle Magic Tempranillo (Monterey)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this 100% varietal, cocoa, bittersweet chocolate, vanilla and herb aromas lead to plentiful, well-balanced cherry and vanilla flavors. There's a lot to like.
Designation: Vineyard Series Art den Hoed Vineyard Painted Hills
Name: Maryhill 2015 Vineyard Series Art den Hoed Vineyard Painted Hills Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Sour aromas of black plum, cola and grape seed are dominated by a damp coffee-grind scent on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a tad funky and gritty with black-fruit flavors.
Name: Scaredy Cat Ranch 2015 Tempranillo (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied oaky wine shows strong aromas and flavors of oak sawdust and cedar over rather tart and tight blackberry notes.
Name: Renwood 2016 Tempranillo (Amador County)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This young Tempranillo is highly tannic, saturated in color and lacking fruit tones. A vanilla flavor is dominant on the palate, giving this an unbalanced nature.
Name: Foon 2016 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is a thin and sharp in profile. The tannins are quite abrasive, and the fruit tones are soft and muted.
Name: Foon 2013 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Silky smooth, highly integrated aromas of baked black fruits and fine cocoa are just the beginning of the road on this superb gran reserva with a funky label. Concentrated and fully charged on the palate, this deals rowdy but delicious plum and berry flavors backed by wood spice and cinnamon. A stout finish keeps up with the fruit. Drink or hold for years to come (through 2035).
Name: Casa Primicia 2012 Viña Diezmo GR Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, smooth blackberry and tobacco aromas are chocolaty and subtle. Full allotments of black fruits, tannins and acidity play well together, while this tastes of blackberry, black cherry and baking spice. To back it all up, a rock-solid finish with notes of lemony oak, vanilla and tobacco is on point. Drink through 2028.
Name: 12 Linajes 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Heady aromas of malted milk ball, ripe berry fruits and tobacco are warm and welcoming. Hailing from a warm year, this feels full but playful, with tannins that are only mildly scratchy. Flavors of vanilla, tobacco, butter, herb and dried berry fruit are textbook for Rioja gran reserva, while this takes a while to fully unfold on the finish. Drink through 2035.
Name: Hidalgo 2012 Gran Reserva Tradición H  (Rioja)

Description: A fine mix of dried red fruit, baking spice, tobacco and olive aromas ranks as classic Rioja. A dry, fairly full palate reflects the quality of the 2015 vintage, while flavors of spiced plum, cassis and tobacco avoid any tricks. A meaty, chewy palate confirms that this was made from excellent raw materials. Drink through 2023.
Name: Hidalgo 2015 Reserva Tradición H  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky oak tops a nose with root beer, chimney draft and heady berry aromas. A thick, creamy palate delivers the heft Ribera is known for, while this tastes of ripe blackberry, cassis, coconut, vanilla and mocha. A lush finish is packed to the brim, but while this is massively fruity and oaky, to call it elegant, sophisticated or refined would be stretching things.
Name: Arrocal 2014 Ángel  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Lightly charred and smoky aromas sit on top of earthy berry fruit, all touched up by lemony oak and minerality. A wiry palate is pulsing with acidity, while this tastes of blackberry and boysenberry along with vanilla and cured beef. A secure and steady finish features just enough brightness to suggest further aging. Drink through 2029.
Name: Casa Primicia 2014 Julian Madrid Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Attractive aromas of sandalwood, blackberry pastry and root beer signal a ripe wine from a notoriously cold vintage. A firm but impressive structure supports leathery berry, spice and tobacco flavors backed by a wall of oak. A finish with controlled heat tastes spicy and feels eminently dry. Drink through 2028.
Name: Viña Mayor 2013 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe, malty aromas of chocolate and maple blend with cherry and cassis scents to form a red carpet kind of nose. Flush, deep and solid on the palate, this lively gran reserva goes for fruit over classic Rioja nuances; expect spiced berry, currant and plum flavors accented by tobacco and chocolate. A muscular finish is the close. Drink through 2032.
Name: Casa Primicia 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: From 60-year-old Tinta Roriz vines, this wine is full of dense, dark fruits with rich tannins and the potential for smooth berry flavors. The grape, a k a Tempranillo, shows its aptitude for fine, richly structured wines and brings out its aging ability. Drink from 2020.
Name: Quinta da Pacheca 2015 Grande Reserva Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Description: Aromas of dried cherry, cola, cedary oak and tobacco are what you want from a fine Rioja, and this has all of that and more. On the palate, this reserva is fresh and full, with subtlety cut by racy acidity. Spicy flavors of leathery berry fruits are savory and deep, while this tastes lightly herbal and spicy on a steady finish. Say yum and drink at any point through 2023.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Clasico Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of cherry, berry, tomato sauce and vanilla are smoky and slightly tarry. A flush, full mouthfeel is lifted by core acidity, while flavors of blackened spice, tobacco, toast and cassis finish with classic Rioja notes of vanilla, mocha, toast and warmth. Drink this winner through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Elegant aromas of forest floor, fine oak, tobacco and spice notes grace core black fruit scents. A powerfully restrained palate is a touch creamy with oak, while this offers deep plum and berry flavors backed by a roasted, meaty finish where spice character is prominent. Drink through 2028.
Name: Casa Primicia 2014 Viña Diezmo RV Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Robust aromas of dark toast, cool mint, cola, blackberry and chocolate are riper than what most 2013 RDDs show. A round, expansive palate gets drier as rough tannins take grip. Roasted, savory flavors are solid, while this simmers with oaky tobacco notes on a long finish. The more time this has in the bottle, the better. Drink through 2028.
Name: Protos 2013 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of ripe berries and smoke meld with a hint of Band-Aid on the nose. The palate of this reserva is narrow, condensed and fairly hard. Typical regional flavors of mixed black fruits are at full ripeness, while this is muscular and concentrated on a finish that hints at syrup. Drink through 2027.
Name: Tionio 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Woodsy oak and olive aromas frame more standard cherry and berry scents. In the mouth, this is rubbery and scratchy due to hard tannins. Black plum and boysenberry flavors suggest coffee, while the finish on this is toasty and darker than what came before. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Landaluce 2014 Fincas de Landaluce Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Familiar Rioja aromas of creamy oak, wood smoke, leather and earthy berry fruits are encouraging and lead to a solid palate with forgiving intensity. Blackberry, cassis and vanilla aromas are lasting on a finish that's reaching maturity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Montecillo 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy berry and plum aromas come with patented Rioja side notes of vanilla and tobacco, while this reserva from a warm but top-notch vintage feels dry and slightly choppy. Roasted, gamy plum and berry flavors show some buttery oak, peppery notes and a leafy accent in front of a meaty finish touched up by lemony hints. Best from 2020–2024.
Name: CVNE 2015 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Despite the fact that 2014 was a problematic vintage in Ribera del Duero, this crianza is showing the right stuff. Earthy black fruit aromas push up against stewy, while this feels flush, with grabby tannins. Savory black plum and blackberry flavors are mildly oaky, while firm tannins frame finishing baked black fruit and oak spice flavors.
Name: Val Sotillo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy, nutty berry aromas are leathery and struggle to suggest purity. A saucy palate shows firm tannins, while this tastes of tobacco, earthy plum and mixed spices. A long, savory finish with dried fruit flavors is classic for Rioja.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Clásico Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Mature berry, cola and coffee aromas announce a gran reserva that just reaches that level of affordable excellence that everyone is looking for. The palate is a bit raw and bumpy, and the spiced plum flavors are familiar and touched up by buttery oak, but overall this delivers enough classic Rioja tobacco, vanilla and red fruit character to warrant spirited consumption.
Name: Campo Viejo 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are on the soft side, while this feels creamy and slightly raisiny, with grabby tannins. Oaky milk chocolate notes blend with herbal red plum and berry flavors in front of a grabby finish where a chocolate flavor rises to the fore.
Name: Siglo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Alluring spice and berry aromas along with notes of maple, winter-scented candle and vanilla make up a nice nose. While this is dry and scratchy in feel, on the plus side it's focused. Dark berry and cassis flavors yield to oak and wood prior to a toasty, spicy finish with chocolate notes.
Name: Valdubón 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A solid nose common to Rioja smells like earthy berry fruits, dried leaves and olives. A punchy palate with screechy acidity offers flavors of plum and currant touched up by oaky vanilla. More of the same along with a touch of prune carries the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Powerful but composed aromas of blackberry, tar and blackened spice are on the money. A grabby, pulling palate is pushed by hard, drying tannins, while this reserva from a warm vintage tastes of saucy berry fruit and oak prior to a finish that's plump and a touch flat. Drink through 2021.
Name: Larchago 2012 Reserva Familia Chavarri  (Rioja)

Description: Subtle berry and cassis aromas have earthy undertones. On the palate, this is wide and fleshy but not laser focused. Mild oak, chocolate and plum flavors finish with tomato, spice and light herbal notes.
Name: Bodegas Berceo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas border on raisiny and stewed, while background notes of graphite and smoke are barrel driven. This crianza from a marginal vintage feels resiny and a bit syrupy. Savory black fruit flavors come with vanilla and chocolate shadings, while this remains chocolaty on a steady finish.
Name: Resalte 2014 Lecco Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Cherry, vanilla and oak spice aromas come with a note of citrus. This crianza feels fresh and lively but not that deep or complex. Flavors of spiced plum, currant and red apple skin show a mildly desiccated note of prune on the finish. This is a textbook simple Rioja to enjoy at any time in any setting.
Name: Viña Bujanda 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Olive, raisin, cassis, clove and wood grain aromas constitute an interesting nose. A full palate with resiny oak and noticeable tannins sets up a flavor profile based mostly on clove, oak and berry fruit. While this remains oaky across the finish, there's enough dark fruit here to make this well worth a go. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Cosme Palacio Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Orderly berry and black currant aromas come with a hint of oak-based clove. A drawing palate is healthy albeit tight, while this Tempranillo tastes of earthy, roasted berry fruits and oak spice. Complexity pokes its head up on the finish via savory game, olive and meaty notes.
Name: Pagos de Valcerracin 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Plum and berry aromas come with accents of cowhide and leather. A slightly grating and choppy palate settles with airing, while this crianza tastes of baked plum and raspberry. Dry tannins make for a grabby finish.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Cola and blackberry aromas come with cheesy oak notes on a nose that seems awkward. An edgy palate with high acidity lacks the smoothness one might expect from a top gran reserva, while plum and raisin flavors are sappy prior to a raw and screechy-feeling palate.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2011 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: A full black fruit nose punches above its weight class, with depth of fruit and smokiness normally found in more expensive wines. A full, fleshy palate is held together by firm tannins, while this Tempranillo-led blend tastes of dark fruits, herbs and spices prior to a steady, lightly toasted finish.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2016 Codice Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Aromas of vanilla bean, coconut and ripe red apple are followed by soft-feeling fruit and barrel flavors, with caramel notes on the finish. The oak plays a prominent part in the show.
Name: Sawtooth 2016 Classic Fly Series Tempranillo

Description: A mixture of wet clay and baked plum aromas form the nose of this ready to drink crianza. Scratchy tannins and tight acidity give the palate verve, while this tastes mostly of saucy plum. A rubbing, tannic finish wraps it up.
Name: Marqués de Carrión 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A demonstrably oaky nose comes with aromas of maple, hickory, wood grain and berry fruits. Following the nose, this feels grabby, with severe wood-based tannins. Buttery berry and oak-based flavors could use another year or two to settle, while this feels grating and warm on the finish.
Name: Viña Olabarri 2016 Bikandi Crianza Ecological  (Rioja)

Description: A slightly murky and earthy nose requires airing to show its best. In the mouth, this crianza is full, chunky and obtuse, with raw tannins. Herbal berry flavors are slightly minty, while this is short and tastes of plum and berry fruit on the finish.
Name: Casa Primicia 2016 Viña Diezmo CR Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Wood spice and earthy aromas of forest floor and mint outweigh popping fruit on the nose of this fleshy, filled-out crianza. Spiced raspberry and dried plum aromas lead to a steady finish with crisp latent acidity that fosters length.
Name: Bodegas Lozano 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gamy berry aromas are earthy and smell like black olives in brine. A firm palate becomes drier and more raw with airing, making for spicy plum and rubbery flavors. Fruit is hard to find on a tough finish where the coolness of 2013 shows through.
Name: Carramimbre 2013 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Dried berry fruit, leather and oak spice aromas comprise a traditional Rioja nose. In the mouth, this is lean and choppy, with lemony acidity creating tightness. Snappy, saucy plum and savory oak flavors finish dry, with rubbing tannins.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Generic plum and cherry aromas come with a vanilla note, while this everyday crianza feels compact, with pressing acidity. Plum, tomato, vanilla and coconut flavors reflect an oaky Rioja that tastes a bit dried out on the finish.
Name: Valdelana 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A soft nose with rubber, vanilla and floral berry aromas sets up a wide, bulky palate that's satisfying but not exactly precise. Black plum, cassis, wood spice and mint flavors finish steady but with a grapy feel.
Name: Lealtanza 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Fully ripe black fruit aromas push up against raisiny on what seems like a late-harvest kind of nose. That same sensation carries to the palate, which feels ultraripe. Baked berry flavors are backed by dark chocolate notes, while this is steady but also slightly stewy on the finish.
Name: Matanegra 2013 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Oaky berry aromas are backed by milk chocolate and vanilla notes on a candied nose. A smacking palate centers on severely dry tannins, while this reserva tastes of saucy, savory plum and currant. A clipped, abrupt finish is apropos for this Rioja from a cold year.
Name: Marqués de Carrión 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: While this smells a touch tired, with a hint of oxidation to go with tobacco, raisin and damp aromas, sappy tomato-like acidity provides proof of life. Flavors of tomato, raspberry, currant and vanilla finish dry and saucy in an old-style Rioja way. Drink now.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Viña Alarde Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Leathery berry and raisin aromas are ever so slightly oxidized. This crianza feels zesty and lively, with plum and red berry flavors. A tight, racy finish is a bit raw but honest, and overall this is a nice Rioja if red fruit flavors and acidic snappiness hold appeal.
Name: Viña Otano 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Candied plum and berry aromas are friendly and inviting. A round, pulpy palate is in balance, while this Tempranillo tastes of plum and raspberry, with a distant hint of dark berry fruit.
Name: Dominio de Punctum 2017 Lobetia Organic Vineyards Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy notes of iron and brick dust blend with horsey, leathery berry notes in front of a smacking medium-bodied palate that's choppy and drawing. Flavors of salt and chicken fat are oak based, while this also offers basic berry fruit notes. On the finish, this is comfortable but doesn't offer much textural complexity, body or length.
Name: Nexus 2014  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Berry fruit, road tar and a touch of chocolate are the aromas that get this young Ribera Tempranillo going in a good direction. Slightly raw tannins roughen the palate, while this tastes of savory and saucy black plum. Notes of soy sauce and black-olive tapenade lend credibility to the finish.
Name: Valderiz 2016 Valdehermoso Joven  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Jumpy berry aromas suggest wet dog fur. While this is fresh in feel, it's also a bit clipped and thin on the palate. Cherry and plum flavors come with prune and raisin notes, while this hangs in there on a choppy finish with acidic snap.
Name: Eduardo Garrido García 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The color shows a bit of bricking. Char, dried tobacco and spice aromas are followed by somewhat lighter styled fruit, game and barrel flavors.
Name: Idilico 2015 Reserva Tempranillo (Yakima Valley)

Description: An abundance of raw-oak aromas gives this crianza a sense of saw mill and clove. High-acidity creates choppiness, but that's offset by lactic oaky notes. Tart plum and currant flavors are tomatoey and woody, with some vanilla softness. On the finish, this remains tomatoey and punchy.
Name: Burgo Viejo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Floral red berry aromas include notes of nutmeg and dried herb. A fleshy palate is anchored by hard, scratchy tannins, while spicy plum and currant flavors are dry and peppery, characteristics that carry over to the finish.
Name: Don Aurelio 2015 La Elegancia Crianza Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

Description: Palpable aromas of vanilla-rich oak result in aromas of pencil eraser, campfire and milk chocolate. In the mouth, this feels soupy and thick, with moderate acidity. Flavors of pasty vanilla, chocolate and berry syrup taste oaky and candied on the finish.
Name: Duquesa de la Victoria 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy oak aromas include notes of blackberry, mocha, fig and raisin. This Tempranillo feels saturated and dense, with tough tannins. Blackberry, cassis, chocolate and peppery spice flavors finish dark, toasty and long.
Name: Virgen de las Viñas 2015 Tomillar Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bacon and smoked berry aromas are gamy and rough. No two ways about it: This is fiery and centered on acidity. Wild berry flavors get overrun by dry woodiness, while hard tannins make this raw on the finish. This may require decades to soften up.
Name: De Bardos 2013 Mítica Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Basic aromas of currant, red plum and milk chocolate set up a tight, firm palate with red cherry and plum flavors. A smacking finish is fresh and taught, and overall this is a good everyday Tempranillo.
Name: Delia 2017 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Robust cherry aromas start out earthy and smoky but turn more raisiny the longer this sits. Cutting tartaric acidity is a bracing element that boosts wild berry, spice and chocolate flavors. A rough finish elicits no suggestion of elegance.
Name: Bodegas Soledad 2015 Solmayor Crianza Tempranillo (Uclés)

Description: A light nose with pale berry aromas barely registers as ripe. In the mouth, this crianza is dry and just makes the weight for medium-bodied. Leafy, slightly bitter plum flavors finish dry, shallow and slightly green.
Name: Viña Palaciega 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Scalped raspberry and plum aromas are limited. This feels round but awkward, while candied plum flavors lead to a rubbery-feeling finish with the same flavors that came before.
Name: San Antonio Abad 2017 Delicioso Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Candied red fruit aromas are youthful and punchy. A light-to-medium palate is basic in composition, while this Tempranillo tastes of plum, raspberry, tomato and peppery spice. A juicy but simple finish brings this to a close.
Name: Trencalòs 2017 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Simple, spunky aromas of cherry and raspberry candy are not that serious. This Tempranillo feels full and jumpy, but with little focus. Like the nose, this tastes of cherry candy, while the finish disappears in no time.
Name: Bodegas Soledad 2017 Solmayor Tempranillo (Uclés)

Description: Berry aromas are fortified by smoke, char and tobacco scents that don't seem fully natural. There's flesh to the palate, but also tannins that are hard as nails. Herbal black fruit flavors come with a vanilla note, while a brambly finish tastes and feels slightly raisiny.
Name: Viña Fuerte 2015 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Light in color, with aromas of tire rubber, black olive, seaweed, hay and wet oak leading to lighter-styled fruit flavors with a grip of tannins. There are some interesting things to be found, but it doesn't all come together.
Name: Bitner 2015 Estate Tempranillo

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of olive and rubber share the nose with leathery berry scents. A meaty, fleshy palate is cut by sharp acidity, while this tastes of lightweight plum, berry and ginger. Lastly, a briny note seeps onto a grabby finish.
Name: Alvides 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Punchy, herbal red fruit aromas come with vanilla and clove notes as well as some greenness. A scratchy-feeling palate sees a dominant woody clove flavor snuff out this Tempranillo's fruit character, while a spicy finish remains woody and noticeably green.
Name: La Candelaria 2014 Senda 66 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Cherry and red currant aromas are compact, with notes of wet earth and damp animal fur. A reduced palate is drawing, while this shows narrow black fruit and peppery flavors in front of a sappy finish that hollows out little by little.
Name: Vicente Gandia 2015 Finca Del Mar Crianza Tempranillo (Valencia)

Description: A nose heavy with aromas of compost and mulched leaves offers only minimal fruit. On the palate, this is decidedly raw and angular. Zesty but sharp currant and cranberry flavors finish scratchy and lightly abrasive.
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2015 Rivallana Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Candied red fruit aromas are rudimentary while suggesting sugar beets. A fleshy, widespread palate delivers herbal plum flavors, while this is short on the finish.
Name: Navas 1212 2016 Joven  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Jumbled aromas of gummy red fruits and green herbs set up a chunky but flat palate. Soft, inexact red fruit flavors are wan, while this tastes herbal on a jammy finish.
Name: Camina 2017 Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Aromas of compost, stale peanut and berry fruit carry the nose. In the mouth, this is raw and grabby, with tomato-like acidity. Green, earthy flavors of tomato and herbs are low on fruit and finish with a note of compost.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Federico Paternina Banda Azul Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked berry and clove aromas are disjointed on the nose. A heavily oaked palate is gummy in feel, while this tastes mostly of wood and clove.
Name: Viña Arnáiz 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Lean raspberry and orange peel aromas are low on fruit, while this feels pasty, sticky and grabby. Resiny oak creates vanilla-like lead flavors, with jammy berry fruit lurking in the background. A grabby-feeling, green finish tastes tart and feels scratchy.
Name: Delia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Gaseous aromas of mulchy berry fruit, iodine, rubber and sulfur get this Tempranillo going in the wrong direction. Green, gummy flavors match the nose, while on the finish this is herbal tasting and medicinal, with weedy notes.
Name: Enate 2017 Tempranillo (Somontano)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Even in a difficult vintage like 2014, this single-vineyard Ribera is strapping and impressive. Dark, smoky aromas of fine oak, wood spice and burnt toast are paramount to the wine's secondary fruit scents. A full, wide palate with strong tannins is home to blackberry, cassis, fig, chocolate and toasty flavors. On the finish, barrel char and lemony notes allow this to go the distance. Best from 2022–2038.
Name: Emilio Moro 2014 Malleolus de Valderramio  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bold black fruit aromas combined with scents of leather, herbs, oregano and wild desert brush make for a complex and intriguing nose. A bold, punchy palate is deep and intense, with flavors of blackberry, cassis, dark chocolate and coffee. A high-energy finish with rock-solid tannins ensures that this will last a long time; drink from 2020–2035.
Name: Emina 2014 Atio  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's something addictive about the smoky notes on this wine, starting with a nose that's full of roasted beef, hickory-smoked meat and toasted peppercorn aromas. The palate combines black cherry, vanilla and nutmeg with rich coffee and smoked pork flavors.
Name: Longoria 2016 Tempranillo (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Malty, earthy berry aromas settle quickly and are elevated by a hint of fine tobacco. A full, round and layered palate gets a boost from lemony oak and acidity, while this tastes of black fruit, chocolate, tobacco, coffee and spice, all of which are classic Rioja gran reserva flavors. On the finish, toasty oak lingers along with chocolaty berry notes; best from 2020–2030.
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2012 Óscar Tobía Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Blackberry, prune, raisin, leather and tar aromas are full and masculine, but refined. On the palate, this is tight and finely focused. Flavors of blackberry, vanilla and coffee finish steady, with calm, complex notes of tobacco and marzipan rising to the fore of a steady finish. Drink this excellent gran reserva through 2030.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2011 Monte Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Initial oaky aromas dissipate and settle on road tar blackness. A lush, fleshy palate is braced with acidity, while this gran reserva tastes of plum, cassis, tobacco and brown sugar. Fresh acidity creates length on a finish with mocha, chocolate and spice flavors. This needs more time to show its best; drink through 2028.
Designation: Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2012 Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark, toasty berry and cassis aromas come with interesting and exotic notes of licorice root and baking spices. A full-force palate is tannic and strapping, with little to no cushion. Blackberry, cassis and well-tuned oak flavors finish tannic and with mocha and coffee notes. Drink this tight, drawing Tinto Fino through 2032.
Name: Cepa 21 2014 Horcajo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe, raisiny aromas include notes of maple and vanilla but nothing stale or murky, which is a good sign. A wide, dense palate matches the nose, while this tastes of ripe berry, cassis and fig along with spice and chocolate. Dry tannins and a hint of desiccation define the finish on this tasty Rioja reserva that will be at its best now through 2021.
Name: Altos De Rioja 2014 Altos R Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Root beer, sandalwood, cassis, berry and tobacco aromas are rich and heady. While this Rioja from a warm vintage is deep and intense, it's lifted by lemony acidity and a bold oak character. Brandied cherry flavors are spicy and helped along by creamy vanilla and chocolate notes, while an easygoing finish suggests near-term drinking through 2020.
Name: Maetierra Dominum 2012 QP  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smooth, heady aromas of blackberry, cassis, tobacco, marzipan and vanilla are clicking on all cylinders while leading to a dense, saturated palate that only gets more dense and hard with airing. Blackberry, black cherry, coffee, mocha and caramel flavors conclude with notes of marshmallow and chocolate on a tannic finish with sharp teeth. Drink through 2025.
Name: Señorío de Sotillo 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Welcoming berry and cassis aromas are ripe and smooth, with integrated oak. On the palate, this crianza is honest and not overly demanding yet well structured. Blackberry, coffee and mocha flavors are in command through the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Emina 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Prune and dried blackberry aromas start off this wine. The saturated, meaty palate brings blackberry and black plum flavors that move to a dried-fruit finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Legaris 2014 Páramos de Legaris  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Dry berry, rose petal and leafy notes get this gran reserva going. In this youthful state, pulling acidity is making this raw on the palate. Currant, red plum and cranberry flavors loosen up on a steady finish. This is not a classic Rioja gran reserva; it's fresher and less complex than the classic recipe calls for; drink through 2022.
Name: Sonsierra 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This is a fully oaked gran reserva with gritty aromas of lemony wood resin, milk chocolate and tarry grit. A wide palate is more big than precise, while this tastes of gamy berry, oak spice and cardamom. A minty but light oak character on the finish suggests tobacco and complexity. Best from 2022 on.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2011 Cerro Añon Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of rubber, pencil eraser, vanilla, wild berry and desert brush are true to Rioja. This gran reserva feels lush and packed, but the acidity seems a bit tartaric. Cassis, blackberry and chocolate flavors don't do much on a full but chunky finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2011 Óscar Tobía Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Olive, forest floor and damp earth notes mix with berry and cassis aromas on the nose. It shows powerful tannins on the palate, with ripe black fruit flavors that reflect the warm vintage. Drink through 2024.
Name: Legaris 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Soft, ripe aromas of cassis, raisin and buttery oak are easygoing and not too demanding. An elastic feel is derived from rubbery tannins, while this tastes of saucy plum and berry fruits as well as savory oak. The finish on this gran reserva delivers more of the same flavors, with notes of herbs and spice. Drink through 2025.
Name: Lealtanza 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Berry, cherry, chocolate and brown sugar aromas give way to toast and vanilla as this airs out. A powerful palate is fueled by wiry acidity, while an oak-driven flavor profile features vanilla, coconut, toast and plum. On the finish, this thins out then turns overtly woody. Drink through 2025.
Name: Valdelacierva 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Much improved over the previous vintage, the pretty red berry fruit is framed by light toast, from aging in a small amount of once-used oak. The finish is focused, and the light touch of leather is unobtrusive.
Name: Jaxon 2016 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Ripe, chocolaty berry and olive aromas are classic for Rioja reserva. A fully saturated palate is oaky but braced by bold acidity, thus ripe flavors of plum, currant and chocolate seem fresh. Covila usually produces highly drinkable, steady wines; this fills the bill. Enjoy through 2021.
Name: Covila 2014 II Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Modest but classy raspberry, plum and oak spice aromas get this gran reserva going in the right direction. A full-bodied palate reveals edgy tannins, while this tastes lightly toasted and blackened, with plum and berry fruit at the foundation of a long, steady finish. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Montecillo 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A standout among Lexème's 2016s, this young wine is still pulling itself together. Aromas of vanilla and Bourbon highlight its 16 months in French oak. The tart, pinpoint berry fruit is framed in dark chocolate. Give it until 2020 and then drink over the next half decade.
Name: Lexème 2016 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, earthy aromas of raisin and baking spices meet a tar note on the nose. Rubbery tannins are ramped up on the palate, while this crianza from a warm, dry vintage delivers flavors of mocha, char and wood grain that linger through the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Protos 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are oaky and smoky, but not overly so. This feels fleshy and grapy, with a pulpy overall mouthfeel. Smoky, blackened berry flavors are chocolaty, while this is toasty and dark on the finish. For the most part, this reserva seems authentic for Rioja and ready to drink.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Añares Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Jammy berry aromas come with hints of chocolate cake and mint. A full, dense palate rates as chunky and warming, while this Rioja tastes of blackberry and dark plum. A chewy, solid finish has integrity and properly reflects a warm, dry year. Drink through 2021.
Name: Larchago 2015 Crianza Edición Fábulas  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Olive, berry and prune aromas sit in front of a hard-charging palate with slightly raisiny fruit and a lightly stewed character. Toast, chocolate and coffee flavors on the palate and finish reflect a good amount of oak.
Name: Alidis 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky blackberry aromas break down with airing and turn earthier and more gritty. A bullish palate with drawing, abrasive tannins sets up blackberry, cassis and olive flavors, then an unruly finish tastes of savory berry fruits and chocolate.
Name: Pagos de Valcerracin 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A plush, jammy nose contains berry fruit and exotic spice aromas, all backed by violet and licorice hints. A full palate is fruity and balanced, while this tastes of baked plum and meaty berry fruits. A steady finish doesn't change much, meaning this is full and chunky on the back side.
Name: Bodegas Leza García 2015 Tinto Familia Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are slightly leafy and not without a touch of complexity. A full palate with ripe tannins registers as being right, while ripe plum and cassis flavors maintain brightness on a finish with sappy acidity.
Name: Viña Eguía 2015  Rioja

Description: Grapy plum and berry aromas are dense and pulpy but entirely pleasant. In the mouth, this is a touch choppy and hard, with rubbery tannins. Beefy berry and savory plum flavors finish with vanilla and coffee notes along with sturdy tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Luis Saenz 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Chunky black fruit aromas are inviting and under control. In the mouth, this crianza from a warm, dry vintage feels thick and saturated, with jammy weight. Roasted berry and plum flavors finish big, sappy and a touch jagged due to rugged tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Altos De Rioja 2015 Altos R Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Dry, spicy aromas of plum, brick dust and earth are lean but sound. On the palate, this Rioja is plenty satisfying, with smooth tannins. Plum and wild berry flavors finish tight, tannic and peppery, with moderate oak in support.
Name: Campo Viejo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Raisiny berry aromas are jumpy and foxy as well. In the mouth, this feels dry like desiccated fruits. Black plum, oak and vanilla flavors finish flush and full but also tough and intense. Five years after harvest and this is no easy ride.
Name: Finca Albret 2013 Reserva Red (Navarra)

Description: Dark berry aromas are slightly complex and minerally, with a hint of hot stones. This Toro feels big and fleshy, but also slightly choppy. Blackberry, plum and chocolate flavors slowly drift away on a steady, direct finish.
Name: Rejadorada 2016 Roble  (Toro)

Description: Earthy aromas of raisin and baked berry fruits lead to a medium-bodied palate that's more spongy and absorbing than hard. A mix of leafy berry, brown sugar, salt and herbal flavors finishes short and basic, with a touch of root beer and licorice to ponder.
Name: Hacienda Urbión 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Generic berry and plum aromas are clean and standard for everyday Rioja. A medium-bodied palate with modest but notable tannins shows bright plum and red berry flavors in front of a finish that darkens up and is legitimately toasty.
Name: Larchago 2017  Rioja

Description: A black color and dense aromas of blackberry, clove and oak spice lead to a fully saturated palate with rubbing tannins and modest acidity. Heavily spiced and toasted blackberry, cocoa and vanilla flavors are oak-aided, while this settles in bumpy fashion on a tough, tannic finish.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Generación MC  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Generic berry and plum aromas are straightforward and clean. A tight-as-nails palate shows merciless tannins and severe clamp, while pinched red fruit flavors offer a hint of olive. Tannic rawness remains on a clampy finish.
Name: Marqués de Valparaíso 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A round nose is slightly raisiny and ripe, with vanilla and a woodsy note of hand soap. A fairly full palate isn't short on acidity or tannins. Chocolaty oak accents plum and wild raspberry flavors, while this is jacked up on a powerful but untamed finish.
Name: Castroviejo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A lightly maderized color and aromas of earthy berry, raisin and prune indicate moderate overripeness. That assumption is confirmed on a plump, chunky palate with rubbery tannins. Ripe berry and raisin flavors finish with the slightest hint of early onset oxidation; drink now.
Name: Cuna de Reyes 2014 Crianza Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)

Description: Rubbery, slightly blackened aromas of berry fruits, beef stew and olive lead to a wide, fleshy palate with solid tannins. Black plum, vanilla and prune flavors are derived from a warm, dry vintage, while this crianza deals a mild chocolaty note on a round finish.
Name: Montecillo 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Charming aromas of plum, blue fruit, herb and spice are followed by ripe, full-bodied blue and black fruit flavors that thin out a bit in the middle. The tannins give a firm squeeze. It comes off as light at times.
Name: Longship 2016 Invader Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Snappy red berry aromas come with notes of tomato, mint and dry spice. A round palate with moderate depth and dry tannins lacks stuffing, while this tastes of herbal red plum, currant, oak spice and tomato prior to a finish that's fresh but raw and grating.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2014 RB Rioja Bordón Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A charred, chocolaty nose is doused with oak and related coffee and mocha aromas. On the palate, this is resiny and sappy in feel, with excess weight. Wood and more wood flavor has seeped into core berry fruit, while this feels dry and tannic on the finish, with a marshmallow flavor.
Name: Alidis 2012 Expresión Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are a touch soapy and candied. A fresh, racy palate is high in acidity but modest in terms of stuffing and weight. Plum and berry flavors are light and simple but fattened up by a note of buttery oak prior to an honest finish.
Name: Bodegas Berceo 2016 Más de Berceo Tempranillo (Navarra)

Description: Aromas of root beer, earthy plum and minty herbs lead to a saturated palate with tight tannins. Oak and spice flavors share the palate with red plum, currant and savory notes. On the finish, this is full and tannic.
Name: Bodegas Lozano 2015 Montes De Leza Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Classic Rioja aromas of lemony oak, vanilla and red fruit feed into a lean, fresh palate without much depth. Dry, spicy notes of mild oak blend into core tomato, red plum and currant flavors, while this crianza finishes with barrel spice and clove accents along with lingering cranberry and currant flavors.
Name: Finca Valpiedra 2014 Cantos de Valpiedra  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Slightly volatile berry and plum aromas settle without too much salad dressing character. A dense, jammy palate is on the fat side, while this tastes of black fruits, chocolate and herbs prior to a grating finish with some heat.
Name: Alidis 2017 Tinto 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Generic red-fruit aromas are basic but clean. A chewy, plump palate is solid and not too heavy, which helps standard plum and berry flavors. While this joven-style Toro is far from concentrated and intense, the finish is slightly grapy, chunky and jammy.
Name: Rejadorada 2016 Reja  (Toro)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dry, punchy currant and cherry aromas are snappy and fresh. In the mouth, this everyday Tempranillo feels smacking and fit, with high acidity. Short but fresh plum and berry flavors stay bright and lively across an otherwise vacuous finish.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2017 Viña Temprana Old Vines Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)

Description: Plum, cherry and berry aromas are standard but clean and fresh. Following the nose, this everyday Tempranillo from the Valdelana family feels spunky and bouncy, with rubbery tannins. Generic plum and berry flavors finish snappy and bright.
Name: Duquesa de la Victoria 2017  Rioja

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisiny aromas are earthy but lack freshness, clarity and purity. A gritty, grinding palate is tannic and rough, while this warm-vintage reserva tastes of mint, prune and gamy berry fruits. On the back end, a minty green flavor infiltrates a hard-pounding, severely tannic finish.
Name: Alidis 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Skinned plum and cherry aromas are narrow and slightly toasty. A tannic palate is grabby and lacking in finesse, while this tastes of dark plum and cherry. On the finish, this is rough, rugged and grabby, with jagged residual tannins.
Name: Campellares 2016  Rioja

Description: Leafy, earthy plum and berry aromas don't suggest much ripeness. On the palate, this is fresh but wiry, with zesty red fruit acidity offset by mild creamy oak. Short berry flavors finish with tangy latent acidity and notes of tomato and herb.
Name: El Coto 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked, raisiny berry aromas come with a mild green tobacco note. An edgy, chunky palate shows hard but bracing tannins, while this drought-year Tempranillo has raisiny overtones atop berry and oak flavors. Woody campfire flavors drive a gritty finish with a kiss of oaky clove.
Name: Marqués de Valparaíso 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: After cheesy barnyard aromas blow off, this simple Toro offers up baked, lightly medicinal flavors of berry fruits and raspberry. A short, lightly herbal finish tastes minty and shows gummy tannins.
Name: Pagos del Rey 2016 Sentero  (Toro)

Description: Cherry, plum and coconut aromas along with a hint of vinegar make up the nose on this fresh but edgy Tempranillo. Flavors of red plum, olive and vinaigrette finish dry and woody in a highly basic but competent way.
Name: Luis Saenz 2017  Rioja

Description: Clean cherry and plum aromas are just stout enough to draw you in. A lean palate without much body or weight holds salty plum and currant flavors, while a steady finish with juicy acidity confirms this Tempranillo's everyday status.
Name: Tempranillo Road 2017 Tempranillo (Navarra)

Description: Jumpy, prickly cherry and plum aromas are lean and spicy. The palate on this Tempranillo follows suit: It's tight, juicy and high in acidity. Flavors of red plum and currant taste of oaky clove, while a forced woody clove flavor persists on a bright, tight finish.
Name: Agronavarra 2017 Ventana Roble Tempranillo (Navarra)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oak is the dominant character on this Tempranillo, and it smells mostly of clove and leathery berry fruits. A smacking and bumpy palate is quite tannic and rough, while this tastes of oak grain, clove and tart plum. A tough finish is minty and slightly green.
Name: Balbas 2017 Ardal Tradición  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Mild aromas of clove and cinnamon blend with red fruit scents. A snappy, tight palate is lean and crisp, while spicy cherry and raspberry flavors are dry and display no secondary levels of depth or complexity.
Name: Bodegas Lacort 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Uncomplicated cherry and raspberry aromas come with a latex note. A crisp, dry, tight palate doesn't have much weight or body behind it, while this tastes of spice, green tea, mild oak and simple red fruits.
Name: Carlos Serres 2017 Old Vines  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery, cheesy berry aromas are earthy and come with a touch of spice. High acidity makes for a tight, drawing palate, while this tastes of tangy plum and currant prior to its scratchy finish.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2016 Protocolo Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Rubbery black cherry and olive aromas are gritty and not that ripe. Similarly, the palate on this Tempranillo is hard, narrow and tannic. Short red plum and berry flavors shrink up on a finish with the texture of apple skins.
Name: Ochoa 2013 Crianza Tempranillo (Navarra)

Description: Stemmy, musky aromas of clove and men's cologne announce a big and overwrought palate that could use more lift and elegance. Toasty, peppery berry flavors transition to tomatoey and herbal prior to a finish that simmers with toasty oak but not much fruit.
Name: Antaño 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Mulchy, earthy berry aromas are leafy and not that ripe. On the palate, this is tight and high in acidity, while gritty, savory plum flavors are herbal on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Rivallana  (Rioja)

Description: Rubbery aromas suggest tree bark, plum fruit and hand soap. A lean and crisp palate plays up tartaric acidity, while shearing cherry and raspberry flavors take a while to dissipate on a linear but raw finish.
Name: Raiza 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of road tar and black licorice burn and simmer in front of a sticky palate. Burnt oak along with dark chocolate flavors are pressed onto berry fruit, while this is dry on the finish. Valdelana is the maker of this label.
Name: Duquesa de la Victoria 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Funky, foxy aromas of iodine and leathery berry fruits lead to a raw, choppy and tannic palate, while minty plum and currant flavors finish with a reprise of desertlike dryness and grating tannins.
Name: Emilio Moro 2017 Finca Resalso  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Grapy, reduced aromas suggest apple skins. This off-vintage Rioja feels sappy and displays ringing acidity and a textural sensation of grape skins. Shocked plum and berry flavors are high toned and quick on a skinned finish.
Name: Licenciado 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Cherry, tea and cookie aromas are O.K. but not elevated or suggestive of anything beyond what's basic. A lean palate with high acidity and pulling tannins offers light raspberry flavors prior to a mildly abrasive finish.
Name: Antaño 2017 Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Description: Damp, rubbery berry aromas suggest compost. This basic Tempranillo feels grabby but also flabby. Jammy berry flavors are nondescript, while the finish on this standard wine is lazy, slightly tannic and stewy.
Name: Tres Buhis 2016 Tempranillo (Yecla)

Description: Right off the bat you can tell that this is all about the oak. Aromas of coconut and lactic berry fruits smell of wood grain. A resiny palate is sticky, while flavors of raw oak, wood spice, clove and distant plum fruit are what they are.
Name: Viore 2016 5 Meses en Barrica  (Toro)

Description: Berry and cinnamon aromas lack clarity and focus. A tight, juicy palate is drawing and mildly astringent. Sappy black plum and raspberry flavors dry up quickly on the finish.
Name: Antaño 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Slightly soupy plum and berry aromas open this generic red blend. A fleshy, tannic palate is mildly abrasive, while blueberry, cassis and herbal flavors are a touch green before hinting at chocolate and plum on a grabby finish.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2016 Protocolo Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of cherry and plum are medicinal in nature on the nose. This feels choppy and tannic, with an excess of skins-based extract. Gamy, foxy berry and oak flavors are bone dry on a scratchy finish.
Name: 12 Linajes 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Furry, mossy plum and berry aromas are jumbled and suggest iodine. A thin, pinched palate shows vinegar-like acidity along with light, leafy flavors of currant and tomato.
Name: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Toro)

Description: Leafy, mulchy aromas are damp, while this struggling reserva is hard and rubbery in feel. Tomato and burnt savory notes finish saucy and a touch green.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Clasico Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Rubbery, reduced aromas of road tar, cardamom and black fruits are about as far from elegant as things get. A bulky, tannic palate matches this Tempranillo's black color, while soupy flavors of black plum, oak resin and bitterness culminate on a finish that tastes burnt and feels scratchy.
Name: Castillo de Monjardin 2017 Clásico Tempranillo (Navarra)

Description: Animal fur and grapy berry scents carry the nose. In the mouth, this feels fleshy and rubbing. Light, leafy berry flavors struggle to hold interest on an unstructured finish.
Name: Cuna de Reyes 2015  Rioja

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisiny aromas include a note of fig, and overall this struggles mightily to show any elegance up front. On the palate, this is poorly balanced: The acidity is tartaric and citric, while there's no body to support that much acidity. Raisin and citrus peel flavors don't mesh well on the finish.
Name: Alvides 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Spicy plum, berry and dry herb aromas are accented by cheesy oak and a hint of barnyard. On the palate, this worthy Tempranillo is plump, juicy and balanced. Lightly baked spicy plum and berry flavors are uncomplicated, while this tastes meaty and savory on a dry and focused finish.
Name: Zuccardi 2016 Q Tempranillo (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black plum, leather, tobacco and a hint of jasmine show on the nose of this bottling of a still rather uncommon grape for the region. There is also a jasmine touch to the palate, where intriguing purple-flower flavors meet with ripe blueberries and licorice spice.
Name: Seven Angels 2015 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Earthy, slightly stalky berry aromas include a note of ground leaves. This Tempranillo is full and flush, with typical Mendoza size. Blackberry, plum, olive and brown-sugar flavors finish with all the weight this tasty honest red can handle.
Name: Bodega Calle 2015 El Olvidado Reserva Tempranillo (Mendoza)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a tight stiff wine, with scents and streaks of licorice, rubber and espresso. It was aged in one-quarter new oak for two years, which seems to have further roughed up the tannins. It's astringent and dark, and not built for aging.
Name: Maragas 2015 Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tempranillo is a strength in this region, but this rustic tannic woody wine does not reflect that. Suggestions of black-cherry fruit are buried in woody flavors of charred burnt coffee, leading into a short bitter finish.
Name: Schmidt 2015 Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

Description: The award for the funkiest Tempranillo this side of Spain goes to this herbaceous number with the heavy pine, juniper and feline aromas. On the palate, this is heavy and soupy, while the flavor profile is green and sharp, with briny pickled notes throughout.
Name: Altocedro 2017 Año Cero Tempranillo (La Consulta)

Description: This is a fabulous gran reserva from a very good but lightly heralded vintage. Aromas of spiced plum, black olive, fig, tobacco and cassis come together like a puzzle. A deep, pure palate shows near-perfect balance, while this tastes of plum, berry fruits and earthy spice. Smooth, elegant and chocolaty on the finish, this delivers all one can ask for from Rioja. Drink through 2035.
Name: CVNE 2011 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe blackberry aromas are a touch malty and baked, with earthy depth and a topping of smoky oak. A sinewy palate is both creamy and braced by firm acidity. Well-oaked raspberry and plum flavors finish with notes of cocoa and vanilla. Drink this fine gran reserva from 2020 to 2035.
Name: Contino 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Heady aromas of raisin and tobacco come with cedary oak to form a classic Rioja gran reserva nose. A bold but balanced palate blends fresh acidity with deep fruit and integrated tannins. Plum, currant and white pepper flavors finish with chocolaty oak and a kiss of elegance. Drink through 2032.
Name: El Coto 2011 Coto de Imaz Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Prune, raisin and PX Sherry aromas are warm and heady, and while they might suggest overripeness, there isn't much (if any) on a palate that is cut by tomato-like acidity. Savory plum and berry flavors are more earthy than desiccated, while this is fully alive on the finish, with rubbing tannins. Drink through 2030.
Designation: Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2011 Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition  (Rioja)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dark and brooding wine has everything in spades. The color is reddish-black, the aromas are full of new leather, oak dust and black cherry, while the flavors are ripe, generous black cherry, blueberry and dark chocolate. The 40% new American barrels adds spicinesss. There is no lack of the grape variety's famous tannins, but they are fine grained and contribute to a velvety saturated mouthfeel.
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Tempranillo (Amador County)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Pure, lush aromas of ripe blackberry swaddled in chocolaty oak are what Ribera wines of quality are known for. This is weighty and dense on the palate. Heavily toasted and blackened berry flavors finish chocolaty, with firm tannins. Hold through 2034.
Name: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2014 Clave de Tábula  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Max ripe aromas of prune and raisin are baked and sweet. On the palate, this is huge and rugged, with massive tannins. Chocolate, raisin and cassis flavors are similar on a finish that adds fig and coffee to the picture. While this may be a touch overripe, it will stay drinkable up to about 2030.
Name: Matarromera 2014 Prestigio  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Despite 2013 being a tough year for reds throughout northern Spain, this is a good effort within the Numanthia framework. Compact dark fruit aromas hint at prune and chocolate. A raw palate with hard tannins and lemony acidity reflects the vintage, while flavors of black plum, currant, vanilla and maple land on buttery oak on a rough, hard finish. Best from 2021 to 2028.
Name: Numanthia 2013 Numanthia  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cepa 21's top wine smells of savory oak, bacon fat, hickory wood and Bourbon barrel, meaning it's oaky. A fully packed palate is intense, with rough, drying tannins suggestive of sandpaper. Char and smoke flavors are at the top level, barely allowing for berry fruit to poke through. No surprise that coffee and toast flavors dominate the finish. Drink through 2030.
Name: Cepa 21 2014 Malabrigo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of olive, root beer, rubber and spicy berry fruit are a bit closed, damp and earthy. A solid palate with good acidity hosts flavors of spiced plum, currant, vanilla and raw oak. On the finish, plum and fresh herb flavors drift off under the guidance of subtle oak. Drink now through 2025.
Name: CVNE 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Coarse aromas of tree bark and tobacco are smoothed out by vanilla and dried cherry and plum notes. This is structured and firm on the palate, with fairly hard edges. Chocolaty oak flavors lead secondary spiced berry and tobacco notes, while this tastes oaky in a familiar Rioja way on the finish. Drink through 2028.
Name: Valserrano 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Exotic aromas of blueberry along with Middle Eastern spice notes set this apart from the Ribera del Duero pack. A wide, pulpy palate is smacking, while short, oaky flavors of stewed plum and beef bouillon are meaty and again, different than most wines from the area. Finally, a finish with oxidized notes suggests that you drink this sooner rather than later.
Name: Vega Sicilia 2013 Valbuena 5°  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, earthy berry aromas are oaky, a touch gritty and suggestive of asphalt. On the palate, this asserts a firm grip. Ripe but true flavors of blackberry and dark plum are comported on the finish. Drink this fine but uncomplicated crianza through 2021.
Name: Matanegra 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A compelling mix of berry, oak, mocha and earthy aromas is true to Ribera del Duero and moderately complex. A tight, tannic palate delivers blackberry and smoked meat flavors prior to a fleshy, meaty tasting finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Valderiz 2014 Valdehermoso Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and thick-textured wine wraps spicy smoky beefy flavors around a good core of blackberries and black cherries. The spicy oak character dominates but it's attractive and adds to the wine's boldness.
Name: Odisea 2015 Lewis Vineyard The Temp Tempranillo (Clements Hills)

Description: Ripe and easygoing aromas of plum and berry fruits include a distant note of clove. This is juicy but also plump and balanced. Berry, plum and mild oak flavors are standard but appealing, while this is fresh, lightly oaky, spicy and correct on the finish.
Name: Valdelacierva 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine looks deep and dark, smells like black fruits and tastes concentrated, ripe and nicely dry. It has firm tannins and good acidity to boost the texture and enough depth in the fruit flavors to last on the finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Signature Tempranillo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is exotic and extroverted thanks to the aroma of wood char and singed rosemary, the bold black-fruit, the roasted coffee and the cocoa nib flavors. It's not overly full in body, and has good acidity and firm tannins for structure, which helps power the bold flavors on the palate and finish.
Name: Shannon 2015 Home Ranch Reserve Tempranillo (Lake County)

Description: There's a chemical note to the nose of this oaky-smelling Rioja. A thick palate is chewy and tannic, while this tastes of clove, licorice gumdrop and baked berry fruit. Oaky clove is the dominant flavor on a dense but standard finish.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Reserva Unica  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Initial ripe, baked black fruit aromas transition to raisiny. A heavy, smacking palate steps with heavy feet, while this tastes of roasted black plum and stewed berry fruits. A chewy, dense, saturated finish is par for the course.
Name: Energo 2014  Ribera del Duero

Description: This reserva from a not-so-good vintage smells floral, much like red roses. A pulpy palate is fleshy and short on focus, while this tastes of candied plum, raisin and cherry tomato. A slightly metallic flavor is up front on the finish.
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2014 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Meaty black fruit aromas are endearing but simple. In the mouth, this plays up the fresher, crisper side of Rioja. Plum and spice notes make for a snappy flavor profile, while this retains its crispness on a fresh finish.
Name: Casa Primicia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Rubbery berry aromas are scattered, with notes of floral soap, bacon and oak. A fresh but choppy palate holds flavors of plum and oak spice. Those same flavors carry onto a dry, tight finish that's more lean than lush.
Name: Valserrano 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Rubbery berry aromas are earthy and on the lean side. In the mouth, this crianza is firm, with almost no give. Cherry flavors show a hint of raisiny overripeness, while this is solid on a basic finish.
Name: Carlos Serres 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Candied berry and raisin aromas are just fresh and focused enough. A jammy, tannic palate is rather flat, while this tastes of pasty, oaky red berry fruits. A touch of heat and medicinality are noted on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is heavy-handed with the oak, showing bold wood char and smoke aromas followed by smoky, black-peppery flavors that dominate the blackberry and cherry notes underneath. Firm tannins give a good tight mouthfeel.
Name: Lewis Grace 2014 Estate Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Description: Berry and plum aromas show some barnyard amid overall ripeness. This feels bulky and grating, with rubbing tannins. Chunky berry flavors are more basic and undefined than specific, while this crianza is punchy and a bit rough on the finish.
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Welcoming berry aromas are fresh and include notes of cinnamon and baking spices. On the palate, this is rubbing due to grating tannins. Flavors of leathery plum, raspberry and oak finish with notable wood spice and friction.
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This medium-bodied wine smells mellow and mature, tastes leathery and spicy and has a smooth lightly textured mouthfeel. It will be good for everyday occasions. Best to drink it soon.
Name: Riaza 2014 Outsider 2.0 Tempranillo (California)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: With a closed-in aroma and being almost monolithic on the palate, this wine is full-bodied, moderately tannic and subtle in flavor. Touches of wood char and black pepper in the aroma meet mild blackberry on the palate.
Name: Sweet Heart 2015 Tempranillo (Yolo County)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A jammy, reduced nose is dominated by cooked berry aromas. The dense palate tastes largely of wood grain and stewed berry fruit. A minty oak flavor marks the short finish.
Name: Tamaral 2014 Vendimia Seleccionada Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Murky aromas of leafy plum and compost announce a challenging wine from a difficult vintage. In the mouth, this reserva is outright thin. Tangy, tart plum and red cherry flavors are zesty as well as lightly green and herbal on the finish.
Name: CVNE 2014 Cune Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of compost and peanut say what needs to be said about this mulchy-tasting crianza. Rawness on the palate and finish do nothing to boost this along.
Name: Pata Negra 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Candied red berry and ham aromas are shaky but tolerable. This has the feel of rubber and nails, while plum flavors are somewhat weedy. For basic country wine, this is acceptable.
Name: Chapillon NV La Fresquera Tempranillo (Spain)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry with a side of dill pickle describes the nose on this leafy, unfresh Tempranillo. Flavors throughout are murky, soupy and weedy.
Name: Mureda 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Tomato and herbal red berry aromas flunk the pleasantries test. A heavy, grabby palate tastes of grilled, herbal berry fruits, while a charmless finish is gritty. Not much to recommend here.
Name: Viñedos Balmoral 2016 Maravides Mediterráneo Tempranillo Tempranillo (Spain)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Root beer, tree bark and stewed fruit aromas aren't encouraging, nor is the color, which lacks luster. A tubular palate is oddly narrow, while flavors of plum, licorice and burnt brown sugar are shocked by tartaric acid.
Name: Bodegas Y Viñedos Martuela 2016 Dauco Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Raisin, cassis, beef soup and damp mop are notable aromas on the nose. A flush, fleshy palate includes severely dry tannins, while this tastes wild and herbal in front of a weedy finish.
Name: Sinfonía 2016 Vintage Collection Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: This is a soft, well-integrated and moderately tannic wine, juicy in brawny black fruit and smoked meat. It offers a dusting of tannins that are offset by the fruit flavors, finishing with aspects of lavender, licorice and black pepper.
Name: Jarvis 2014 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Tempranillo (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling from a new project based in Santa Barbara County offers aromas of elderberry, blue flowers, dark cocoa and earth, proving both rocky and fruity on the nose. Acid rises quickly on the palate to deliver flavors of blueberry, black rocks and a hint of leather.
Name: Grace + Vine 2015 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of black plum, cocoa, cinnamon and turned loam show on the nose of this bottling from a newer winery in the Gilroy area. Thyme, marjoram and oregano play against red plum on the herbal palate.
Name: Alara 2016 Tempranillo (San Benito County)

Description: Leathery berry and animal aromas blend nicely into savory plum and berry scents to form a good nose. A tight, drawn-in palate is a bit hard, although there's no complaints with this Rioja's energy level. Saucy, slightly salty tomato and red plum flavors finish with earthy notes. This is a classic Rioja in every sense; drink through 2025.
Name: La Gitana 2014 Tradición H  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy, savory aromas include notes of cured meat, dried leaves and red berries. A solid palate is grabby but in shape. Leafy, earthy flavors of roasted plum and berry fruits end with peppery spice notes and a lasting sense of dryness. Drink this by-the-book reserva through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Laztana Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blueberry, mocha and earth highlight this softly textured wine that's made from an estate-grown site and pays homage to the producer's Spanish heritage. It has grip and quiet power.
Designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled
Name: Marimar Estate 2015 Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled Tempranillo (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe black-currant, baked fig, clove and ginger aromas show on the rich nose of this bottling. The palate is also quite ripe with thick fig cake and gingerbread flavors, though framed by chalky tannins and lots of acid, proving very Rioja-like.
Name: Alara 2015 Tempranillo (Central Coast)

Description: A deep nose with solid berry aromas, oak and spice is what you'd expect from a reserva from this reliable bodega. Full tannins make for a rubbing mouthfeel, while this tastes of berry fruit and distant chocolate. Savory flavors take over on a heavy, tannic finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Solid berry and cherry aromas include mild but helpful spice notes. This crianza from a good vintage is smacking, fresh and true to the classic Rioja style. Flavors of plum and berry include vanilla, spice and cocoa notes prior to a long finish that's dry, peppery and strapped with acidity.
Name: Valserrano 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Sweet-smelling raisin, prune, licorice and chocolate aromas are fully ripe. In the mouth, this is plump but firm, with scratchy tannins. Prune, mocha and chocolate flavors are consistent with the nose, while this holds onto a raisiny sense of ripeness on the finish.
Name: Finca Azaya 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Earthy aromas of ripe berry fruits blend well with spicy oak and vanilla notes. A lively palate with bright acidity puts out flavors of spiced plum, tomato, red currant and dried earth. This is a classic Rioja crianza that's honest, fresh and eminently drinkable over the next few years.
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2015 Finca de la Villa Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy berry fruit aromas are more foresty and mulchy than bright and fresh. A tight, drawing palate is tannic and high in acidity. Like the nose, this tastes saucy, earthy and tomatoey, while a steady finish confirms that this is traditional Rioja reserva.
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2014 Rivallana Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy plum and spice aromas show earthy grit upon deeper inspection. A full, fruity palate offers plenty of size and weight, while this tastes of blackberry, coffee and chocolate. Pulpy berry fruit flavors narrow down on the finish.
Name: Viña Mayor 2016 Tinto Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Traditional Rioja aromas of dried berry fruit and red currant are rugged. In the mouth, this is dry, pulling and fairly austere due to grinding tannins. Gritty flavors of plum and tomato sauce are spicy and the slightest bit green on the finish. Drink or hold through 2021.
Name: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Damp but stout aromas of concentrated berry fruits are full but not overly expressive, layered or complex. A fleshy, widespread palate follows suit, while this tastes of jammy but generic plum and berry fruits. A full finish spreads out but lacks definition.
Name: Convento Oreja 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of crushed blackberry, pomegranate and blueberry are fleshed out by white pepper. Crushed-velvet tannins and structured, balanced acidity house flavors of red cherry, plum, bay leaf, white pepper and leather.
Name: Llano Estacado 2015 Harvest Reserve Tempranillo (Texas)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are clean and fruity, but only moderately intense. A pulpy, fruit-filled palate is on the grabby side, while this tastes of leathery berry and black plum. Notes of chocolate and oak spice are apparent on the finish.
Name: Navas 1212 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
