Description: The smooth, medium-bodied palate shows juicy red fruit teeming with vanilla, baking spice and a touch of cigar wrapper. The oak becomes more apparent on the finish, but that fruit flavors prevail and keep this wine fresh in character.
Name: Aridus 2015 Limited Production Tempranillo (Arizona)

Description: Blueberry and black raspberry aromas meld with notes of black currants, herb and white pepper. Soft black fruit flavors of plum, currant and mulberry are joined by subtler oak flavors and vanilla. The tannins are fine grained and chalky, balanced by gentle acidity. The finish is lengthy, employing more of those soft black fruit and leather tones.
Name: Llano Estacado 2016 Cellar Reserve Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)

Description: An earthy nose of lush green moss, ferns and tilled earth carries a subtle hint of wild blackberry. The palate is more fruit driven, offering cherry, raspberry and plum flavors that are supported by a backbone of a savory earth note and gritty tannins. It finishes with a spicy pepper tone.
Name: Messina Hof 2016 Private Reserve Double Barrel Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)

Description: Ripeness is conveyed through mild raisin and prune aromas. While this is firm on the palate, there's just enough cushion to provide depth. Earthy berry and raisin flavors reflect a warm year, while this is sappy on a fruity finish with just enough edge to it.
Name: Sonsierra 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Enticing aromas of cherry, cranberry and red plum are backed by cedar and baking spice on the nose. The palate is packed with juicy flavors of cherry and pomegranate, laced with leather and tobacco. The well-structured tannins are sandy in feel and supported by vivacious acidity, making for a very crushable red with plenty of complexity. It finishes on a cranberry juice note sprinkled with white pepper.
Name: Vara NV Tinto Especial Lot # 014 Tempranillo (America)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oak-based lactic aromas include graphite and pencil eraser notes along with heavy black fruit scents. This is big and a bit jumbled on the palate. Blackberry and black currant flavors are accompanied by pasty oak notes. On the finish, this is grabby but with cutting acidity.
Name: Cepa 21 2016 Hito  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Gritty berry and spice notes indicate a wine that's just ripe enough. A palate with rubbery tannins and grip features saucy, herbal plum and tomato flavors. On the finish, this is steady, fresh and tightly wound.
Name: Aspaldi 2015 Cosecha  (Rioja)

Description: Fragrant aromas of new leather hover, red cherry and peppercorns carry the nose. The palate is less intense, with robust, dusty tannins taking center stage over flavors of black cherry, vanilla and charred tobacco leaf. The finish leans on blueberry and cassis tossed with green peppercorns.
Name: Caduceus 2014 Nagual del Judith Tempranillo (Arizona)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are matched by spicy oak and vanilla notes. In the mouth, this warm-vintage crianza feels snappy, sappy and sinewy. Oaky red plum and currant flavors finish spicy but basic. Overall, this is a good but standard Rioja, nothing more.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This offers aromas of brown sugar and gingersnap tinged with blackberry. The palate echoes the nose, showing more brown sugar and wild blackberry notes joined by vanilla and sweet baking spice. The tannins are soft and velvety, with plenty of acidity for balance. Drink now–2025.
Name: Caduceus 2014 Merkin Vineyards Tarzan Red Tempranillo (Cochise County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of spice, tobacco and herb lead to lighter styled fruit flavors. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own but has a place at the dinner table.
Name: Gordon Estate 2015 Estate Grown Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Cedar and cigar box aromas dominate the nose of this reserve Tempranillo that spent one year in American oak. The palate is more fruit-driven, offering flavors of cranberry, blackberry and raspberry. A juicy finish lingers on a pepper note and a grip of tannin.
Name: Pedernales 2014 Reserve Tempranillo (Texas)

Description: Aromas of raspberry meld with cedar and baking spice. The palate echoes the nose adding tart cranberry, white pepper and tobacco leaf. Vibrant acidity and velvety tannins linger through the finish that's filled with a tart berry flavor.
Name: Pedernales 2015 Tempranillo (Texas)

Description: The nose shows ripe black plum, blackberry, herbs and stale pepper, while the palate offers blueberry, raspberry, oak and cocoa powder. The cranberry-laced finish displays the easygoing grip of crushed-velvet tannins.
Name: McPherson 2015 Tempranillo (Texas)

Description: Damp, herbal berry aromas lead to a full palate with rubbery tannins. Soft, stewed berry and spice flavors are low on kick and freshness but don't fold. On the finish, this flattens out and tastes baked and slightly cooked.
Name: Lágrimas de Maria 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A very subdued nose leaks out faint hints of blueberry and green tobacco leaf. The palate opens with a ripe red-berry note that dives into cigar box, oak and black pepper spice. Gritty, aggressive tannins bring a bitter edge to the white pepper-laced finish.
Name: Haak 2015 Cellar Reserve Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)

Description: This is a basic table wine, light and a bit brownish in color, that tastes a little tired and has flavors like tea and raspberry vinegar.
Name: Viaggio 2014 Outta the House! Tempranillo (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of creosote introduce a neutral palate of petrol and red fruit flavors. Bitter green tannins and a little bit spice on the finish attempt to add some excitement, but this is underwhelming and ultimately bitter.
Name: Landon 2015 Reserve Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)

Description: This is textbook Teso la Monja, with a deep, lusty nose that is packed with a ripe but balanced black-fruit flavor and copious new oak. Hard, pounding tannins are edgy but not jagged, while this tastes of toasty blackberry, cassis and blueberry pie. A warm finish suggests molten chocolate cake. Best from 2020–2026.
Name: Teso La Monja 2015 Victorino  (Toro)

Description: Imperial Reserva is a personal favorite, and from a vintage plagued by rain this is a swinging success. Rich aromas of maple are prominent, with solid berry fruit as the canvas. Punchy acidity seems raw at first, but it's the proper carrying vessel for tangy, spicy dried-fruit flavors that settle on cranberry and plum. Drink through 2032.
Name: CVNE 2014 Imperial Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Blackberry and cola aromas are infused with game and a touch of oak-based vanilla. A flush palate is packed to the brim, while this tastes of ripe black fruit and chocolate. The warm finish is loaded with fudge and cassis flavors, and overall this checks all the boxes for an excellent, modern red wine. Drink through 2025.
Name: Matsu 2015 El Viejo  (Toro)

Description: Rooty aromas of foresty berry fruits are not that bright or lively, maybe a reflection of 2014's rainy conditions? However, this remains deep and flush on the palate. Oaky berry flavors are a touch soft and mushy, again reflective of the year. Wood spice and bacon flavors on the finish are welcome; drink through 2025.
Name: Bodegas Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia 2014 Macán Clásico  (Rioja)
Winery: Bodegas Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia

Description: Berry and oak aromas are not overly deep. On the palate, this is more defined, with lively acidity and popping fruit. Plum, spiced berry and currant flavors end with chocolaty oak, nutmeg and blueberry notes. Unlike most Contino wines, this one seems ready for near-term consumption; drink through 2024.
Name: Contino 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A graphite note and the essence of fine oak sit nicely atop a nose defined by blackberry, prune and raisin aromas. A tight palate qualifies as direct, while this Toro cruiserweight tastes of toasty oaky black fruits and pepper. A spicy dry finish doesn't waver, and this Tinta de Toro will age well; drink through 2027.
Name: Teso La Monja 2015 Almirez  (Toro)

Description: Baked plum and cherry aromas are spicy and classic for Rioja, while lively acidity lends spirit to the palate. Berry and currant flavors show a raisiny character on the back end and run steady through the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2013 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is an up-and-coming variety in the Rocks District subregion of the valley. The aromas are generous, with notes of moist earth, tobacco, cherry and dried herb. The flavors are elegant in style, showing a sense of texture and grace. The finish kicks it up a notch.
Name: No Girls 2015 Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: Blackberry, vanilla, sandalwood and oud wood aromas are a touch cheesy and warm but mostly alluring and of high quality. Intense and pulling on the palate, this warm-year Reserva tastes of blackberry, coffee and vanilla. Coconut, vanilla and unresolved oak flavors dominate a ripe finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Blackberry-jam aromas are full, flush and lush, but not what you'd call complex. A choppy lively palate with bruising tannins isn't shocking for Toro, while this tastes of ripe black fruits, mocha and chocolate. Despite having massive tannins, this Crianza finishes just smooth enough. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Crianza  (Toro)

Description: Intense berry aromas are baked, earthy and suggestive of prune. A powerful palate is direct, healthy and tannic. A mix of black-fruit and blueberry flavors concludes with dry, peppery spice notes on a long tight finish that's on target. Drink through 2026.
Name: Matsu 2015 El Recio  (Toro)

Description: Cinnamon, clove and oak-spice aromas frame notes of berries and citrus peels on the nose. A full palate feels a touch oily and creamy, while this tastes of savory, lightly salted plum and berry fruits. The saltiness carries over to a well-formed finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Bodegas Bilbainas 2013 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Smooth, welcoming aromas of cola, black fruits and integrated oak are soft and indicate that this is ready to drink. A plump, sappy palate delivers ripe berry and chocolate flavors, while this is fleshy on a finish weighted down by berry pulp. Drink through 2021.
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2006 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Baked blackberry and cassis aromas are ripe to the max and come with plenty of oak-driven vanilla. On the palate, this is plump but honest, with depth and give. Baked berry flavors are enriched by oaky vanilla and coffee notes, while this is smooth and steady on the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Conde Valdemar Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Savory, meaty berry aromas are unconventional and gamy more than bold, oaky and fruity. A plump round palate is full but not fat, while roasted meaty blackberry flavors finish toasty and snappy, with touches of heat and burn that should slip away with more time in bottle; drink through 2025.
Name: Elias Mora 2015  Toro

Description: Oak-rich aromas of maple, chocolate and vanilla rest on top of ripe berry scents. This is a medium-deep Rioja with bouncy tannins and lively acidity. Flavors of blackberry and cassis show a flowery hint of violet on a finish with depth and character. Drink through 2026.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Leathery berry aromas include exotic notes that stir interest. This feels choppy but also lively and balanced. Cassis, blackberry and plum flavors finish steady. With plenty of ripeness and depth, this manages to show complexity along with elegance. Drink through 2020.
Name: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Issos Crianza  (Toro)

Description: Ripe black-fruit aromas blend with notes of sandalwood, turned earth and graham cracker to form a complex and inviting nose. A dry tight tannic palate is proper and drumming, while this Toro tastes of blackberry and wood spice prior to a focused but dry and tannic finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Maurodos 2015 Prima  (Toro)

Description: Savory berry aromas include a lot of oak and graphite along with exotic hints. Hailing from a vintage marked by a rainy harvest, this isn't bright or fruity at any check point. Blackberry, cassis and licorice flavors are short on a blocky finish tasting of mint, cardamom and oak. Drink through 2024.
Name: Muga 2014 Torre Muga  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe red-fruit aromas are slightly candied and include notes of brick dust and baking spices. On the palate, this is lively and in good health. Savory, lightly roasted plum and currant flavors finish steady, with freshness, residual red-fruit flavors and finally some noticeable oak. Drink through 2021.
Name: Rioja Vega 2014 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky black-fruit aromas meet the basics for a top-notch Ribera wine. While this grinds a bit on the palate, it's not too scouring. Bold berry flavors show a saucy gamy side on a finish with mild heat and scrappy intensity. Drink through 2025.
Name: 12 Linajes 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: An outstanding value, this is the second label from Tempranillo specialist Paul O'Brien. It offers a boatload of mixed flavors and accents, with citrus, fig, cherry tobacco and bourbon tea all well represented and supported with lively acidity.
Name: Oregon Territory 2015 Tempranillo (Oregon)

Description: This wine is carried by aromas of earth, spice, cherry and plum. For a crianza, this is a serious medium-bodied wine. Spicy dark-berry flavors come with a touch of cocoa prior to the lasting finish, with leftover spice notes and slow-fading fruit. Drink through 2019.
Name: Raiza 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Brandied berry and raisin aromas lead the nose of this mature Gran Reserva. The texture is austere and grippy, a reflection of a cold vintage. Spice, earth, berry and plum flavors finish with a note of tobacco. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2008 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Fine oak helps an otherwise ripe and earthy nose. A rich saturated palate ranks as syrupy, while this Tempranillo-led blend tastes of coconut, chocolate mint and blackberry jam. While thick and stout throughout, this off-vintage wine always seems a bit flat. Drink through 2021.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2013 Baron de Chirel Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are suggestive of raisin, baked plum and pastry. In the mouth, this Crianza is chewy and solid, but not too heavy. Plum, raspberry and wood-spice flavors are lasting and steady across the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Pure berry and black-cherry aromas make for a flush and friendly nose. In the mouth, this is quite dry and drawing, with rough-textured tannins. Lightly salty and savory blackberry and black-plum flavors finish with surface-level depth and a reprise of scratchiness; drink through 2024.
Name: Teso La Monja 2015 Romanico  (Toro)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though slightly high toned, there's much to like here. Black cherry fruit and a dusting of cocoa powder focus the flavors in a smooth and spicy wine. As it moves across the palate, a streak of vanilla, followed by a lingering flavor of bacon, comes up. It's probably best to drink this now through the early 2020s.
Name: Delfino 2016 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Earthy, rubbery berry and plum aromas are spicy and dry. A tight palate with firm tannins and bold acidity offers plenty of grip. Baked plum and currant flavors are dry and spicy on a finish with residual oak character. Drink through 2023.
Name: Dios Ares 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Dark smoky charred aromas lend a crusty, slightly burnt topping to the nose. In the mouth, this cool-vintage wine is wiry, with magnetic midpalate acidity. Saucy flavors of plum and berry finish savory and tight. Fitting for a 2013, this is never overly ripe. Drink through 2022.
Name: Sonsierra 2013 Pagos de la Sonsierra Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry aromas suggest raisin and graphite. A flush palate is full in body and displaying good structure. Roasted berry and plum flavors are meaty in front of a savory finish that tastes of soy sauce and grilled beef. Drink through 2020.
Name: Sonsierra 2014 Crianza Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)

Description: Briary berry aromas are spicy but also earthy and a bit stewed. A chewy dense palate is more chunky than structured, while this tastes of charred wood and baked berry fruits. Given that 2012 was a very warm year, this is in good shape. Drink through 2022.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cool, murky berry aromas are gamy. A blast of fruitiness propels a big palate loaded with spicy chocolaty oak. Bold berry flavors are short-lasting on a tight, intense finish. Crianzas are made to drink young, but this will benefit from more aging; drink through 2028.
Name: Torres 2015 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy berry aromas are forward but inexact. A tight powerful palate is narrow in scope, with peppery red-berry flavors propelled by lively acidity. Finishing notes of oak spice and cocoa are notable through a choppy but bold ending.
Name: Viña Mayor 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark oaky aromas of minty black fruits are gritty and concentrated. Following that nose, this is grinding on the palate. Acid-pushed dark-fruit flavors come with an offset of oaky vanilla, while this is clipped and gappy in feel on the finish.
Name: Alvides 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Chunky berry aromas are spicy and dense, but a touch flat. On the palate, this Crianza is smacking, with lively acidity. Plum and berry flavors are generic but good, while this toes the same flavor line on a solid finish. Drink through 2019.
Name: Pata Negra 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy, savory aromas of leathery berry fruits come with an animal note. This warm-vintage Reserva is dense and feels like it's piling on top of itself. Roasted, spicy berry flavors are slightly leafy, while oak spice is lasting on a solid, chunky finish.
Name: Casa Primicia 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are a touch baked and raisiny, which makes sense given the warmth and dryness of the 2011 vintage in Rioja. On the palate, this is dry as a bone, with cheek-pounding tannins. Flavors of roasted plum, red currant, tomato sauce and vanilla finish raw but also clean and true. Drink through 2024.
Name: Aspaldi 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy rooty aromas of licorice, anise, fennel and dried berry fruits are a bit herbal and raw. As for raw, the palate fits that description, with bumpiness to boot. Berry, oak spice and baking-spice flavors are steady on the finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2012 Rioja Bordón Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Smooth, spicy berry and black-cherry aromas are spread across a concentrated nose. A tight juicy palate is fresh, while this weighs in as medium-to-full. Lightly roasted berry and plum flavors include a spot of oaky vanilla, while this is mellow and emphasizes freshness and spice notes on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2015 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Up-front aromas of cedary oak, vanilla and spice provide framing for riper berry scents. A full palate with piping acidity is cut by creamy oak, while this tastes of red plum, currant, tobacco, savory spices and vanilla. Although a bit ripe and soupy in structure, this is a classic-style Rioja to drink now.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Federico Paternina Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of barrel spice, baking spice and earthy plum form an inviting nose. This is chewy and full on the palate, with good balance. Roasted berry, spiced plum, baking spice and clove flavors close up shop on an edgy finish, with popping acidity and residual roasted notes.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas offer a touch of wet clay to keep things grounded. This Reserva is medium in body, with good acidity and balance. Earthy berry flavors shows hints of oak and raisin, while plum and prune notes carry over to a finish with dry edgy tannins. Drink this proper Rioja through 2023.
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2013 Fincas da la Villa Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromatically speaking, this is gritty and rough. In the mouth, this Reserva from a shaky vintage is soupy but not out of shape. Sappy plum, prune and tomato flavors are classic for Rioja but finish without much punch, so best to drink this soon.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Baked berry aromas are lightly raisiny and more flat than jumpy. In the mouth, this feels medium-plus in weight. Short toasty black-fruit flavors are spicy and peppery on a finish with mild burn. Drink now.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2015 Rioja Bordón Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Baking-spice aromas are matched against ripe earthy plum and berry scents. In the mouth, this Crianza is chewy, dense and blocky. A saturated flavor profile includes ripe blackberry and savory oak, while this is woody and spicy tasting on a dry finish.
Name: Larchago 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stewed, baked black-fruit aromas are ultraripe and gamy. Congruent with the nose, this feels rich, sappy and dense on the palate. Deep plum and blackberry flavors lose freshness on the back end and finish raisiny.
Name: Matarromera 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: An almost-black color and savory, meaty aromas of black fruits and prune announce a saturated Tempranillo with syrupy weight and thickness. Charred flavors of burnt wood and slightly overripe black fruits finish with full tannins.
Name: Proelio 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Spiced-plum, soy sauce and prune aromas settle on soupy as this breathes out. A full palate with sinewy tannins, notable acidity and some creaminess deals flavors of stewed plum, raisin and vanilla. On the finish, it's more of the same, with a stewed final impression.
Name: Nubori 2014 Cata Nobilis Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Borderline raisiny aromas are ripe but a touch cooked and soft. This feels flush and full, but also soupy. Blackberry, spice and oaky flavors finish woody and with notes of mint and herbs.
Name: Viña Vilano 2016 Roble Black Edition  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Spicy earthy cherry and berry aromas are calm like a serene lake. A more crisp and drawing palate is bolstered by fresh acidity, while this tastes of earthy plum and tomato, with spice notes. A fleshy but limited finish is the conclusion; drink now.
Name: Bodega Classica 2014 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Raisiny aromas of prune juice and vanilla lead to a chunky, weighty palate that's almost syrupy. Blackberry, prune and raisin flavors are a touch soupy on a finish with low acidity. Drink now.
Name: Castroviejo 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Saucy berry aromas include screaming oak notes, while this is smacking, tannic and full on the palate. Plum and berry fruit flavors are fully oaked, while this feels tight and drawing on the finish.
Name: Gómez de Segura 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Concentrated black-fruit and oak aromas are gamy. A jammy palate tips the scales towards heavy, while this tastes of ripe, slightly baked black fruits. Notes of toast, spice and game mark the close.
Name: Tionio 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A dark color and bulky aromas of jumbled black fruits and Christmas spices set up a stacked palate with hard tannins and lots of weight. Blackberry flavors mixed with mocha and spice notes are classic for Ribera del Duero. A warm finish with grating tannins suggests that aging may help; drink through 2026.
Name: Trus 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe berry and raisin aromas are desiccated and jammy. An edgy tannic palate deals flavors of raisin, prune, toast and black pepper, while a short but dense finish confirms that this is a ripe modern-style Tempranillo.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2015 Finca Torrea  (Rioja)

Description: Berry fruit aromas are slightly gamy, with a hint of vanilla. On the palate, this is choppy and tough. Gamy, herbal plum and raspberry flavors transition to oaky and chocolaty on a severely dry, tannic finish that pushes up against sandpaper.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2013 Cosme Palacio Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Mature, slightly oxidized berry aromas lead to a palate that has the clamp and tension of rubber bands. Black-fruit and plum flavors are good but basic, while this feels rocky hard and rubbery on a tannic finish.
Name: Dominio de la Abadesa 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy black-cherry aromas are earthy and herbal, with a note of olive. A deep but tightly drawn palate brings flavors of berry, plum and raspberry. This Crianza is tight as nails on a raw finish. Time could help this along; drink through 2028.
Name: Pradorey 2015 Crianza Finca Valdelayegua Single Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bold berry fruit and spun-sugar aromas scream ripeness and oak. On the palate, this strikes as being tough, aggressive and forward in nature; nothing is reserved or subtle. Crackling plum and cherry flavors wrap up on a rough finish. More time in bottle could help this, but Crianzas shouldn't require a lot of patience. Drink through 2030.
Name: Atalayas de Golbán 2015 Torre de Golbán Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Plum and berry aromas come with notes of tobacco ash and green herbs. On the palate, this is a bit closed and clipped. Savory, spicy berry and plum flavors finish with length and notes of vanilla and mixed spices.
Name: Bodegas Heredad Aduna 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: An obtuse nose with chunky berry aromas gets sketchier under the microscope, which unveils aromas of green bean and mulch. A flat rubbery tough palate is fiercely tannic, while this tastes a bit stewed and heavy. A rubbery finish tastes of dark-berry fruit.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2014 Fincas Valdemacuco Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy aromas of wet clay share space on the nose with strawberry and cotton-candy sweetness. A lively palate is high in tartaric acidity, while this tastes of roasted plum, savory red-berry fruits and spice. On the finish, this shows a mild note of prune.
Name: Viña Otano 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A fresh berry aroma is overpowered by an earthy overtone in this wine. This is holding up on the palate, while flavors of roasted berry fruits are just not that ripe, a lasting reflection of a cold vintage.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2007 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Gritty earthy aromas of raisiny fruit and asphalt are indicative of a drawing and gritty palate. Leafy notes of tomato vie with baked-fruit flavors, while this is clampy and lacks smoothness on the finish. Seems like 2013's cold conditions affected this wine.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2013 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oak-based spice, chocolate and vanilla aromas fit the bill for Ribera del Duero. In the mouth, this is hard as rocks, with fierce tannins that bump and grind. Jammy berry flavors collapse on a heavy, tannic finish.
Name: Bodegas Veganzones 2015 912 de Altitud Limestone Soil Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromatically, this doesn't offer much. And while the palate is a bit raw, rugged and clumsy, this tastes of cherry, plum and chocolate in way that's convincing. On the finish, this is spicy with lingering cocoa notes.
Name: Salcis 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Soapy red-fruit aromas are questionable. In the mouth, this is tough and pulling, with no holds barred. Candied berry and sugar beet flavors finish with intensity but also a green residual note.
Name: Bodegas Veganzones 2015 Viejo Mundo Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A severely charred and woody nose means this blocky Crianza has strong scents of mint, clove and barrel spices. Expect a battle from start to finish; the palate is resiny and grabby, while oak-infused berry flavors taste a lot like clove. The same can be said for a big-time woody finish.
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2014 Selección Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Scratchy aromas of spicy red fruits and tree bark hold up to scrutiny, as do the oaky notes that create a vanilla essence to go with gamy berry flavors. A chewy, meaty finish belies this Crianza's low price tag.
Name: Bodegas Fos 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Gamy rubbery berry-fruit aromas include oak and iodine notes. A choppy hard palate tastes of roasted berry fruits and green herbs, while a full tannic finish is chunky and soupy.
Name: Cyan 2015  Toro

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Black-fruit aromas include notes of rubber and mixed spices. On the palate, this is loose in structure but shows ample acidity. Moderately ripe berry and black-plum flavors are savory and taste of stewed meat on the finish.
Name: Rios de Tinta 2016  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of cherry Kool-Aid and candied berry fruits are circumspect. On the palate, this young Tempranillo is chunky, pulpy and lacking in definition. Oaky flavors of chocolate, chicken fat and spice stand out more than fruit, while this lacks intensity on a plump finish.
Name: Arrocal 2016 Ocho Meses En Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy berry and cotton candy aromas are a bit hot and weedy. This feels sappy but upright on the palate. Flavors of plum, currant and green herbs finish with grip and spice notes.
Name: Atalayas de Golbán 2016 Virdiana Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy berry aromas show lemony oak and wood resin. This feels tannic, grabby and hollow in the middle. Herbal berry flavors lean in the direction of green, while this tastes minty and low on fruit on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Glorioso Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Reedy cherry and berry aromas are gritty, while a fairly full palate deals earthy plum and spice flavors that are peppery. This tastes roasted on a firm, tough finish. Charm and high notes are fleeting on this Crianza.
Name: Casa Primicia 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Sappy blackberry aromas are dense. In the mouth, this is heavy and a bit overweight for a joven-style wine. Plum and herbal flavors end with flabby weight.
Name: Peñalba Herraiz 2016 Aptus 6 Meses Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Odd aromas of lemony oak and scented soap are dominant and block out this Crianza's fruit scents. A pinched high-acid palate holds soupy tomatoey flavors of savory red plum and currant. On the finish, this is tart, with rubbing tannins.
Name: Quirus 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A heavy nose is oaked to the point that this Crianza smells mostly of charred wood and shoe polish. Oak-dominant flavors of herbal berry fruits and plum mixed with baking spices conclude with a resiny aftertaste.
Name: Ramón Bilbao 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of wood grain, mint, clove and smoke ride into a rock-hard palate with fierce tannins. Burnt oak, black fruit and hard-spice flavors give way to heat and forced spice on the finish.
Name: Viña Vilano 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy aromas of oak and tobacco meet brandied cherry and plum about halfway. On the palate, this is screaming with acidity, making for a shrill mouthfeel. Flavors of oaky vanilla and sour cherry finish with sizzle and sour red-currant notes. The most notable problem is unresolved pesky acidity.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 HZ Abascal Vineyard Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Savory, meaty aromas are strained, roasted, oaky and low on fruit. This young Ribera del Duero from the Vicente Gandia family of wines is raw and underdeveloped on the palate. Roasted berry flavors are short on ripeness and taste gritty in front of a hollow finish.
Name: Dolmo 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Berry aromas are fiery and scratchy at first, then break down and become suggestive of olive. High acidity and not much body create crispness but also tart plum and cranberry flavors. Loud acidity is maintained on a raw finish.
Name: Dios Ares 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Band-Aid and latex aromas are big parts of a jumbled nose. In the mouth, this is basic, with sappy acidity and chewy thickness. Meaty plum and cherry flavors are oaky and a touch green, while this is generic on the finish.
Name: Trus 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Oak-blanketed plum aromas are barely up to the heavy clove and rubber notes that are out front. A choppy, tannic palate qualifies as rough, while this tastes more of oak, clove and spice than vivid fruit.
Name: Vallobera 2015 Familia San Pedro Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Cherry and hand-soap aromas barely make the grade. This feels raw and lean. Cranberry and plum-skin flavors finish herbal, spicy and not really ripe. This is a highly snappy Crianza without much flare.
Name: Bodegas Lacort 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: An outright woody nose smells of sawdust and mint. On the palate, this young Tempranillo shows holes in the middle. Oak-heavy flavors of clove smother what fruit this has.
Name: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Wayward berry aromas are heavily oaked, resulting in clove scents. This feels fleshy and awkward, with mild tannins and a questionable structure. Woody, sappy purple-fruit flavors include a strong blast of clove, while this retains an oaky character on a finish that's both savory and baked in flavor.
Name: Bodegas Grupo Yllera 2016 Boada Campo de Bueyes Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Minty raw-oak flavors are raspy. Following suit, this feels raw and choppy as nails. Generic black-fruit flavors are covered up by resiny oak, and that same woody character stands out on a scratchy finish.
Name: Latitud 42 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Grapy, soupy aromas lack clarity and suggest hot pavement. This is lacking in structure and constitution, and that means overall balance is sketchy. Woody, soapy berry flavors are a bit weedy on the finish.
Name: Finca La Mata 2016  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gamy, herbaceous aromas are foxy and raise questions about the quality of this Crianza. A hard tannic palate that tastes of green oak, clove and herbal berry fruits is less than stellar, while this is highly herbal on the finish.
Name: Arrocal 2015 Passión Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of game and sauced berries starts off this high-toned wine. The tannic palate offers flavors of medicinal plum and wood.
Name: Bodegas Grupo Yllera 2014 Boada Campo de Bueyes Crainza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Closed on the nose, the palate of this wine is carried by an undefined berry flavor. This is simplistic in feel, with a clipped finish.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2014 Próximo  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine is earthy, nutty and vegetal on the nose. A tannic, grainy palate is lacking in elegance, while burnt-out plum flavors finish weedy and oaky.
Name: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2015 Condado de Haza Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bold aromas of flowers, ripe berries and cassis carry the exotic nose. This bottling from the renowned García family is intense, tight and structured like a brick house. Boysenberry, blackberry and chocolaty oak are the most notable flavors, while this oozes coffee, toast and peppery spice on a hard-driving but focused finish. Drink from 2020–2038.
Name: Garmón 2015  Ribera del Duero

Description: Ripe, chunky and slightly static is how to describe the nose on this prime gran reserva from a benchmark year. A flush lush palate shows no gaps and is full from side to side. Baked plum and berry flavors are ripe to the max without tasting sweet, while this darkens up and tastes more savory on the finish. Drink from 2020–2035.
Name: Muga 2010 Prado Enea Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Attractive aromas of mocha, vanilla, wood grain and healthy plum and red-berry fruits come in front of a creamy rich palate that some might say is a touch fat. Deep plum, cherry, cassis, vanilla and chocolate flavors are equally rich on a long finish with savory berry and vanilla-cream flavors. Drink through 2030.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Monte Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A full-fruit nose is lightly toasted, with a flicker of menthol and tobacco coming from the combination of ripe berry fruit and oak. A saturated palate is intense but still a bit rough at this young age. Rubbery berry, plum and spice flavors get clipped on the finish by hard drying tannins. This needs more time; best from 2020–2032.
Name: Valserrano 2016 Nico  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Max level full-toast oak gives this brute an almost burnt nose, but with subtler leathery berry and crude oil notes it's not just about the oak. To no surprise, this is intense and powerful on the palate. Flavors of maple, chocolate, toast and blackberry are pressed into a stocky whole that doesn't dissipate on the finish. Drink from 2020–2032.
Name: Astrales 2015 Christina  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe blackberry aromas run deep and are supported by earth notes and a hint of buttery pastry. Like most high-end wines from this bodega, this is fully formed and ripe, with correct balance. Savory berry and salty cured-meat flavors finish smooth and with some elegance. Drink through 2026.
Name: García Figuero 2015 12 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A compact nose does its best to support the weight of heavy yet savory aromas of beef jerky, soy sauce and black tea. A choppy tannic palate sizzles more than it simmers, while this is toasty and blackened in flavor. Additional toasty oak, baking spice and chocolate flavors seep onto a long generous finish. Drink from 2020–2035.
Name: García Figuero 2015 Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A good deal of oak is notable on a nose with savory aromas of beef soup along with berry-fruit scents and a hint of prune. A full chunky palate shows rubbery tannins, while this tastes of plum, savory berry, prune, salt and spice. A steady finish doesn't deviate from this Tempranillo's core flavors. Drink through 2035.
Name: Bodegas Corral 2011 Altos de Corral Barrel Fermented  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, prune, raisin and oak spice come together with aplomb. A full-bodied palate with controlled weight is the vessel for toasty flavors of oak, vanilla, mocha and baked black fruits. A solid finish with latent acidity is a worthy conclusion to this fully oaked Tempranillo. Drink through 2027.
Name: Bodegas Leda 2014 Viñas Viejas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe modern aromas of black fruits and fine oak set up a flush palate with density and smooth tannins. Chocolaty oak flavors are wrapped around blackberry and plum notes, while this is savory tasting and doesn't hammer away on the finish. Drink this excellent Tempranillo through 2025.
Name: Peñalba Herraiz 2015 Carravid  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and hearty in the glass, this built-to-last bottling shows black currant, roasted coffee, cocoa powder, new leather and cola on the nose. Chiseled yet sticky tannins and powerful acidity frame the palate, where dark-berry, root-beer and chocolate flavors reign. Drink 2021–2034.
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Gran Reserva Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Central Coast)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bursting aromas of black raspberry, bright blackberry, lavender and chaparral scrub make for an intriguing nose to this single-vineyard Tempranillo. There's a leathery Old World vibe to the palate, where gamy dusty touches give depth to dried berry and herb flavors.
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Description: This is the definition of a young ripe bomber with big berry aromas and floral notes. Hardness on the palate makes this a tough hill to conquer now—fierce tannins are unforgiving. Toasty blackberry and coffee flavors are gritty on a long finish with lasting blackness. Drink from 2019–2030.
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Viñedos de Altura  (Rioja)

Description: Soupy raisiny aromas announce a fully ripe, almost overripe gran reserva with a round, dense mouthfeel. Baked flavors of ultraripe berry fruits are matched by savory notes of black olive. On the finish, there's mostly coffee and toast flavors and not much acidity or tannic grip. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde Valdemar Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Balsamic aromas of soy sauce, Modena vinegar, black olive and stewed berry fruits form the opening on this clampy Ribera with pinching tannins that narrow the palate. Savory blackberry and boysenberry flavors finish with some heat and hard tannins. Drink through 2035.
Name: Anier 2015 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smashed blackberry, purple flowers and loamy earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Sticky tannins frame the palate, though it's a fairly fresh take on the grape, with boysenberry and fresh purple flowers meeting with leather and smoked meat flavors.
Name: Croma Vera 2016 Maduro Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cedar and tobacco aromas blend with black-fruit notes and coffee to create a welcoming nose. An expansive palate is full in volume and cut by strong acidity. Lemony oak sits atop flavors of toasty plum and blackberry, while this delivers a lively finish with earth notes. Drink through 2028.
Name: Conde de Siruela 2014 Élite  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Plum, black cherry and gritty notes of tar, asphalt and chalk dust control the nose on this wiry Tempranillo that's grabby, hard and tannic on the palate. Peppery berry-fruit flavors are steady across a bold finish. This still needs time to settle and soften; drink through 2025.
Name: Embocadero 2014  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked berry aromas come with notes of dry spices and sandalwood. A chunky palate is a touch flat and overweight, but not outright flabby or fat. Berry, black-plum and savory baked flavors finish flush and long, with chewy tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Clunia 2014 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Classic Rioja aromas of root beer, cedar, cigar box, olive and earthy baked-berry fruits open this gran reserva. A weighty palate is cut by acidity, while this offers flavors of baked cherry, cassis and spice. A rush of acidity lends length to a finish with tobacco, pepper and dried berry flavors. Drink through 2025.
Name: Baron De Ley 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Warm, slightly cheesy aromas give way to earthy black-fruit notes with baked overtones. This feels tight and firm, with healthy tannins. Black-plum and blackberry flavors are replaced by toasty blackness on the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Vega Clara 2015 Diez Almendros Degusta Secreto  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe berry aromas suggest prune and raisin. Given the nose, it's no surprise that this is plump, chewy and dense on the palate. Roasted berry flavors are at max ripeness and touched up by spice and clove notes, while on the finish this is chunky, with tannic bite. Drink now.
Name: Nubori 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of baking spices, vanilla, dill and toast are more out front than fruit, with oaky graphite in the background. A pulling palate is immediately tannic and resiny. Woody barrel-driven black-fruit flavors are savory, while residual oak is the lead ingredient on the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Val de Los Frailes 2015 Prestigio Tempranillo (Cigales)

Description: Ripe spicy berry aromas are a touch raisiny and hot, which is a proper reflection on the warm 2012 vintage. A balanced palate is just tight enough, while this tastes savory and spicy, with ample oak and berry fruit flavors. A texturally solid finish benefits from core acidity. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2012 Glorioso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy currant and plum aromas show notes of latex and sweet pastry. A tight, rubbing palate runs heavy on the tannins, while black-fruit flavors are chocolaty but lacking in nuance and complexity. Same goes for a full-fruited finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2015 Damana Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral violet aromas blend with boysenberry notes on a fruity nose that avoids the heavy oak character that's common to the region. In the mouth, however, this is choppy and tannic. Basic berry flavors are ripe but not complex, while this is strapping on a finish with standard dark-berry flavors. Drink through 2023.
Name: Cepa 21 2015  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of blackberry, cassis, raisin and vanilla are common for top-level Ribera del Duero. In the mouth, this is rough due to hard tannins, heavy oak extraction and outsize acidity. Cola, blackberry and chocolate flavors are peppery, spicy and heady on a tough-as-nails finish. Drink through 2028.
Name: Matarromera 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A concentrated and potent nose of dark-berry-fruit aromas mixed with cigar box portends a big wine. Confirmation comes on the palate, which is ripe, rough, choppy, tannic and bolstered by lemony acidity. Flavors of bold berry fruits, plum, raw oak and vanilla finish with chocolate and tobacco notes. If you know Ribera del Duero, this is straight from the textbook.
Name: Resalte 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy berry aromas are loaded with gritty notes of black olive and coffee grounds, meaning the nose is none too bright. A choppy palate is rough and drawing, while this tastes of soy sauce, pepper and dark berry fruits. A tough drying jagged finish lowers the smoothness factor on this hard-pounding RDD. Drink through 2030.
Name: Pingón 2014 Torre Pingón Selección  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Dark-plum and baking-spice aromas lead a nose that's warm, murky and a touch unclear. A gritty medium- to full-bodied palate offers spicy plum and raspberry flavors in front of a compact finish with lasting savory notes. Drink through 2020.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2012 Excelso Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Stewed black-fruit aromas are earthy and deep, but lacking in freshness. A full-bodied palate delivers all the expected weight and body of a warm vintage like 2012. Savory prune and cassis flavors peter out on a baked-tasting finish. Drink now.
Name: Vinsacro 2012  Rioja

Description: Soupy berry and raisin aromas are smoky but lack rigidity. An inward-pulling palate is tight due to fairly severe tannins. Dark-plum flavors are savory and a bit oaky, while this is powerful on a muscular finish with rubbery tannins and lasting savory flavors.
Name: Bodegas Bilbainas 2012 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Muddled black-fruit aromas include notes of road tar on a ripe nose that's not entirely fresh. On the palate, this warm-vintage Rioja is drawing and tight. Flavors of currant and plum are raisiny at their base, while this is ripe, meaty and savory tasting on the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2012 Cueva del Monge  (Rioja)

Description: Initial perfumed aromas break down and turn a bit soapy and like red-apple skins. A juicy palate has volume but lacks structure. Plum, wild berry and saucy flavors finish full and wide but without much definition or shape.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Federico Paternina Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Plump berry aromas are solid and sound, but not elevated or special. A tight palate is firm and offers just enough body and richness. Lightly baked berry flavors finish steady, with a touch of licorice.
Name: Hermanos Hernáiz 2016 El Pedal Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy berry and raw oak aromas are more powerful than elegant. A saturated palate with palpable thickness is hard to cut through. Deep but compact cassis and blackberry flavors are hard around the edges, while this fades quickly on the finish for something so big and dark.
Name: Convento Oreja 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky berry aromas are rustic and scratchy as this crianza comes at you with force. A saturated palate is bullish and grabby, while this tastes of ripe blackberry, burnt toast and chocolate. Oak-driven spice and dark-fruit flavors settle with warmth on the finish.
Name: Dominio del Soto 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoke, leather and dark-berry aromas make for a savory and fruity entry on the nose of this bottling. Gritty tannins frame the rugged palate, offering plummy flavors of rhubarb and hickory smoke.
Name: Rabble 2016 Mossfire Ranch Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Creamy earthy berry aromas are a touch nutty and raisiny. Flavors of spiced plum and prune are long-lasting, with a touch of heat and a note of pepper. On the finish, this is dry and spicy but doesn't show many elevated qualities.
Name: Bodegas Corral 2012 Don Jacobo Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Muddled aromas of gritty berry fruits and tomato leaf suggest low ripeness. On the palate, raw acidity is the key player. Fiery red-berry flavors are fairly well oaked, while this simmers but doesn't evolve on the finish.
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of raspberry, plum, tobacco and cedar are a touch reedy and raw. A somewhat dilute and lean palate deals tart cherry and red-plum flavors that hint at sourness. Tangy zesty acidity pumps up finishing salad-dressing-like flavors of vinegar, salt and herbs.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Viña Alarde Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Crisp red-fruit aromas and dusty spice notes convene on a fiery nose. This is hard, smacking and jagged on the palate, with flavors of tomato, red plum and dry oak. On the finish, this returns to the same grating tannic intensity that defines the palate.
Name: Marqués de Reinosa 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Floral aromas of violet grapy blueberry and minimal oak amount to a nose without much tension or intensity. A pulpy fruity palate avoids hard tannins, while this tastes of herbal raspberry and plum with some spice. Scratchiness comes up on a full finish.
Name: Rioja Vega 2014 Crianza Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Description: Raspberry, toast, spice and herbal aromas are pure Rioja. This is crisp and tight as a drum. Raisiny fruit flavors are offset by hard acidity, while this is spicy across a bumpy finish.
Name: Viña Bujanda 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Fiery aromas are herbal and suggestive of lavender. A pinched narrow palate holds briary flavors of herbal raspberry and blueberry. Tannic rub creates friction on a finish with herbal green notes.
Name: Casa del Valle 2014 Orquestal Reserva Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Grapy black-fruit aromas are friendly enough, with a dusting of baking spices. A tight snappy palate ranks as firm and not that giving, while this tastes of saucy plum and berry fruits prior to a dry tight finish with puckery scratchy tannins.
Name: Pata Negra 2016 Gran Selección Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Description: Punchy red-fruit aromas are lightly concentrated and floral. In the mouth, this is smacking and superficially hard. Generic berry and cherry flavors finish rough and tough, with jagged edges.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2016 Selección  (Rioja)

Description: Berry and plum-skin aromas lead to a direct palate with energy but also a sense of rawness. Rough rooty berry flavors are lasting on a tough grabby finish.
Name: Familia Bastida 2016 Vuela  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Heavy berry fruit and oak aromas are low on depth and complexity. This thick Tempranillo is choppy and impermeable. Saucy flavors of herbal plum and tomato finish equally herbal and with saltiness, much like a meat sauce for pasta.
Name: Quintana de Cue 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Lean rubbery berry aromas are raw and pinched, with a hint of vinegar. This Rioja from an average vintage smacks hard with juicy acidity. Standard berry flavors are short and basic, while this is wiry on the finish.
Name: Nubori 2016 Cata Nobilis  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of road tar, blackberry and rubber are a touch chemical but not bad. A raw palate with rubbery tannins is home to generic plum and berry flavors. A dry rubbery-feeling finish is appropriate for this everyday Tempranillo.
Name: Sonsierra 2016  Rioja

Description: Generic berry and plum flavors lead to a pulling palate with clamping tannins and high acidity. Plum, black-fruit and olive flavors are choppy prior to a tight-as-nails finish.
Name: Carlos Serres 2016 Old Vines  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy plum, cherry, spice and tobacco aromas are familiar to Rioja. A high-acid medium-bodied palate is austere and hard as nails. Tart red-fruit flavors finish racy and fiery, with excess gas in the tank.
Name: Aspaldi 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A nose built almost entirely around raw oak is warm and earthy more than fresh and fruity. In the mouth, this is severely tannic and resiny. Hot woody berry flavors are demanding, while this is dry and dominated by the barrel on the finish.
Name: Gómez de Segura 2016 Selección  (Rioja)

Description: Raspberry and red-berry aromas are clean and fresh, but nothing more. A rubbing tannic palate is scratchy, while this organic-grape Rioja provides generic berry flavors that finish with astringency.
Name: Navardia 2016 Made With Organic Grapes  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of mulch and green beans are flat-out underripe. A raw tannic palate and green-berry and plum flavors finish weedy.
Name: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2014 Condado de Haza Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This limited production wine is powerfully concentrated and rich. With wood flavors giving mint and balsamic aromas and dark fruits, the wine is impressively rich and spicy, certainly needing to age further. Drink this impressive wine from 2022.
Name: Quinta do Vallado 2015 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a dark and concentrated wine. The nose suggests sweet hay, while the palate is substantial and loaded with flavors of black raspberry, chocolate and coffee. It's fairly tannic and the astringency should set it up well to accompany a thick cut of beef.
Name: Reustle 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This dark dusty wine is rich, showing fine black fruits and layers of tannins. The wine has a juicy character, full of blackberry flavors that are lifted by the acidity and polished by the wood aging. Drink now–2022.
Name: Quinta de Lemos 2012 Tinta Roriz (Dão)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Smoky on the nose, this bottling shows rustic red-fruit aromas alongside new leather and gingersnap scents. That leathery kick shows on the tip of the sip, and then come waves of red cherry, turned earth and more smoke, with a vanilla finish—a great barbecue wine.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2015 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Description: Aragonez (aka Tempranillo in Spain) is well adapted to the warm southern Alentejo vineyards. The wine is textured, with firm tannins and intense spice, juicy acidity and a rich aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
Name: Cortes de Cima 2014 Aragonez (Alentejano)

Description: The aromas are high toned, with notes of raspberry, earth, spice and mineral. The palate is lighter styled, with the concentration not entirely holding throughout. An impressively long finish caps it off. Still, there are a lot of good things going on.
Name: K Vintners 2015 El Jefe Stoneridge Vineyard Tempranillo (Washington)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a good example of southern Oregon Tempranillo, with light pomegranate and salmonberry fruit and a wash of coffee liqueur. It sets up the finish against earthy tannins, but the overall balance works. About 4% Grenache is included in the blend.
Name: Reustle 2015 Timnah Bloc Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Built upon earthy tannins, this wine has offsetting black-cherry fruit, hints of cola and some brown spices. It was aged for half a year in American oak barrels, half new and half once used.
Name: Guzzo 2016 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Folin vineyard, this is quite light and herbal. The flavors move into a tannic midpalate, with tobacco and tea rather than ripe fruit. It spent almost two years in 100% new French oak, which seems to have sent the fruit packing, at least for the time being.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2015 Reserva Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is quite light in color for the variety. Aromas of fresh tobacco, orange peel and herb are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. It all seems quite dialed back, not appearing to have fully ripened and fleshed out.
Name: DaMa 2015 Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Star anise, caramel, black plum and black currant show on the rich nose of this bottling, which is enhanced with 12% Grenache and 12% Monastrell. There is solid acidic energy to the palate, lifting up the cassis and gingerbread flavors that ride polished tannins into the finish.
Name: Caliza 2014 Sympatico Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated black currant is livened up with hints of espresso, olive and moist earth on the nose of this bottling. There is strong acid and decent tannins on the palate, framing the dark berry and baking-spice flavors.
Name: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2012 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Winemaker: Warren Ellis. This is an interesting selection, made from a grape that is not terribly common to South Africa. The resulting wine offers abundant spicy tones upfront, a cured-meat mélange of coriander and green pepper married to roast beef and cassis. The medium-weight palate offers structured, grippy tannins that carry though the dry, leathery finish. The flavors are tight and black fruit-skin driven, with just a hint of charred oak on the back.
Name: Neil Ellis 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Amper Bo Tempranillo (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's cherry, plum, flower, graphite and spice aormas lead to compact fruit flavors surrounded by firm tannins. Equal parts intrigue and delivery, it needs some time to unwind.
Name: Columbia Winery 2015 Tempranillo (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This broad, inviting Tempranillo offers ripe, robust blackberry, cassis and smoked meat aromas. Its blackberry and fig flavors blast at full volume, persisting into the thick finish with just the right amount of chocolaty oak. Drink through 2032.
Name: García Figuero 2014 Milagros de Figuero  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's heady coffee and mocha aromas come at you off the bat, followed by roasted black fruit scents that scream of many months in new oak. Its cedary berry and cocoa flavors sizzle with lemony acidity, framed by firm tannins. It finishes ripe and hot. Drink through 2040.
Name: García Figuero 2014 Noble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's berry aromas are unencumbered by toasty oak. The palate is saturated and fruity, with well-formed blackberry and dark plum flavors. It's steady, firm and long on the finish. Drink through 2030.
Name: Resalte 2012 Lecco Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This leads with oak-derived smoky, chocolaty aromas, but blackberry, maple and molasses notes fill out the nose. The muscular palate boasts blackberry and black currant flavors, while chocolaty richness is the prime driver of the powerful finish. Drink this brick of a Tempranillo through 2030.
Name: Val Sotillo 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy berry, tobacco and leather aromas announce an old-school Ribera wine with brett in the bouquet. On the palate, this is chewy and meaty, with a full complement of tannins. Its blackberry and cassis flavors are supported by baking spice notes. They lead to a ripe finish loaded with chocolaty richness. Drink through 2034.
Name: Val Sotillo 2011 VS Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Toasty aromas of road tar, tea and baking spices accent this wine's blackberry and oak scents. The palate is plush—rich with fruit but just short of syrupy. Its baked berry, plum and spice flavors lead to a ripe, slightly hot finish. Drink now–2027.
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2012 Óscar Tobía Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The nose of this wine is loaded with mocha, coffee and raisinated fruit notes. The palate offers dark, chocolaty flavors of toasted blackberry and oak, framed by ripe tannins. That oaky chocolate flavor carries over to the ripe, slightly hot finish. Drink through 2028.
Name: La Gitana 2012 Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery pencil eraser scents accent this wine's blackberry and menthol aromas. It's a heavyweight, with chunky blackberry and fig flavors swathed in chocolate notes from aging 30 months in French oak. It remains oaky and thick into the finish. Drink through 2032.
Name: Pinea 2014  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This reserve-level offering is subtle and complex in tones of fig, blackberry, black cherry, leather, espresso and oregano that come together beautifully. There's no need to wait, but it should continue to drink well through 2025.
Name: 2Hawk 2015 Darow Series Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's jammy black plum and berry aromas contain an oaky whiff of milk chocolate. It's saturated and plump, with blackberry, blueberry and cassis flavors. Chocolate and licorice notes show on the woody finish. Drink through 2030.
Name: Alion 2014  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's toasty oak and inky black fruit aromas suggest pencil lead. The palate is full bodied but controlled, with prominent woody flavors of tobacco and vanilla. Savory black fruit and tobacco notes mark the finish. Drink through 2028.
Name: García Figuero 2014 15 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This features top-heavy aromas of cedar and tobacco. It's ribbed with powerful tannins that frame its cassis and baked plum fruit. Those flavors are infused with cedary oak, finishing smooth and chocolaty. Drink through 2030.
Name: Valduero 2011 6 Años Reserva Premium  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This wine's raisin and ripe blackberry aromas include whiffs of cinnamon and nutmeg. The solid, balanced palate pops with acidity and noticeable oak. Vanilla, cinnamon, cassis, tobacco and citrus peel flavors carry into the finish with momentum. Drink through 2026.
Name: Carlos Moro 2014 Oinoz by Claude Gros  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's black fruit aromas come with road tar, leather and raisin notes. It's intensely tannic, with ripe, savory berry and cassis flavors and integrated oak. Chocolate and baked black fruit notes last on the strong, tannic finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Numanthia 2014 Termes  (Toro)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A vast improvement from the previous vintage, this standout wine is a sophisticated expression of a grape that's staking a valid claim to being Southern Oregon's signature red. Black fruit, tanned leather and strong tobacco and clove suggestions combine. The flavors are wrapped in a supple, polished package and show exceptional balance and length.
Name: 2Hawk 2015 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's blackberry, cassis and plum aromas are plump and fruity, with no garish oak notes. On the palate, it's fleshy, with inky blackberry flavors and tapered tannins. Those tannins persist long into the finish. Drink now–2030.
Name: Bodega San Pedro Regalado 2012 Canta Perdices  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral aromas and plenty of black-fruit flavors nicely fill out the full body of this ripe and opulently textured wine. The color is black almost to the rim, the aromas are spiced with vanilla and cocoa, and the flavors are so ripe with dried berries and cherries as to taste slightly sweet on the finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Tempranillo (Fair Play)

Description: This wine's blackberry and raisin aromas come with fig, prune and chocolate notes. Scratchy tannins make for a rugged, chewy palate, with ample tobacco and oak flavors and ripe blackberry and cassis notes. Hints of prune and chocolate emerge on the finish. Drink through 2027.
Name: Covila 2014 II AEX  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy, leafy plum and savory aromas open this vibrant, traditional Rioja with a flush but subtle palate. Its plum, blackberry and tea flavors are steady and spicy. Drink through 2023.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2011 Excelso  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of prune, cassis and marzipan are surprisingly rich for this cold and difficult vintage in Rioja. It's full bodied and tannic, with plum, blackberry and prune flavors. Dark berry and meat notes mark the finish.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2013 Reserva Especial Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's earthy, mature plum, currant and raspberry aromas are spicy and defined. The mouthfeel is marked by drawing tannins and citrusy acidity. Bold flavors of currant, red plum and cherry emerge alongside a cocoa note. Drink now–2032.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2010 HZ Abascal Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This opens with heavy, earthy blackberry aromas, seeming chunky. The potent palate is saturated with beefy plum and blackberry flavors, which remain at full volume into the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Muga 2012 Reserve Selección Especial  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy, mint-laced berry, tobacco and oak aromas introduce this wine. It's solid but ordinary, with good structure. Its intense berry flavors are matched by loud oak notes, yet it remains lively on the finish, with preserving acidity.
Name: Pata Negra 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though the vineyard source is not indicated, the texture and flavors of this wine speak to biodynamic farming. It's loaded with dark, bloody flavors and accents, along with a whiff of wet moss. On the palate, it recalls cool climate Syrah with its mix of umami, herb and cured meat flavors. Play close attention, and it will slowly reveal hidden pleasures.
Name: Holloran 2015 Tempranillo (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: The nose of this wine is rich but a bit flat, with plum and raisin notes. It's a full-bodied Rioja with a plodding palate, earthy berry and plum flavors and tea and dark spice accents. It finishes meaty and chocolaty.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2013 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Initial gritty aromas suggestive of coffee grounds give way to richer notes of molasses, leather and bretty berry fruit in this wine. Its full-bodied palate is ruled by choppy tannins and rugged plum and spice flavors. Those flavors lose clarity as oxidized notes settle in.
Name: Salcis 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine offers gorgeous fruit flavors, subdued spices and great balance. It feels poised on the palate, lifted by good acidity, braced by moderate tannins and well filled out by plum, prune and cherry flavors shaded by hints of nutmeg and vanilla.
Name: The Winery SF 2014 Tempranillo (North Coast)

Description: This wine's jammy berry and spice cake aromas give the impression of oak. It's dense and heavy, with ripe tannins, baked black fruit and spice cake flavors and a raisiny finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Viñedos de Paganos 2014 Calados del Puntido Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's oaky plum and berry aromas are more savory than fruity. The palate is raw, with chewy tannins and oaky plum flavors. It's meaty and tough on the finish, the fruit secondary to oaky, beefy flavors. Drink through 2026.
Name: Muga 2014 Reserva Unfiltered  (Rioja)

Description: Earth, oak and cherry aromas introduce this burly Tempranillo. It's heavy on the palate, with hard, grippy tannins and ripe flavors of berries, black plums and oak. A raisiny note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Museum 2014 Reserva Tinta del Pais (Cigales)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is dark and brooding, showing ultraripe flavors, a full body and a thick layer of velvety tannins. It has well-concentrated blackberry and roasted plum aromas and focused fruit flavors that show just a touch of oak spice.
Name: Amador Cellars 2014 Estate Tempranillo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Earthy berry, plum, spice and cocoa aromas announce a wine that's ready to drink. Lemony acidity and firm tannins make for a structured palate, with textbook Rioja reserva flavors of plum, cherry and tobacco. Drink through 2022.
Name: Carlos Serres 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dense raisin and blackberry aromas tilt this in the direction of overripe. On the full, beefy palate, grating tannins frame spicy prune and cassis flavors. A heavy, tannic finish confirms the wine's overtly ripe character, with toasty oak influence.
Name: Bodegas Leda 2015 Viñas Viejas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine exudes aromas of new leather, sandalwood and black cherries, while the flavors are ripe and mouthfilling. Plenty of tannin coats the palate before the wine slowly releases dark-chocolate and cherry-candy notes on the finish.
Name: Septentrio 2014 Tempranillo (Lake County)

Description: This crianza's plum and blackberry aromas are fruity and firm, with modest oak. It's lively in feel, with zesty acidity covering slight oxidation on the midpalate. Its cherry, plum and wild berry flavors lead to a chocolate- and baking spice-inflected finish.
Name: Bodegas Landaluce 2015 Fincas de Landaluce Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's blackberry, rubber and tea aromas make for a subtle entry. It's firm and acidic, almost raw. Cocoa, tea and coffee notes deepen its spicy plum and berry flavors. It feels warm and solid on a reserved finish.
Name: Valserrano 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's leafy, spicy red fruit aromas grow leathery with airing. The palate is tightly wound, with unyielding tomato-like acidity. Its peppery red plum and tomato flavors show hints of tobacco, earth and oxidation.
Name: Bodega Classica 2012 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This bodega usually delivers solid, traditional Rioja reds. This one opens with heavy oak, cheese and horse aromas, along with earthy berry fruit. The palate glares with oak and screeching acidity, yielding vanilla, wood and tangy plum flavors. A buttered popcorn note and distant fruit flavors carry into the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Eduardo Garrido García 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This jammy, pulpy wine opens with blackberry and cassis aromas and follows through with a mashup of blackberry and black plum flavors. It finishes on soy sauce and stewed berry notes.
Name: Resalte 2015 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This Tempranillo's ripe berry aromas devolve into leathery, raisiny notes as they unwind. It's dense and chewy on the palate, with herbal raspberry and plum flavors and a hard finish marked by raisiny notes and hint of oxidation.
Name: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2015 Mil Cepas Vino de Parcela Cencibel (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: This wine's grapy blackberry aromas convey generic quality. The palate is ripe and pulpy, with toasty black fruit flavors and a dash of pepper. It's in good shape thanks to fresh acidity.
Name: Finca Antigua 2015 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: This wine's rooty berry, spice and herb aromas are intriguing and particular. The palate is rough, with pulpy plum and spicy currant flavors and a briary herbal undercurrent.
Name: Finca Allende 2011  Rioja

Description: This wine's earthy berry aromas include notes of cheese and compost. It's plump and awkward on the palate, with oxidized plum and berry flavors and a finish marked by rubbery tannins.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's earthy berry aromas include a touch of mint and chocolate. It has a crisp mouthfeel, with plum and citrus fruit. It's potently woody on the finish.
Name: Viña Otano 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's spiced plum and berry aromas show hints of animal fur and leather. The palate is rough around the edges, offering plum and berry flavors that have veered toward prune. Savory spice and chocolaty oak notes mark the finish.
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's earthy berry aromas are as cool and herbal as root beer. It's a solid value Rioja, with rubbery tannins that grip the palate and earthy plum and oaky chocolate flavors. The finish is dry, and it fades with a hint of cocoa.
Name: Bodegas Fos 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: The Oregon designation suggests this includes both southern Oregon fruit and grapes from the Eola-Amity Hills. It's an affordable look at an emerging specialty for the state, with olive, bacon fat and dried rosemary notes accenting light, red berry-like fruit. Tannins firm up the finish.
Name: Holloran 2015 Stafford Hill Tempranillo (Oregon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's graphite, herb, orange peel and cherry aromas are followed by light plum flavors backed by soft tannins. It trails off on the finish.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2013 Winemaker's Select Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This offers spicy berry and cassis aromas and oak-derived clove and nutmeg scents. The palate is ripe but wayward, with a flimsy structure. Its oaky plum, raisin and nutmeg flavors finish with even more oak.
Name: Burgo Viejo 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from a few vineyards from the AVA, this offers aromas of green wood, cherry and tobacco. Its plum and cherry flavors are pleasant accents to a core of intense tannins.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2014 Reserve Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: Leafy, spicy red fruit aromas lead to lean, tomatoey cranberry and red plum flavors in this wine. It finishes spicy and reedy, with prominent acidity.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Santiago Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This wine delivers a frontal blast of chocolaty oak and char. Its severely tannic palate overloads its generic black fruit with barrel notes. It finishes hot, with briary touches.
Name: Ovidio García 2014 Esencia Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)

Description: Warm, leathery aromas of baked berries, molasses, animal fur and tobacco announce a heavily oaked style of Rioja.
