Despite all the oak, it's lean and astringent on the palate, a reflection of 2013's cool, rainy conditions. Its dried berry flavors are overcrowded by toasty, resiny oak straight through the finish.
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2013 Selección Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This leads with oaky berry aromas and a whiff of menthol. The palate deals salty plum and berry flavors, a burnt note of char and citrusy acidity. It's clipped and short.
Name: Cuna de Reyes 2011 Reserva Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)

Description: Grassy scents accent this wine's prune and raisin aromas. It's chunky but also high in acid, so the mouthfeel has balance issues. Its raisiny berry flavors are slightly oxidized and spicy on the finish.
Name: Vallobera 2014 Finca Vallobera  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's smoky black fruit aromas come with a licorice note. It's full in body, with spicy plum and currant flavors and an oaky, salty finish.
Name: Beronia 2014 Coleción Beronia Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Description: Unintegrated oak, gritty road tar and earthy berry aromas form the opening of this problematic reserva. Its acidity is almost off the charts, creating scratchiness and tension on the palate. It's tart and tomatoey in flavor, with a coating of oak and vanilla.
Name: El Coto 2013 Coto de Imaz Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This uncomplicated wine features ripe, jammy black fruit aromas. It's full bodied and fleshy on the palate, with blackberry and black plum flavors and a springy finish filled with chocolate notes.
Name: Campos Reales 2015 Selección Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's appealing fresh plum, cherry, pencil lead, wood spice and dried herb aromas are followed by generous fruit and barrel flavors that bring a lightly grainy feel. It's an intriguing example of this variety.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2015 Estate Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Forced oak aromas of milk chocolate and vanilla blend with blackberry and dark plum scents in this wine. It's abrasively tannic and rubbery on the palate, with stewed berry flavors and more oak notes. The finish is scratchy.
Name: Emilio Moro 2015  Ribera del Duero

Description: This wine's heavy black fruit aromas lack freshness. The palate is similar: it's both stewy and tannic. Its raisiny black fruit flavors are buried in oak, tasting much like a cup of black coffee on the hot, heavy finish. It's too overripe and bulky, even for the warm year.
Name: Heras Cordon 2012 Hacienda José Luis Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's aroma seems shut down even after aggressive aeration. On the palate, it delivers direct but rather generic red wine flavors, with herbal notes and stiff tannins. It finishes with a hint of alcoholic heat.
Name: Holloran 2014 La Chenaie Tempranillo (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: This wine's gritty black fruit aromas bring road tar to mind. Its full mouthfeel is cut by acidity, keeping it from feeling soupy. Its tart, spicy plum and currant flavors finish with overt oak, punchy acidity and heat.
Name: Sancho Barón 2014  Rioja

Description: Mild, controlled aromas of spiced cherry, road tar and earthy coffee form the nose of this wine. The palate is restrained, with integrated spiced berry and dried leaf flavors. For an everyday Rioja of quality, look no further.
Name: Marqués del Atrio 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This leads with tire rubber, asphalt and beef jerky aromas, seeming smoky, savory and oaky. Grippy tannins frame its slightly stewed berry flavors. It finishes on notes of licorice, smoked meat and baked blackberry.
Name: Señorío de Sotillo 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This wine's floral, grapy aromas are woody and a touch volatile. It's jammy and mouthfilling, with wiry acidity and soft tannins. Its jammy berry and black plum flavors finish flush, without much structure.
Name: Volver 2015 Single Vineyard Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's grapy, jammy raspberry aromas are not the stuff of great Ribera del Duero. It lacks direction on the palate, tasting of herbal, medicinal plums and currants with a scratchy finish.
Name: Dominio de la Abadesa 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Gritty aromas of road tar and burnt wood share space with herbaceous berry fruit scents on the nose of this wine. It's rough in feel, with dark, spicy flavors of berries and chocolate. The finish is herbal, peppery and consistent with the rest.
Name: Lar de Sotomayor 2015  Rioja

Description: This opens with vanilla, dill and fiery black fruit aromas. In the mouth, it's linear, with tomato, plum and oak spice flavors that finish with lively acidity and some alcoholic heat.
Name: Larchago 2014 Pagos de Tahola Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's herbal plum and berry aromas are dry and subtly green. It's tight and racy, with raw tannins, currant and red plum flavors and a dry, herbal finish marked by lemony acidity.
Name: Campo Viejo 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is yet another very hard 2014 Ribera del Duero, devoid of elegance Its cherry, berry and herbal aromas lack focus, and its black fruit and toast flavors finish with scraping tannins.
Name: Cathar 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Peppery, beefy aromas and rich deep berry flavors highlight this full-bodied and firm-textured wine. It is bold and mouthfilling, with a touch of ripeness on the finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Tempranillo (Amador County)

Description: This wine's tea and spiced plum aromas come with a hint of orange peel. It tastes of reedy raspberries and currants on the narrow palate. Moderate oak spice is detectable on the lean finish.
Name: Beronia 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's earthy plum and vanilla aromas are cheesy and rough. It's round on the palate, with spiced plum, herb and oak-based vanilla flavors that flatten out on the finish, showing mild oxidation.
Name: Beronia 2014 Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's berry aromas carry a faint hint of animal hide. The palate is raw with acidity yet saturated with roasted berry flavors and minty, oaky notes. Those wood suggestions linger on the edgy finish.
Name: Bodegas Eguren 2015 Condado de Eguren Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's berry and cherry cola aromas seem candied and medicinal. On the palate, it's tight with rugged tannins. Its spiced plum and tobacco flavors have a burnt character while the finish is marked by tannic dryness.
Name: Finca El Encinal 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Stiffly structured, this wine holds tight to its blackberry and black-cherry flavors with very firm tannins that leave a drying sensation. It has a good core of ripe black cherry and black pepper but will need to pair with a fat juicy piece of meat to tame its astringency.
Name: Matchbook 2014 Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)

Description: This wine's gamy blackberry and raisin aromas struggle to hold up. The palate is astringently acidic, with coconut- and vanilla-laden plum and berry flavors. Those oak accents preside on the finish.
Name: Val de Los Frailes 2014 Roble Tempranillo (Cigales)

Description: Foxy plum and violet aromas introduce this basic Tempranillo. It's broad on the palate, with herbal plum and berry flavors, modest acidity and little structure or intensity.
Name: Campos Reales 2016 Canforrales Clásico Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Thistlecroft vineyard, this was produced and bottled by Eola Hills winery. It's an oaky, blocky wine, with potent vanilla syrup scents and flavors that marginalize the fruit and disguise any varietal typicity.
Name: Eliana 2015 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: This Rioja's gritty berry aromas include hints of pepper, asphalt and animal fur. It's clipped and raw, with oak-laden herbal plum and berry flavors. A burnt oak character rests heavily on the finish.
Name: Pingao 2015  Rioja

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's raisiny aromas include smoked meat and chocolate notes. It's intensely tannic on the palate, tasting mostly of chocolaty oak and vanilla. That oak dominates the finish, leaving a carob flavor.
Name: Bodegas Copaboca 2015 Finca Feroes Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Heavy oak dominates the nose of this wine, creating milky notes of vanilla and carob. The palate is choppy with tannins and herbal red plum and currant flavors. It ends with mint and green notes.
Name: Bodegas El Cidacos 2011 Conde Otiñano Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's jumbled aromas of coffee grounds, burnt oak and berries lead to a tight, pulling palate with hard tannins. Its heavy oak and soupy berry flavors are accented by carob and green notes. On the finish, it's overtly tannic.
Name: Milcampos 2015 Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This smells of spices, barrel char and milk chocolate. Its raw, tannic palate shows highly evident oak, tasting of reedy plum and wood. The finish is tough.
Name: Bodegas El Cidacos 2012 Conde Otiñano Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This second label wine from Leda smells flat, raisiny and overripe. A soupy, heavy palate follows the nose, delivering stewed berry and raisin flavors. Stewed fruit and cinnamon notes mark the close.
Name: Bodegas Leda 2015 Mas de Leda Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's furry berry aromas bring a wet dog to mind. It's at once creamy and acidic on the palate, with chocolaty oak and gamy, herbal berry flavors. It finishes with a lasting note of carob.
Name: Bodegas Fariña 2015 Spanish Sons Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Herbal, jammy berry flavors lead the nose of this blocky-feeling Tempranillo. Its stewed plum and berry flavors finish peppery, gritty and herbal, with little structure.
Name: Sinfonía 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Considering that 2015 was a good, albeit hot, vintage, this is surprisingly edgy, with pronounced acidity. Its tart currant and plum flavors are lean and sour, lacking ripeness and richness.
Name: Finca Constancia 2015 Parcela 23 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: After a couple of good vintages, this wine was clearly affected by 2014's marginal harvest conditions. The nose is gamy and full of olive and damp earth notes. The palate is tannic beyond belief, leading to a scratchy finish. In between, there are dark berry and coffee flavors.
Name: Tierra Aranda 2014  Ribera del Duero

Description: Baked, raisiny aromas announce an overripe wine. The thick, jammy palate matches the nose, delivering prune and baked plum flavors prior to a stewy finish.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This Tempranillo's cranberry and currant aromas are lean and raw. It feels capped and rough on the palate, with acidic scratchiness and choppy plum and currant flavors.
Name: El Cortijillo 2016 Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This features incongruous stewed berry, graphite and tea aromas. The palate is soupy, with burnt oak, mint and grass flavors.
Name: Sensible 2015 Tudela de Duero Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's savory berry aromas include a strong blast of mustard and leafy, minty notes. The palate is choppy, acidic and raw, with clove-laced sour berry flavors. It's thin and out of balance on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Fariña 2015 Mascaradas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Scattershot aromas of green herbs, mint and blueberries introduce this hard, flat wine. Its plum flavors are raw and minty, and the finish is harsh with green notes.
Name: Finca Constancia 2015 Altozano Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's salad dressing and mustard aromas signal some volatility. It's jammy and shapeless on the palate, with saucy berry and mustard flavors. It was tasted twice with slightly varying results.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Fincas Valdemacuco Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: The rusty color, the subtle scents of root beer, smoked meat and leafy berry fruits, and a general air of complexity all help this fine Gran Reserva make its mark early on. A cushioned palate is both light yet deep. Ripe berry, mulled plum, fig and prune flavors finish with chocolaty notes of raspberry and plum. This is a classic Gran Reserva in peak form—the best Montecillo wine in decades. Drink through 2024.
Name: Montecillo 2001 Gran Reserva Selección Especial  (Rioja)

Description: Deep in color and floral aromas as well as still-ripe blackberry and plum scents, this Gran Reserva from one of the best vintages in modern Rioja history is chewy to its core, with a beam of bright acidity maintaining great shape. Bold berry and plum flavors are on display many years after harvest, while a ripe finish is spicy and confirms excellence; drink through 2028.
Name: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2001 200 Monges Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: From a ripe year, this dark, single-vineyard Rioja is big and saturated. Aromas of earthy blackberry and tomato are not shy or subtle. Spiced black plum and salty black-fruit flavors land on a full finish that slowly ends with dark and spicy afternotes. Drink through 2025.
Name: Finca Allende 2009 Calvario  (Rioja)

Description: Charred smoky aromas mask robust berry scents. Deep plum and berry fruit creates a flush texture. Full oaky flavors of blackberry and black plum are spicy, dry and chocolaty on the finish. Given how hard it was to make good wine in Rioja in 2013, this is excellent. Drink through 2032.
Name: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2013 Macán  (Rioja)
Winery: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA

Description: Alluring aromas of olive, cola, spiced plum and ripe berry fruits are smooth and round, not pushy. A plush palate is layered and balanced. Plum, black currant and prune flavors are earthy, spicy and at peak maturity. On the finish, this aged Tempranillo is like excavating new layers of the same wine. Drink through 2024.
Name: Larchago 2000 Chavarri Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A barnyard aroma is tempered by notes of coffee and baked berries. This is a rugged, old-school Toro, with scraping tannins and lemony acidity. Flavors of plum, lemon peel, tobacco and vanilla are deep and thorough. A burly finish with live-wire tannins and acidity keep this jacked-up Tempranillo on edge. Drink through 2026.
Name: Rejadorada 2012 Sango Reserva  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Toasty oak and mint aromas infuse a sense of darkness to the nose of this full-bodied wine. Bold acidity cuts through the woody weight to give balance on the palate, with flavors of berry and cassis. This is dry and substantive on the finish, which tastes of salt, baking spices and more berry fruits. Drink through 2028.
Name: Valduero 2015 I Unacepa  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A bold, smoky nose of black fruits and toasty oak is aggressive and unsettled. This is deep, chewy and severely tannic, with a sandpaper sensation to the mouthfeel. Spiced-up cassis and berry flavors come with earth and tobacco notes. On the finish, this is powerful and hard, with a note of fine cigar. Drink through 2028.
Name: Elias Mora 2012 Reserva  (Toro)

Description: Rubbery blackberry and peppery spice aromas lead to a palate with piercing acidity that might be perceived as shrill. Tangy red-plum flavors are so intense and shear that there's a citric element to this cool-vintage Rioja. On the finish, which is racy and choppy in feel, spice notes return. Drink through 2030.
Name: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2013 Macán Clásico  (Rioja)
Winery: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA

Description: Stewy aromas take time to show their best, which includes a floral note of violet to go with earthy baked blackberry. An abrupt palate revolves around choppy tannins. Flavors of soy and hoison sauce accompany stewed berry notes prior to a drying finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Uro 2011  Toro

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Roasted blackened aromas of berry fruits and black currant are a touch rough and could use more time to settle. A crisp snappy palate is intense, angular and showing grainy hard tannins. Spicy woody flavors of clove and campfire are intermixed with plum and berry fruit, while this feels lively, acidic and a bit fiery on the finish. Drink through 2030.
Name: Astrales 2015  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe smoky aromas are oaky and full, with rooty sweetness and some heat. High acidity creates core intensity, and overall this feels more punchy and acidic than in prior years. Woody spicy peppery flavors of plum and currant finish fresh and ripped, with residual oak, spice, herb and plum flavors. Drink through 2028.
Name: Emilio Moro 2015 Malleolus  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Gramercy Estate, Les Collines and Olsen vineyards, this wine was aged in a mixture of new and neutral American and French oak. The aromas are reserved, with notes of spice, raspberry, graphite and red cherry along with pleasing herb accents. The flavors show a lot of nuance and sophistication along with a tart finish laced with orange peel notes. Soft tannins provide support. It's a winner.
Name: Gramercy 2014 Inigo Montoya Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Saucy red-fruit aromas are aided by a subtle scent of old wood and barnyard, all of which are throwback characteristics. A full, grabby palate is rife with grape-skin tannins, while spicy plum and berry flavors are ripe enough to suggest prune. A firm, peppery-tasting finish is right for this quality Gran Reserva; drink through 2026.
Name: Bodegas Corral 2004 Don Jacobo Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy berry aromas are ripe and exhibit integrated oak, earth and leather notes. A tight but bold palate with tension delivers bright berry and cherry flavors backed by a hint of chocolate on a balanced finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Atalayas de Golbán 2014 Torre d'Golbán Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe toasty chocolaty aromas of prune and fig turn more volatile and jumpy with air. A tight perky palate with bold tartaric acidity is home to flavors of oak, vanilla, tobacco and spicy plum and berry fruits. Flavors of mocha and chocolate-chip cookie soften up an otherwise intense finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Uro 2011 Selección  (Toro)

Description: Light aromas of citrus and lemon peel suggest a lean aged wine. On the palate, this is linear, without a lot of body or layering. High-toned plum and citrus flavors are mostly monotone on the finish except for a light dusting of spice.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 1999 Excelso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Wiry aromas of blackberry and cherry are scratchy and reduced more than smooth and expansive. This Rioja is racy and fresh on the palate, with all sorts of verve. Flavors of plum and black currant are touched up by clove and pepper notes, while this shows dry oak and peppery spice on a firm finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Landaluce 2015 Capricho de Landaluce  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe aromas border on raisin and hoison sauce, with savory, baked berry notes. This is decidedly plump and chunky on the palate, with a jammy mouthfeel. Blackberry, chocolate and peppery spice flavors finish oaky in a traditional Rioja way.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Mild cherry and berry aromas include a dash of baking spices. A crisp racy palate is based on fresh acidity and tight tannins. Earthy plum, cherry and currant flavors are the slightest bit oxidized, while this is steady and sturdy on the finish.
Name: Valduero 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Big aromas of coffee, spice cake and earthy black fruits slip towards raisin and murk. This sports a bulky palate with grating tannins. Stewy black-fruit flavors are accented by oaky clove and nutmeg notes, while this stays woody and spicy on the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Arrocal 2014 Selección  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Plum and raspberry aromas are fresh and jammy, with a mushroom note. On the palate, this aged Rioja is wide but with raw tannins that hammer. Spicy but drawing red-fruit flavors are peppery and lean on a finish that turns tart as it winds down.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2007 Federico Paternina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Foresty berry aromas are oaky, earthy and not overly ripe, with barrel-driven notes of clove and chocolate. This has rough tannins and a scratchy mouthfeel. Herbal plum flavors are woody and spicy, with a strong taste of clove on the finish.
Designation: Finca La Mina Reserva Single Vineyard
Name: Pradorey 2014 Finca La Mina Reserva Single Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This is all Dineen Vineyard (Rattlesnake Hills) fruit, aged in a mixture of neutral and twice-filled French oak barrels—a rare look at this variety in the state without overt oak influence. Aromas of pencil eraser, gummy bear, tobacco and spice are followed by plentiful dried and fresh tobacco flavors that show a reserved styling.
Name: Temporal 2015 Temp Tempranillo (Washington)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are leathery and oaky, with a hint of prune. A chunky, plump palate is fairly resiny in feel. Flavors of vanilla along with old-style oak and tobacco interplay with berry-fruit notes that push up against overripe. On the finish, this holds onto its overt oak-influenced character.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Cottony plum and berry aromas are a touch soapy. This is plodding and on the heavy side. Saturated stewy berry and spice flavors are chocolaty and oaky on the finish, as well as herbal. This offers a lot, but it's coarse, jumpy and suffers a bit under its own weight.
Name: Gómez de Segura 2013 Finca Ratón Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Musky earthy berry aromas come with a note of graphite. In the mouth, this is raw and lacks totality. Flavors of plum skins and grape skins are slightly oxidized and finish with herbal raspberry and currant notes.
Name: Heras Cordon 2013 Hacienda José Luis Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy dry aromas of plum and cherry are classy and traditional. A tight and crisp palate feels lemony due to high acidity, while this tastes of dry salty plum and currant. Oak spice, clove and cocoa flavors settle in on a woody finish.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2006 Santiago Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A light red color and earthy aromas of dried cherry and cinnamon oversell a linear palate that's acidic and pushes hard to the middle. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors finish long and narrow on a wood spice note.
Name: Bodegas Lacort 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Up-front creamy oak leads to aromas of root beer along with dusty berry fruits. This Crianza has a heavy pounding palate with protruding tannins. Herbal blueberry and plum flavors are fully oaked and thus taste forced, pushy and candied through the finish.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Puerta Vieja Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Toast, chocolate, tobacco and rooty aromas precede a racy linear palate that's so streamlined it's sharp. Tart plum and raspberry flavors are soured by lemony acidity, while this is raw and nervy on an intense finish.
Name: Rioja Vega 2013 9 Barricas  (Rioja)

Description: Heavy oak results in aromas of maple, clove and wood resin. On the palate, this is sticky and chewy, with rough tannins. Much like this smells, it tastes of wood, clove and milk chocolate more than clean fruit. A spicy clove-driven finish is dense and cheesy.
Name: Bodegas Fariña 2012 Dama de Toro Crianza  (Toro)

Description: A roasted gritty nose suggests both age and underripeness. A rubbery palate is more jagged than smooth, while this tastes of salty berry fruits and plum. A dry finish goes quickly, leaving an aftertaste of tart red fruits and tomato leaf.
Name: Urbina 1999 Selección  (Rioja)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of brown sugar, strawberry, mint and wood spice lead to red-fruit flavors on the lighter side of medium bodied, with a grip of tannins and bitter notes on the finish. It's an unusual offering of this variety.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Painted Hills Vineyard Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Roasted berry, compost and earthy aromas are jumbled and not entirely fresh. This is narrow and resiny in feel, with oaky flavors of clove, milk chocolate and resiny berry fruits. Overall, there's not a lot to this other than oaky makeup.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Selección  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy aromas of baked fruits and leather struggle to convey a sense of full ripeness. A tight acidic palate is hard and drawing, while this tastes of oxidized plum in front of a snappy finish.
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2015 VII  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy, underripe berry aromas are raw, stalky and roasted. This feels edgy, not smooth or elegant. Saucy flavors of red plum and currant are lean and snappy on the finish.
Name: Viñestral 2015 Tinto Joven  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Prune and raisin aromas and flavors are so dominant that this is exposed as an overripe wine with cooked characteristics. While not awful, there's no balance, acidity or life to this.
Name: Trus 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This wine's blueberry and cassis aromas are accented by wet clay notes. Its saturated palate is so dense it requires a drill to get through in this youthful stage. Offering deep blackberry and dark chocolate flavors, it finishes with melting tannins and a lasting note of burnt wood. Drink through 2035.
Name: Finca Allende 2015 Gaminde Single Vineyard Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Description: Finca Allende wines are back in the U.S., and 2015 is a fine vintage to debut this single-vineyard Tempranillo. Its ripe aromas suggest berry and prune, with floral highlights. Lemony acidity bolsters its warm, toasty blackberry and plum flavors. Agile in build, it shifts gears like a fine-tuned transmission. Drink through 2035.
Name: Finca Allende 2015 Mingortiz Single Vineyard Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's blackberry and cherry aromas are dark and ripe, with leathery complexity. It's full and balanced, with tannins that are just edgy enough to lend structure to the baked berry, chocolate and meat flavors. The long finish is laced with earthy notes and bold acidity. Drink through 2029.
Name: Valderiz 2014  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, meaty aromas of black fruit and oak announce a well-made wine with nice balance between ripeness and structure. Its creamy and a bit thick on the palate, offset by hard tannins. It finishes with chocolaty oak and savory berry flavors. Drink this serious red through 2026.
Name: Peñalba Herraiz 2014 Carravid  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This rust-tinted wine's roasted plum, currant, olive and rubber aromas lead to a mature palate with lasting acidity. Its balsamic berry and plum flavors are a touch oaky yet seem ready to drink. A meaty note accents the finish.
Name: Val de Los Frailes 2006 Pago de las Costanas Tempranillo (Cigales)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Exceedingly ripe aromas of chocolate and raisin hint at a cooked wine, but on the palate this redeems itself. Yes, it's extracted and syrupy, but a bright core of acidity brings it back to earth. Its herbal berry and fudge flavors come with more than enough oak, recalling prune, blackberry and chocolate layer cake on the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Valduero 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This giant of a Tempranillo is woolly on the nose but also full of berry and spice notes. Its saturated, tannic palate places size over elegance, tasting of creamy vanilla, marshmallow, black cherry and cassis. Drink through 2030.
Name: Clunia 2014 Finca El Rincón de Clunia Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This modern blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot offers spicy, leathery berry aromas and a complex hint of dried cheese. The palate is saturated and lacking finesse, driving spicy brandied berry and chocolate flavors into the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Finca Río Negro 2012 Cogolludo-Guadalajara Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: This wine offers a mix of floral, berry and earthy aromas on the nose. It reflects its fine vintage, displaying firm tannins on a tight palate. Dried plum, cherry, tomato and herbal flavors finish with tension and wiry freshness. Drink through 2027.
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2005 I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's richly oaked blackberry and cassis aromas include hints of tobacco and sawdust. Its saturated palate is hard with rubbery tannins, suggesting it needs time to age. Its oaky, inky black fruit flavors finish toasty and dark, with tobacco and cigar box notes. Drink 2021–2038.
Name: Proelio 2015 Cepa a Cepa  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's black fruit aromas are smoky with chocolaty oak and animal notes. On the palate, severe, citrusy acidity narrows down its savory plum, wood and lemon flavors. With so much youthful oak and acidity, it's wiry and angular now. Drink from 2020.
Name: CVNE 2015 Real de Asúa  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine offers aromas of leather, earth, and berries. The palate is intensely concentrated and jammy, with brambly blackberry and cassis flavors that show a minty herbal side. Roasted, earthy notes rise up on the finish. Drink through 2030.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Hacienda Zorita Magister Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: This Tempranillo Mexicano is a wide load, starting with its earthy, stewy black fruit aromas. The palate is scratchy, with full-size, abrasive tannins. Loud peppery blackberry and chocolate flavors finish with a fiery burn and strong black coffee and charred beef notes. Drink through 2024.
Name: Santos Brujos 2013 Tempranillo (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: This wine's appealing cherry and plum aromas feature an oaky note suggestive of maple. It's medium in body, its spicy, oak-aided flavors of cherry and currant driven long into the finish by lively acidity. It ends with tobacco and chocolate notes. Drink through 2020.
Name: Muruve 2013 Crianza  (Toro)

Description: This wine's earthy plum and berry aromas include classic notes of tobacco and vanilla. Its solid, balanced palate delivers ripe berry, prune, cocoa and oak flavors prior to a warm, lightly herbal finish with a hint of raisin. Drink through 2022.
Name: Campo Viejo 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This is full and dense but not heavy. Its ripe, smoky aromas include balsamic berry, tobacco, vanilla and lemon peel notes. Spicy into the finish, its earthy plum and raspberry flavors are loaded with dry oak. Drink through 2023.
Name: Beronia 2011 Reserva Tempranillo-Graciano-Mazuelo  (Rioja)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Light leather and barnyard notes lead the way, suggesting this wine wine is starting to dry out. The fruit is leathery rather than fresh, and the tannins have a marked astringency. That said, the style emulates many Riojas—a fair standard. Drink now–2022.
Name: Ryan Rose 2015 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Cherry and berry aromas come with a darker hint of road tar in this wine, accented by herbal notes. The palate is tight with lemony acidity and bold tannins, featuring dry, spicy red plum and cherry flavors. On the finish, it's dry, peppery and lightly herbal.
Name: Uro 2012 Finca la Rana  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This impresses with bold berry and spice aromas. On the palate, it's wiry in feel, with pounding acidity and hard tannins. Its salty, earthy plum and red berry flavors are fully oaked, with a severely dry and high-acid finish. Drink through 2027.
Name: Conde de Siruela 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's earthy berry and olive aromas are a bit rubbery. On the palate, it's raw and choppy but not too rough or intense. Its salty, lightly herbal berry and plum flavors end on a savory note.
Name: Dominio Romano 2015 Camino Romano  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vibrant fruit flavors and a very firm tannic texture peg this wine as one to age for a few years. It combines cranberry and cherry aromas with deeper black-cherry and cassis flavors that stay lively due to good acidity.
Name: Las Positas 2014 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This crianza is intense, its ripe blackberry and cassis aromas tinged with oak. Loud flavors of black plum, coffee and spice are pushed by lemony acidity into the toasty, strong-boned but narrow finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Protos 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This bright and lively Tempranillo offers concentrated berry and plum aromas with a touch of oak. Grippy and a touch abrasive, it tastes of blackberry and subtle oak, finishing salty and savory, with mild heat.
Name: Bodegas Martinez Corta 2016 Cepas Antiguas Selección Privada  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine smells a touch minty and green. It's tight, muscular and tannic on the palate, with oaky, herbal berry fruit and a firm, chalky finish.
Name: Finca La Mata 2015  Ribera del Duero

Description: This wine's dried cherry and plum aromas are dusty and earthy, with hints of latex and rubber. Its grippy, tough palate offers briny, savory flavors of earthy berry fruits and oak. Salty and drying on the finish, those fruit notes taste roasted, with little to no brightness.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's raisin and prune aromas are accented by marzipan, tobacco and oak notes. Ripe flavors of blackberry and raisin are offset by citrusy acidity, creating rawness on an otherwise concentrated palate. It's extracted, acidic and a bit disjointed on the finish.
Name: Protos 2015 27  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's blackberry, grilled meat and olive aromas are a bit rustic. It's honest on the palate, with stewed fruit, spiced plum and herbal flavors that finish with bold acidity. A no-frills but good Ribera del Duero.
Name: Torres 2014 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tannin management is improving for many Oregon Tempranillos, and this is a good example. Its light, peppery red fruit is cloaked in pretty barrel flavors: baking spice, mocha, almond paste. The alcohol has come down significantly from the 2014 bottling, to good effect.
Name: Delfino 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This late release offers an aromatic mix of rose petal and forest notes, with flavors to match, accenting light berry fruit. The natural astringency of the grape is kept in check. Drink now–2022.
Name: Dominio IV 2011 Tango Three Sleeps Vineyard Tempranillo (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oak-derived aromas of maple, charred wood and clove are pronounced on the nose. The full-bodied palate offers grainy tannins and strong charred oak notes that leave a charcoal-infused berry impression. Its flat, slightly stewed finish is bolstered by a shot of lemony acidity.
Name: Balbas 2015 Ardal Tradición  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is well balanced, with a mix of light toast and citrus-strawberry fruit. It shows generous barrel flavors, from cocoa to coconut and caramel. Drinking at or near its peak, it's flavorful though without clear-cut varietal expression.
Name: Red Lily 2013 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This everyday Tempranillo offers chocolaty berry aromas. Tightly built, its dark, spicy raspberry and plum flavors finish bright and firm. A very good basic red.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Viña Temprana Old Vines Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)

Description: This wine's fiery nose holds oak spice, red fruit, tobacco and chocolate aromas. It's full and grippy on the palate, with hard tannins. Oaky flavors of vanilla and cocoa bolster moderately ripe cassis and plum fruit. A creamy quality persistents on the finish.
Name: Finca Sobreño 2013 Crianza  (Toro)

Description: This wine's light, herbal berry aromas include a touch of olive. A solid though basic Tempranillo, it offers fresh black plum flavors and feels unrefined and a touch aggressive on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Fos 2016 Maceración Carbonica  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This crianza's rustic grilled meat and baking spice aromas are unfocused. It's jammy and soupy on the palate, with a soft structure, mild tannins and charred prune and berry flavors.
Name: Cillar de Silos 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Prune and raisin aromas suggest overripeness in this wine. In the mouth, it's extracted and harsh, with raisin, baked plum and blackberry flavors and heavy tannins.
Name: Matarromera 2013 Granza Made From Organic Grapes  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral aromas recalling violet petal and raisin introduce this crianza from a tough year. It's at once extracted and narrow, with a heavy blast of oak that lends toast and chocolate flavors, while the finish tastes burnt.
Name: De Bardos 2014 Rómantica Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This wine's grapy berry aromas bring good vinegar to mind. Its raw, fresh palate is firm and far from fat and cushy, with briny plum and berry flavors. It has a hard grape skin-like texture on the finish.
Name: Gorrebusto 2016  Rioja

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This has intense smoky, minty and herbal aromas, without much fruit. It's lemony and wiry on the palate, with sour plum and currant flavors that taste woody, spicy and minty on the finish. A lean and sharp rendition of Tempranillo.
Name: Cruz de Alba 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is assertively oaky, with tart fruit and astringent tannins. It's dominated by strong acids and drying tannins, and the new barrel flavors all but conceal the original fruit. Time may or may not bring it into balance.
Name: Red Lily 2014 Life of Riley Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This affordable red includes 13% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's rough and oaky, with tart berry fruit and ample acidity. In its own sturdy and substantial way, it's a worthy alternative to other barbecue-friendly reds.
Name: Red Lily 2014 Red Blanket Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Modest oak aromas accent this wine's blueberry and plum scents. It's lean in feel, with popping acidity. Diffused berry and cherry flavors finish with energy on the wiry finish.
Name: Bodegas Berceo 2016 Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Description: Gritty rubber and latex aromas mix with less than pure berry scents in this wine. Its loud, briny plum and currant flavors finish tart, with wiry acidity.
Name: Delia 2016 Tempranillo (Spain)

Description: This wine is ultrasmooth, mellow and almost sweet, like a dessert wine. It has nutty raisiny aromas and flavors backed by some deeper plum notes, and a broad texture with soft tannins.
Name: Urban Legend 2014 Holland Landing Vineyard Tempranillo (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Minty black fruit and grilled meat aromas lend this wine a green, herbaceous tone. Its tannic palate tastes of weedy berries and burnt wood. Herbal, green notes and raw tannins overpower the finish, feeling underripe at every point.
Name: Arrocal 2014 Passión  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dry and leathery, though not (yet) to the point where no fruit is evident, this offers rose and cherry scents, with those same flavors somewhat buried in bitter, earthy tannins. The sweaty saddle aromas and flavors may in fact worsen with time, so drink now.
Name: Jaxon 2015 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: This is a mature full-bodied wine that's on the downslope, showing aromas like sunbaked earth and leather, and flavors like balsamic and stewed plums.
Name: Fenestra 2012 Tempranillo (Lodi)

Description: Descarte is a new wine from one of Toro's top producers, offering precise aromas of blackberry and cassis. The tight palate is ripped with tannic power—something that's normal for the region—and offers chocolaty black-fruit flavors that are toasty and spicy, with a dry, peppery and tannic finish that lingers. Drink through 2026.
Name: Elias Mora 2014 Descarte  (Toro)

Description: Cedar, charred oak and game are the key aromas in this wine. The palate is huge and tannic, with flavors of blackberry, cassis, baking spices and herbs that finish chocolaty and spicy. While the product of a cool vintage, this is still a saturated beast that could use more time to come around; drink through 2028.
Name: Elias Mora 2013 Gran  (Toro)

Description: Balsamic berry aromas are heady and include tones of tobacco, cigar box and maple. This gran reserva from a fabulous vintage is solid and chewy, with ripe tannins that are firm but not too harsh. Baked berry flavors are augmented by chocolate and spice notes. It's dense and chewy on the finish, with just enough acidity to ensure balance and longevity. Drink through 2035.
Name: Bodegas Bilbainas 2010 Viña Pomal Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Pago de Arínzano, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A nose with leathery berry aromas is earthy and right on. While this wine still shows fairly hard tannins, the palate is deep and layered, a good sign that this single-estate Navarran Tempranillo will age well for years to come. Chocolaty berry-fruit flavors are slightly baked, while tobacco, woodspice, fudge and baking-spice notes grace a long finish with still unresolved tannins. Drink through 2035.
Name: Arínzano 2010 Gran Vino Tempranillo (Pago de Arínzano)

Description: Despite hailing from a cool year, this wine smells a bit cooked and stewed, with surrounding smoke and charred notes helping out. A saturated palate is dense and blocky, and it tastes of baked berry fruits, fig and chocolate. A peppery-tasting finish and smooth tannins offer a nice close; drink through 2022.
Name: Muruve 2013 Reserva  (Toro)

Description: A ripe, earthy nose shows touches of raisin, peanut and dried cheese along with tobacco, all of which are textbook gran reserve traits. A deep, lush, integrated palate delivers chocolaty flavors of berry fruits, cassis and tobacco. On the finish, oaky notes of vanilla and chocolate blend seamlessly into berry and prune flavors. Drink through 2030.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Despite being a bit murky, leathery and stewy on the nose, this reserva from a classic vintage more than gets by. A full palate with proper balance offers flavors of prune, vanilla and chocolate. Tobacco is the lead flavor on a dense, blocky finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Corral 2010 Don Jacobo Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Deep black-fruit aromas are a touch murky and raisiny, with accents of mocha and chocolate. The palate on this Crianza is raw and shocked by tartaric acidity, so this isn't a smooth and easy ride. Blackberry and prune flavors finish hard and lemony, with unabsorbed oak and tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Elias Mora 2014 Crianza  (Toro)

Description: Oak-based milk chocolate is the dominant aroma on this earthy, creamy Tempranillo from a warm vintage. A full-bodied and syrupy mouthfeel has cutting tannins but not a lot of acidity. Flavors of mocha, tobacco and chocolate sit atop black plum and berry fruit, while this is slightly soupy feeling on the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Cuna de Reyes 2009 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is made from new-to-the-state clones from the Ribera del Deuro and Toro regions of Spain. The aromas intrigue, with pure notes of blackberry, herbs and black cherry jam. The flavors bring an ultrasoft, polished mouthfeel.
Name: Idilico 2014 Reserva Dineen Vineyard Tempranillo (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of strawberry fruit, carnation and a touch of charred meat make for a soft and approachable nose on this bottling. It's softly textured on the palate, where cranberry fruit and peppery spices ride leathery tannins that are not too thick.
Name: Longoria 2014 Tempranillo (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Spicy cherry and plum aromas are lightly herbal, with a note of olive. This varietal Tempranillo is blasting with acidity and skins-based tannins. Saucy flavors of plum and wild berry fruits include chocolaty oak. It's driven by high-toned acidity on a cranking finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2013 Reserva Tempranillo (Navarra)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump boysenberry aromas meet with tanned leather, toasted thyme and a bit of burnt caramel on the nose of this bottling from a biodynamic vineyard near Los Alamos. It's juicy and fruit-forward on the palate, with searing acidity and a grippy, leathery texture, showing lots of rustic earth tones and herbal spices. Needs time to develop.
Name: Labyrinth 2014 Martian Ranch Vineyard Tempranillo (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling is from a region northeast of San Diego and spent 36 months in oak. It shows wet soil, clay and blackberry on the nose, and that dark-berry fruit extends to the palate, where it picks up black pepper, crushed lilacs and black-grape flavors, framed by grippy tannins.
Name: Scaredy Cat Ranch 2014 Tempranillo (Ramona Valley)

Description: Aromas of cinnamon, barrel spice and raisiny fruit are a touch murky. This feels full, wide and tannic. Flavors of plum and raspberry are matched by coconut and oak notes, while woody coconut flavors stand out on the finish.
Name: Larchago 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Leathery, oaky berry aromas are baked and include a note of cinnamon. A stout, firm palate is framed by rough, edgy tannins. Spicy, herbal plum flavors feature more than enough oak, while this is drying and tannic on the finish.
Name: Baron De Ley 2015 Varietales  (Rioja)

Description: High toned aromas of vanilla, baking spice, pencil lead, smoke and fresh tobacco are followed by tart, light cranberry and plum flavors that taper on the finish.
Name: Sawtooth 2014 Classic Fly Series Tempranillo

Description: Aromas of baking spice, plum, smoke and cherry lead to plump, soft fruit flavors backed by very light tannins. There's a peanut shell aroma that causes some distraction on an otherwise interesting wine.
Name: Colter's Creek 2015 Estate Bottled Tempranillo (Lewis-Clark Valley (ID))

Description: Dry, spicy plum and cherry aromas are typical of good basic Rioja. This is medium in body, with somewhat rough tannins and spanking acidity. Plum and berry flavors are common, and it's racy on the finish.
Name: Campo Viejo 2016  Rioja

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color with an orange tinge at the rim, the aromas bring notes of leather strap, cherry, cigar box and spice. The flavors are light but juicy. The concentration doesn't seem all there.
Name: Cerulean 2013 Reserve Acadia Vineyards Tempranillo (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Volatility is an issue on an otherwise flat, jammy nose. Hard tannins and full extraction create roughness on the palate. Flavors of clove and cinnamon come straight from the barrel, and it's jagged on a pounding finish.
Name: Bodega Classica 2015 el Pacto  (Rioja)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, the aromas offer notes of pencil eraser and cherry. The flavors are quite light in style, with the concentration dialed way back.
Name: Cerulean 2013 Acadia Vineyards Tempranillo (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Spicy cinnamon and berry aromas are warm and cheesy. A jammy mouthfeel is lacking in structure, despite hard tannins. Flavors of raspberry jam include green notes of herbs and grass, while this feels flush on the finish, with clamping tannins.
Name: Bodegas Corral 2015 Don Jacobo Vino Ecológico  (Rioja)

Description: Punchy cherry and berry aromas are wiry. This wine is acidic and raw in feel, with tart flavors of pie cherry and plum. An angular finish is driven mostly by sharp acidity.
Name: Montebuena 2015 Cuvée KPF  (Rioja)

Description: Leafy berry aromas are a touch green and herbaceous. Like the nose, this wine feels choppy and raw, with rough tannins. Spicy red-fruit flavors finish with scratchy tannins and dry oak notes.
Name: Rioja Vega 2016  Rioja

Description: Earthy berry fruits come with a slathering of oak-based milk chocolate. This wine feels chunky and heavy, while a mix of leafy berry flavors with oxidized raisin notes finishes jammy.
Name: Valdelana 2016 Agnus  (Rioja)

Description: Reduced berry and plum aromas suggest rubber gloves. An acidic, saucy palate struggles for balance. Tart plum and currant flavors recall tomato sauce, while this wine is dry and grating on the finish.
Name: Burgo Viejo 2016 Tinto  (Rioja)

Description: Jammy berry aromas are a bit volatile, with latex and bramble notes in the background. Scattershot and acidic on the palate, this wine tastes of high-toned saucy berry and plum. It has a pulling finish with tart plum notes.
Name: Palacio del Burgo 2016 Tinto  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Toasty blackberry and cassis aromas are classic for Ribera, while the firm, compact palate is structured but not fiercely tannic. Flavors of spiced blackberry, plum and fig finish with the right interplay between fruit and oak. Drink through 2028.
Name: 12 Linajes 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Big, potent and deeply concentrated, this holds nothing back with its rich, ripe black-cherry-compote flavor. Lavender overtones lead into more expressive layers of vanilla, black tea and Kahlúa. It is intense and lingering.
Name: Abacela 2014 Reserve South East Block Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lusty black-fruit aromas are earthy, oaky and smooth, exemplifying an excellent Ribera del Duero. A palate with pulsing acidity tempers rich flavors of blackberry, chocolate and vanilla. Creamy oak and some fire on the finish guarantee that this will evolve nicely through 2028.
Name: Astrales 2014  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Initial cola and root-beer aromas precede floral berry scents. A strict palate is firm but avoids crushing weight. Narrow plum, currant and berry flavors are focused and framed by roaring tannins. This is still young and tough, but with great potential; drink from 2019–2035.
Name: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2012 Pesquera Reserva Tinto  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This black wine is rich, earthy and chocolaty on the nose, with fully toasted aromas of blackberry and cassis. A massive palate with tannins as heavy as cinderblocks features saturated flavors of blackberry, black coffee and chocolate. A malty, smoky, woody finish is anything but shy. Drink from 2020–2030.
Name: Emina 2012 Atio  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: In most years, Alabaster blows you away with its power, concentration and depth of flavors. In 2014, a mediocre year in much of Northern Spain, this is still excellent. Blackberry, cassis and creosote aromas are toasty, while this is flush in feel and severely tannic. Blackberry, mocha and coffee flavors finish with creamy oak and chocolate notes along with meaty tannins. Only 100 cases produced; drink through 2030.
Name: Teso La Monja 2014 Alabaster  (Toro)

Description: At first, this wine smells a bit burnt. But airing allows this gran reserva to show mature aromas of grilled beef, dry leaves and spice. Hard tannins make for a rubbery mouthfeel, but savory flavors of leafy plum and berry fruits bring it around. A finish with baked fruit and chocolate flavors concludes this classical Rioja. Drink through 2025.
Name: Larchago 2008 Pagos de Tahola Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas with a touch of root beer are lush and soft. That is not the case on the palate, which is tight in the middle and scratchy along the edges. Blueberry and black-currant flavors are a touch minty, while this wine displays chocolate and lemon-peel notes on a tough, pulling finish. Drink through 2030.
Name: Monteabellón 2012 Finca Matambres  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blackberry, leather and plum aromas are inviting. This wine is full and lush on the palate, with grippy tannins. Oaky berry flavors are accented by spice and chocolate notes, while the finish brings pronounced coffee and mocha flavors. Drink through 2025.
Name: 12 Linajes 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A dark color and charred, lemony black-fruit aromas announce a wine that's loaded with hard-pounding oak and tannins. This wine tastes super-toasty, blackened and slightly burnt, with black-fruit flavors at the center. This will work best if quality oak applied in abundance is your thing; drink through 2028.
Name: García Figuero 2014 Viña Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Toasty dark-fruit aromas are compact. In the mouth, this wine is more screechy, tannic and taut. Oaky and berry flavors are balanced and integrated on a long finish with driving acidity. Drink this strong-boned Tempranillo from a lesser vintage through 2028.
Name: Viña Vilano 2014 Legón Premium  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Initially this wine is charred and smoky-smelling, with accents of graphite and cola. A tight, juicy palate is bolstered by bold core acidity, while ripe blackberry and currant flavors capture both the black and red sides of the flavor spectrum. A dry, tannic finish with peppery flavors is intense. Drink through 2026.
Name: Bodegas Fuentespina 2014 Selección Old Vines Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This wine shows a heady, toasty nose of black-fruit aromas, along with maple, spice and heat notes. Spiced blackberry and cassis flavors are typical of this Tinta de Toro, however a palate that's rough as sandpaper makes this a tough go. Drink through 2025.
Name: Maurodos 2014 San Román  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Reflecting a warm, dry vintage, this wine smells ripe and balsamic, with notes of cheese blending with raw wood, cowhide, coconut and cassis aromas. A bipolar palate features creamy oak and lemony acidity. Deep berry-fruit flavors are pushed by perky acidity towards a finish with toast and chocolate notes. Drink from 2019–2030.
Name: Resalte 2012 Expresion  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas open this firm gran reserva from a cold vintage. This wine is chunky on the palate, with scraping tannins. Rooty, meaty berry and cinnamon flavors are slightly stewed, while this is long but hollow on the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas are typical of Rioja gran reserva. A full, grabby palate is not silky-smooth, while this wine tastes of fig and chocolaty berry fruits that are on the cusp of cooked. It loses steam on a finish with raisiny notes. Drink through 2022.
Designation: Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva
Name: Bodega Classica 2009 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Savory, mossy plum and currant aromas are mature and woodsy. High acidity is the lifeblood of this gran reserva that tastes of reedy, leafy currant and herbs. The finish is dry, with a note of tobacco. Drink through 2026.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2008 Viña Alarde Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy black-fruit aromas open this fully built crianza. A tannic palate with cutting lemony acidity gives this a ton of energy. Berry and cassis flavors are equaled by oaky vanilla and café-mocha notes, while a coconut flavor and heat come up on the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Martín Berdugo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are sweetened by notes of raisin, creamy oak and root beer. This gran reserva is more easygoing, plump and chunky than what you'd expect from a great vintage like 2010, with flavors of tobacco, woodspice, vanilla, cherry and berry fruit. Cocoa is a prime flavor on the finish. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Covila 2010 II Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Almost overripe aromas of prune and raisin are at the fore on the nose. A full, chewy palate shows big tannins and roasted, earthy flavors of olive, spice cake and berry fruits. Assertive tannins linger through the finish, with flavors of licorice, herbs and chocolate. Drink through 2022.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A chocolaty, well-oaked nose with minerality and core cassis aromas is contradicted by a juicy palate with bright acidity and tension. Dry, salty flavors of berry and cassis are mildly toasted, while this wine is peppery and snappy on an acid-driven finish. The acid level on this wine suggests more aging; drink through 2032.
Name: Viña Vilano 2014 Terra Incógnita  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A reserved earthy nose smells a bit leafy and stalky. A wide palate with hard tannins delivers textbook Rioja flavors of dried cherry and spiced berry fruits. An earthy note alongside chocolate on the finish ensures that is very much in the vein of Rioja gran reserva. Drink through 2027.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2008 Gran Reserva Excelso  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy berry aromas come with a bell-pepper note. In the mouth, this wine is raw and somewhat abrasive. Plum and raspberry flavors are lightly herbal, while this is distinctly tannic, raw and tough on the finish. This quality wine begs for food.
Name: Viña Vilano 2014 Legón Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Classic Rioja aromas of vanilla, tobacco and dried red fruits are on display. In the mouth, this wine has bracing natural acidity that supports ripe flavors of baked berry fruits and brown sugar. Raisiny hints on the finish suggest drinking this sooner rather than later.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2009 Lagunilla Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A dark, gritty, spicy nose with aromas of black peppercorn, coffee and black fruits sets up a high-acid palate with lemony oak. Flavors of vanilla and creamy oak dominate, while the finish echoes what came before: oak, creamy notes and lemony acid. Drink now through 2027.
Name: Ramón Bilbao 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Heavily roasted aromas of gamy berry fruits, herbs and coconutty oak settle on charred. This wine is bulky and a touch stewed and soupy in feel. Oaky flavors of chocolate, baked berry and cassis end with chocolaty oak on a finish that's heavy and lacking in verve. Drink through 2024.
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Hot, minty aromas of burnt oak, graphite and road tar introduce a fiery palate. Burnt-oak flavors turn resiny and towards mocha and blackberry as the wine breathes. Keeping with a theme set from the start, this is fiery on the finish, with toasty, blackened flavors.
Name: Avante 2014  Ribera del Duero

Description: Earthy berry aromas come with notes of beef stock and dried leaves. A clampy palate with rubbery tannins is the opposite of smooth, while this wine tastes of raw plum, berry fruits and grape skins. It feels pinchy on the finish.
Name: Maetierra Dominum 2009 QP Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe, earthy plum and cassis aromas are slightly smoky, with a graphite note. An oaky palate is spread a bit thin, while flavors of red currant and plum are backed by dry oak that extends onto the finish. Drink now.
Name: Baron De Ley 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a spicy aromatic wine, with potent aromas of vanilla and black tea. The red fruits are compressed, and there is a big streak of coffee liqueur running across the palate. It's got plenty of flavor, though what is grape and what is barrel remains a bit of a puzzle.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2014 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Spicy, briary berry aromas are subtle and reserved, but sound. This wine is firm and a bit drawing on the palate, with flavors of plum, berry fruits and cocoa. Mild berry flavors on the finish are tasty and not pushy or overdone.
Name: Valdelana 2014 Agnus Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The Tempranillos from this pioneering estate winery bring deep dense purple fruits, along with very potent flavors of vanilla, black tea and coffee liqueur. Tannic and earthy, this has a somewhat grainy mouthfeel. It's packed with flavor, but with less emphasis on pure fruit and more on the vanilla-laced tannins.
Name: Abacela 2014 Barrel Select Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Chunky black-fruit aromas are in the overripe zone, with a smoky offset. A raw palate is bolstered by citrusy acidity that creates a screechy mouthfeel. Flavors of plum skins and orange peel are good.
Name: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2009 200 Monges Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A ripe, fully oaked nose includes charred aromas along with herbal plum and currant scents. This wine has so much pep on the palate that it feels a touch raw, with a resiny oak offset. Woody plum and raspberry flavors finish with a final blast of oak.
Name: Izadi 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Pago de Arínzano, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gamy, roasted aromas of berry fruits and black olive are less than stellar for a great year like 2010. A stewed, tomatoey palate is drawing in feel, while this Tempranillo from a single estate in Navarra tastes of olive and herbal black fruits. A severely tannic finish is rough and drying.
Name: Arínzano 2010 La Casona Tempranillo (Pago de Arínzano)

Description: Earthy, herbal aromas are a bit murky and reflect a marginal Toro vintage in 2014. A grabby, overextracted palate delivers rock-hard tannins along with gummy flavors of blackberry and blueberry. On the finish, creamy oak takes on a clove-like flavor.
Name: Muruve 2014 Elite  (Toro)

Description: On first take, this smells oaky, with notes of animal fur and earthy berry fruits. A tight palate shows tomatoey acidity, while a narrow field of flavors includes plum and herbs. Drawing tannins and a minty flavor drive the finish on this basic but positive Rioja.
Name: Carlos Serres 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Woody berry aromas are hot but also creamy and show vanilla notes. A bold, grabby palate delivers oaky flavors of prune, spice and chocolate. Some heat and aggressiveness must be dealt with on a firm finish.
Name: Vega Sauco 2016 La Sonrisa del Nómada  (Toro)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Despite the high alcohol, this is relatively restrained, with flavors mixing rosewater and raspberries. It's a simple, lightly fruity wine, with stiff tannins that introduce suggestions of black tea and a whiff of tobacco.
Name: Schmidt 2014 Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

Description: Murky, gamy aromas indicate that 2014's wet, humid conditions affected this wine. In the mouth, this is heavy and tough, with grating tannins. Black-fruit flavors combined with lemony oak are chunky, massive and acidic on the finish. This wine is good but has balance issues.
Name: Cyan 2014 Valdefinjas Crianza  (Toro)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The Delfino vineyard was the source for these grapes, a mix of two clones. It captures a bit of the varietal character, with spicy, toasty notes around pale cherry fruit. In the finish, some chalky acids dominate.
Name: Ram 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked, raisiny aromas are dull and soft. Following that lead, this wine is jammy and lacking in verve. Flavors of prune, raisin and spice cake finish smooth and easy, with almost no acidity.
Name: Rento 2014  Ribera del Duero

Description: Raisin and prune aromas announce a chunky palate that's solid but not agile or elegant. Flavors of prune and cassis come with a sense of grape skins. It finishes well.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2013 Conde Valdemar Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Lightly earthy, this offers pleasant berry fruit, though it comes across as more generic than specific to the variety. There's a light touch of toast also, perhaps from the barrel aging. Drink up over the next couple of years.
Name: Melrose 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Prune and cassis aromas are timid and earthy. This crianza from a cool, rainy year feels choppy, but has substance. Spicy, peppery red-fruit flavors are dry and finish with acidic freshness.
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are a bit stalky and flat. This crianza is firm and choppy, but also stewed on the palate. Spicy plum and olive flavors are ordinary if not a touch underripe.
Name: Loriñon 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Subtle aromas of cherry cola are basic. This Rioja is medium in body, with slightly scratchy tannins and acidity. Earthy plum and berry flavors finish with a hint of toasty oak and a sense of dryness.
Name: Pagos del Rey 2013 Castillo de Albai Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Rubbery dark-fruit aromas come with cheesy oak scents. This basic Toro has a sticky, saucy mouthfeel bolstered by tartaric acidity. Short, oaky berry flavors are chocolaty, while the finish offers mostly residual oak notes.
Name: Gil Luna 2016 Sin Complejos  (Toro)

Description: The aromas are oak dominated, with notes of vanilla extract, coconut, dill, spearmint and freshly hewn wood, with the fruit struggling to get to the surface. There's a soft, pleasing feel to the palate but the wood again gets in the way. The fruit is hard to find.
Name: Watermill 2014 Estate Vineyard Tempranillo

Description: Soupy raisin and prune aromas are earthy and sleepy. This feels a lot like prune juice, but with tannins. Prune is also the sole flavor on this overripe but still decent gran reserva from a hot vintage.
Name: Burgo Viejo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Heavily charred aromas suggest a steak or hamburger left on the grill for too long. In the mouth, this is compact and boxed in by rock-hard tannins. Like the nose, this young Toro tastes burnt and grilled. Flavors of black coffee and clove dominate an oak-driven finish.
Name: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2016 Triton Old Vines  (Toro)

Description: Stalky cherry and berry aromas announce a lean, tart palate with a texture influenced by grape skins. Plum and currant flavors are thin, and this is earthy, tangy and low on ripeness on the finish.
Name: Bodega Classica 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This Tinta de Toro smells like a cherry Lifesaver. In the mouth, there's not much body or substance. Candied blackberry and cassis flavors are medicinal and jammy on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Fariña 2016 Dama de Toro  (Toro)

Description: Rubbery, medicinal berry aromas smell like Pepto-Bismol. A chunky palate is big and blocky, with no elegance or charm. Candied, grapy flavors finish hard and scratchy.
Name: Muruve 2016 Joven  (Toro)

Description: Many years in bottle haven't done much for this briary wine with weedy aromas of field greens and spice. A choppy palate with uncontrolled acidity is less than comfortable, while the finish offers nothing but rawness and tannins.
Name: Loriñon 2008 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A super dark color and oodles of dark fruit in both the aroma and the flavor make this a rich and seductive wine. It packs in notes of black cherry, blackberry jam and dark chocolate without obvious oakiness even though winemaker Marco Cappelli aged it 20 months in 50% new oak. The wine has good firm structure from lots of soft tannins, full body and moderate acidity making it very impressive, concentrated and layered.
Name: Miraflores 2013 Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A generous influence from new oak barrels works beautifully on this full-bodied spice-saturated and richly concentrated wine. It has everything from subtle cinnamon and cardamom to ripe and lush black cherry notes to a lingering finish that echoes spices and dark fruit. Fine-grained tannins shape the mouthfeel and add welcome grip.
Name: Renwood 2014 Tempranillo (Amador County)

Description: The aromas are sweet and sappy, with notes of raspberry, herb, pipe tobacco and musk. The palate shows more restraint than the aromas might suggest, bringing a suave sense that carries through a finish that just won't quit. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery, bringing a lot of richness.
Name: K Vintners 2014 El Jefe Stoneridge Vineyard Tempranillo (Washington)

Description: There's no reason to drink Cabernet all the time when delicious, well-balanced and firm-textured California Tempranillos like this are becoming more and more common. From a specialist in Iberian grape varieties, the wine has lightly spicy aromas, nicely layered red- and black-cherry and wood-smoke flavors that fill the mouth and linger on the finish.
Name: Bokisch 2014 Tempranillo (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bursting with ripe, almost jammy fruit flavors, this exuberant wine from an often-outstanding estate is rich and mouthfilling, full bodied but not too tannic to easily enjoy. Flavors run the gamut from blackberry to Bing cherry to blueberry and espresso.
Name: Las Positas 2013 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very good concentration and a sleek texture make this medium to full-bodied wine from the Sierra Foothills easy to appreciate. It has layers of ripe black fruits, nuances of toasted oak and cedar, and fine-grained tannins that provide good backbone.
Name: Uphill Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Tempranillo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Full bodied and full flavored, this complex wine smells like black olive, wood smoke and tobacco, tastes like blackberry and dried herbs and feels broad and firmly tannic on the palate. It's built to age well, and should show even more nuances after 2020.
Name: Shannon 2014 Home Ranch Reserve Tempranillo (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a big full-bodied wine that packs a bounty of ripe bold fruit flavors into a firm frame of tannins, alcohol and moderate acidity. It has a big impact on the palate with the concentration to back it up. Big proteins will pair nicely with it.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2014 Tempranillo (Lake County)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This enjoyable wine is complex and intricate in flavor, blending ripe plum and sour cherry notes with black olive, black pepper and bay leaf nuances. It's medium-bodied, smooth in texture and not very tannic.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2014 Tempranillo (Yolo County)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a substantial wine with a spicy, lightly herbal aroma and lots of fruit flavors that spread across the palate. It is medium to full-bodied, has a smooth texture and a good dose of raspberry-like acidity that keeps it fresh.
Name: Matchbook 2013 Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)

Description: Smooth and well-balanced, this medium-bodied wine has earthy spicy aromas, flavors that combine meaty, herbal nuances with red and black cherry and a mouthfeel that's relatively light and easy. It's time to drink up this well-aged wine.
Name: Fenestra 2011 Tempranillo (Lodi)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from Rosebud Vineyard, the aromas show a bit of oxidation along with a touch of volatility. It's a shame as the palate is full of luscious rich fruit flavors that provide a lot of enjoyment. Vanilla notes linger on the finish.
Name: Rio Vista 2015 Tempranillo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has an herbal pickle-barrel component that won't appeal to everyone. The flavors are on the tart side, like cranberry and capers, and some hard-edged oak sticks out on the finish.
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2014 ReZerve Tempranillo (Amador County)

Description: A blend of smoky oak, earth, blackberry and raisin aromas rule the nose on this full-force Rioja that's showing full ripeness despite coming from a cool vintage. Amancio is typically bruising on the palate, with wall-to-wall power and tannins. Dark, hefty berry and plum flavors finish firm and dry, but with plenty of vanilla and oak flavor. Drink from 2020–2034.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2013 Amancio  (Rioja)

Description: Sturdy aromas of licorice, black pepper and wild berry fruits are highly encouraging. In the mouth, high acidity reflective of a cool year is the dominant component, meaning this has long-term aging potential. Flavors of dried cheese, vanilla and chocolate come straight from the barrel, while balsamic berry, plum and currant notes carry over to a well-oaked finish. Drink from 2020–2034.
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2013 Dalmau  (Rioja)

Description: Toasty oak and saddle leather aromas lend complexity to a dark-fruited nose with minerality. This feels snappy, which is what you might expect from a high-end 2013 from Rioja. Oaky black-fruit flavors come with more than enough spice and earth notes, while this is toasty on the finish and also dry and firm in feel. Drink from 2019–2030.
Name: San Vicente 2013  Rioja

Description: The 2010 harvest will go down as one of Rioja's greats, and that means wines like this $25 Gran Reserva can be excellent and affordable. It has a nose of mocha, smoke and earthy berry fruits. The palate is layered and texturally complex, while flavors of root beer, baking spice, dried cherry and plum spread out on a smooth finish that is just right in terms of residual tannins and acid. Drink through 2030.
Name: Carlos Serres 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Initial oak-driven aromas of grilled and smoked meats don't allow for much fruit expression on the nose. A jammy, plush palate is solid but not too hard or tannic. Spicy, toasty flavors of plum, raisin and licorice expire with mild heat and burn on the finish. Drink through 2032.
Name: Licenciado 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Notes of earthy, clove and all spice carry the nose. This is full, juicy and popping on the palate. Flavors of raspberry, mixed spices and exotic tea finish with red-berry leftovers and even more spice notes. Drink through 2028.
Name: Valenciso 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Grainy oak aromas dominate a nose with black-fruit, spice, balsam wood and barrel notes. This crianza is intense, with strong tannins and blazing acidity. Toasted, blackened berry flavors are under control on a bold finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas la Cepa Alta 2014 La Veguilla Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: From Dominio de Atauta, this crianza is slightly murky and earthy up front, with aromas of smoky wood, prune and dark grit. A full, saturated palate is packed with power, while this tastes of blackberry, prune and leather.
