Name: Atalayas de Golbán 2014 Torre de Golbán Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Straightforward berry and cherry aromas control a nose with spice and cocoa notes. A high-toned, tannic palate carries fresh plum and raspberry flavors end, with hard tannins, barrel-based notes and general dryness. Drink through 2021.
Name: Viña Vilano 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Sourced from the Umpqua Valley, where the Oregon Tempranillo renaissance is headquartered, this plum- and cherry-flavored red has the forward, light fruit flavors of grapes from young vines. The tannins are ripe and balanced and the finish just a bit astringent.
Name: Eola Hills 2015 Tempranillo (Oregon)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry and dark plum aromas are solid on the nose. A raw, energetic palate is paced by bright acidity, while this tastes of blackened spice and blackberry. On a bold finish, peppery fruit flavors blend with lightly charred oak.
Name: Peñalba Herraiz 2015 Aptus 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Black cherry and cassis aromas are spicy, with a sense of freshness. This Tempranillo feels tight and racy, with tension to the palate. Woody, spicy black-fruit flavors are medium in depth and a touch cooked, while this is full on the finish, with a pronounced oak flavor sticking out.
Name: Tamaral 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy, lightly baked berry aromas fresh on the nose. A snappy palate with raw acidity leads to mildly herbal plum and berry flavors. A dry, spicy, nicely oaked finish is a bit choppy in feel but tastes right. Similar to past bottlings, this is 55% Tempranillo, 30% Cab Sauvignon and 15% Merlot.
Name: Ochoa 2010 Reserva Red (Navarra)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Black-fruit aromas with accents of road tar and spice turn more herbal with airing. A tight, crisp mouthfeel is built around smacking acidity, while plum and berry flavors come with peppery spice notes. An herbal character returns on a ripped, juicy finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Señorío de Sotillo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 20% Syrah, this brooding wine shows butterscotch, red fruit and spice aromas and tart, high-acid fruit flavors. It's a mix of fruit and barrel characteristics, even though the oak used was neutral. The tannins bring a lightly chalky feel.
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2014 Tempranillo (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of rose petals and raisins carry to a compact palate that is chewy and tannic. Blocky plum and berry flavors are slightly flat on a finish with scraping tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Marqués de Valparaíso 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's vanilla and herb aromas are high toned. The palate brings abundant fruit and barrel flavors, with lively acidity providing the frame. The tannins seem a little coarse at present. Give them some time to settle.
Name: Longship 2015 Invader Tempranillo (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy berry aromas are more gritty than smooth. This feels chunky and on the heavy side, with power but little finesse. Extracted blackberry and cassis flavors finish with overt oak, related chocolate notes and rough tannins.
Name: García Figuero 2016 4 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: You may find tasters divided on this wine; for some it will be delicious, for others overripe and alcoholic. It's definitely big in style, with quite ripe, almost raisiny fruit flavors, a hint of plastic on the nose and astringent tannins.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2015 Aroha Vineyard Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first vintage of this estate-grown Tempranillo—a rare grape in the Willamette Valley. It's a bit high-toned and right on the edge of vinegary. Roasted flavors of charred red fruit and a hint of smoke come through on the finish. This is a love-it-or-leave-it wine with no middle ground.
Name: Vidon Vineyard 2015 Explorer Tempranillo (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe aromas of prune and blackberry come with a hint of green. A dense, tannic palate holds rich flavors of prune and plum. A toasty, oaky finish is spicy but short.
Name: Quintana de Cue 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Charred oak and slightly overripe aromas make for a bullish nose. On the palate, this delivers a jolt of acidity along with oversize tannins, while ripe plum and cassis flavors.
Name: Conde de Siruela 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Raisiny aromas are obvious but not over the top. This basic Toro is expansive but a touch heavy in fell. Raisin and black plum flavors are more baked than fresh, while this is compact on the finish.
Name: Vega Sauco 2015 el Beybi  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jumpy aromas of blackberry Kool-Aid are common for a joven. In the mouth, this feels chunky and grabby, with punchy acidity. Salty berry and plum flavors come with abrasive tannins and an aftertaste of oak.
Name: Martín Berdugo 2016 Joven  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dusty, dried black fruit aromas lead the way in this astringent, oaky wine. Its barrel flavors, from aging in 30% new American oak, suggest raw lumber rather than pretty toast. More bottle age may help smooth it out.
Name: Weisinger 2014 Estate Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Green, grassy aromas announce a wine with ripeness issues. In the mouth, this feels raw and tannic, with hard-pumping acidity. Oaky, chocolaty flavors accent plum and berry fruit, while this feels and tastes riper on the finish than it does early on.
Name: Marqués de Valparaíso 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy black currant aromas are rooty and medicinal. This young Tempranillo is hard and smacking on the palate. A forced-oak flavor of clove is dominant, while this is drying and raw on the finish.
Name: Zumaya 2016  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Berry and plum scents suggest powdered drink mix. A narrow palate feels austere, while this tastes of tart black plum with mineral tones. On the finish, this dries out quickly as it leaves grating residual tannins.
Name: Cantaburros 2015  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is beyond light; it's almost invisible. Some hints of cola, bark and tannin come through on the palate, with plenty of astringency. But where's the fruit?
Name: Redgate 2016 Tempranillo (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This entry-level wine has green aromas on the nose, while the palate is pinched and tannic. Jammy berry fruit flavors blended with green-herb notes and rough tannins.
Name: Emilio Moro 2016 Finca Resalo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: From the Carneros-based producer with its roots in Spain, this succeeds in its velvety smooth texture, juicy fruit and supportive acidity. Black licorice and spiced plum are given additional richness by a jolt of dark chocolate.
Name: Artesa 2014 Tempranillo (Alexander Valley)

Description: Made from Aragonês—the southern Portuguese name for Tinta Roriz, also called Tempranillo in Spain—this wine is one of a series of limited-production, single-variety wines. Structured tannins and ample fruit on the palate match with the inherent smoothness that is typical of the grape. It is a deliciously rich wine that balances power with elegance. Drink from 2018.
Name: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Canto do Zé Cruz Aragonês (Alentejano)

Description: Despite the broad South Australia appellation listed on the label, this small-batch wine is from a single vineyard located between Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. It's meaty and stalky, with raisiny dark fruit, cocoa powder and Dr. Pepper notes. The palate changes directions but is equally delicious in juicy cranberry, earth and herbs, with tightly grained tannins and lively acidity.
Name: Ess & See 2014 Tempranillo (South Australia)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: There's a leathery quality to the nose of this bottling, with charred berries, roasted pepper-crusted beef and slightly sour gamy aromas as well. Cracked black pepper, blackberry, animal skins and beef jerky flavors show on the sip, which hides the high-alcohol content well.
Name: Hart 2015 Hart Family Vineyard Limited Release Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Description: El Capricho is one of Uruguay's more consistent wineries in terms of putting out wines of character and quality. This Tempranillo is smoky, spicy and woodsy on the nose, with notes of cola accenting berry and currant scents. A pulling drawing palate is a bit tannic, while this tastes of toasty oak, plum and tomato. Drink through 2020.
Name: El Capricho 2015 Reserve Tempranillo (Durazno)

Description: The aromas are light, with notes of fresh tobacco, tangerine peel, moist earth, cedar and cherry. The wood tannins come off as a little aggressive at present but there's plenty of lovely fruit there as well.
Name: Cinder 2014 Tempranillo

Description: Part of a series highlighting the principal varieties of the Douro, this wine is made from the grape that is known as Tempranillo in Spain. It is structured and dense, with red-berry fruits and the beginnings of the smooth texture more familiar with the grape. The mineral texture and acidity give further complexity. Drink from 2018.
Name: Adega Vila Real 2015 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Impressively dark and dense in the glass, this bottling from Edgar Torres from a coastal site offers pungent black currant, leather, wet asphalt and black pepper aromas. The palate's charred black plum flavors are wrapped in serious tannins and bolstered by bright acidity. This will evolve into a stellar wine with patience. Drink 2020–2034.
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Description: Compact, almost gritty aromas of tree bark and herbal berry fruits require time to breathe. After necessary airing, this is elegant and fresh on the palate, but full in body. Herbal plum and berry flavors are leathery, spicy and suggest tomato as this transitions to a firm, racy finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: CVNE 2012 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, earthy aromas of baked berry fruits, cassis and licorice lead to a chewy, stout palate. Oaky flavors of ripe blackberry and cassis are rooty and leathery, while this tastes of chocolate and fig on a broad finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2011 HZ Abascal Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of cola, raisin and cassis are ripe and chunky. A sinewy palate displays raisiny flatness, while this is oaky tasting on the surface and more spicy, rubbery and fruity underneath. Flavors of tobacco and wood spice finish tight, with bright acidity keeping things lively.
Name: Rioja Vega 2008 Gran Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Description: Lightly astringent cherry and berry aromas are intriguing and complex. This eases across the palate with weight and ripeness prior to baked berry, cassis and prune flavors. Earthiness becomes a more dominant characteristic the longer this sits. Drink through 2021.
Name: Rioja Vega 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Description: Classic Rioja aromas of earthy berry, cassis and raisin along with cocoa and dry spice notes announce a ripe wine with complexity. A dense palate with good acidity sets the stage for baked berry, cassis and raisin flavors. This Tempranillo is earthy and smooth on the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Coto de Imaz 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Raisin and prune aromas are components of the nose on this ripe Ribera del Duero that offers additional notes of fig and chocolate. A fleshy, thick palate deals earthy black-fruit, prune and spicy flavors prior to a chunky, chewy finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Díaz Bayo 2011 Francisco Díaz Bayo Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Tea and root beer aromas carry a slight rubber slant. A choppy, angular palate is home to savory oak, berry and plum flavors. On the finish, olive and herbal fruit flavors are propped up by live-wire acidity. Drink this long-laster through 2024.
Name: Beronia 2008 Gran Reserva Tempranillo-Graciano-Mazuelo  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A smoky, charred nose includes notes of baking spice, chocolate and black-fruit scents. A tight, solid palate of firm tannins and oak tastes charred, spicy and ripe. On the finish, oak is out front but this has the body and depth to handle it. Drink 2018–2023.
Name: Protos 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: If you like full-flavored, lusty Tempranillos, Viñas del Cenit in western Zamora is a reliable source. This has floral berry aromas, a saturated palate with wall to wall tannins, and baked black-fruit flavors that push up towards maximum ripeness. A staunch, jammy, tannic red made to with meat off the grill.
Name: Viñas del Cenit 2014 Villano Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark, earthy, herbal berry flavors are full-force on a nose. Plenty of grip and spunk drive a firm palate. Cherry, plum, berry and chocolate flavors make for a rich Tempranillo with lasting toasty darkness to the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Viñas del Cenit 2014 Aleo Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy black-fruit aromas include notes of cigar box. This feels tight and acidic, but with plenty of oak. Flavors of woodspice and vanilla are more dominant than plum and berry notes, while this is thick but not entirely thorough on the finish.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2012 Pavo Real  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A dark, roasted, smoky opening is the greeting on this burly Tempranillo from Zamora. Grabbing tannins pinch like squeaky rubbery, while this tastes of savory, roasted black fruits. A meaty, chewy, tannic finish is confirmation of overall toughness. Drink through 2021.
Name: Viñas del Cenit 2014 Venta Mazzaron Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Raisin aromas could use a bit more lift and freshness. This Rioja feels grabby due to rubbery tannins. Soupy, slightly herbal berry flavors finish on chocolaty notes but also a choppy sense of roughness.
Name: Palacio de Primavera 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Toasty aromas suggest maple, along with a note of sawdust to accompany earthy berry scents. A rich, pure palate is intense but shows balance and comportment. Blackberry, cassis, peppery spice and integrated oak flavors are detailed, with a smooth finish. Drink this full-bodied wonder through 2028.
Name: Valderiz 2014 Juegabolos  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A pretty nose shows violet notes alongside leather, blackberry and cassis aromas. The palate is full and edgy, with rubbery tannins that could use some years to resolve. A roasted, beefy flavor profile includes nuances of smoked meat that make this about more than just black fruit. Drink through 2028.
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2014  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Massive blackberry, vanilla and marshmallow aromas are voluptuous. A just-right mix of lushness and tannins determines the palate, which hosts toasty flavors of chocolate and blackberry. A smooth finish with firm but manageable residual tannins is intense but not rough. Drink through 2028.
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2012 Llanos del Almendro  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Toasty oak and graphite aromas fortify a nose that's lemony on the surface and ripe and fruity at the base. A creamy, resiny mouthfeel is toughened by hard tannins, while this wine tastes of toasty oak and black fruits. A dark, woody finish is chocolaty and rich. Drink through 2027.
Name: Dominio Basconcillos 2014 Viña Magna  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A smoky, heady nose is defined mostly by char, coffee and black-fruit aromas. In the mouth, this wine is solidly built but not too heavy. Toasty, chocolaty blackberry and cassis flavors don't change much on a bold, blocky finish that stays the course. Drink through 2027.
Name: De Bardos 2012 Suprema 30 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Appealing black-fruit aromas include notes of tobacco and chocolate. This is a brooding, deep Tinto Fino with grippy tannins. Ripe berry, plum and cassis flavors are flush, while this wine finishes dark, with a reprise of young, rubbery tannins. Best from 2019–2030.
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2015 Parada de Atauta  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This single-vineyard Tempranillo opens with smooth, straightforward dark-fruit aromas that are calm and collected. A deeply stacked palate is a touch fierce but well structured. Toasty blackberry and cherry flavors linger on a toast-etched finish. Drink through 2032.
Name: Olivier Rivière 2014 Las Viñas de Eusebio  (Rioja)

Description: Richly oaked aromas of burnt wood, caramel and sawmill compete with jammy blackberry and cassis notes. A rugged, drawing palate is fiercely tannic and dry. Blackberry, burnt oak and coffee flavors dry out quickly on the finish, leaving simmering toasty mint. Drink through 2025.
Name: Viñedos de Paganos 2012 El Puntido  (Rioja)

Description: Savory, mature aromas of woodspice and earthy berry fruits form the greeting on this gran reserva that's more lively than subdued or silky. Spicy, oaky berry flavors have a ripe, rooty component, while there's just enough pop to a bold, baked, chocolaty finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2009 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Initial murky aromas clear up while remaining a bit gritty and stalky. This crianza has a raw, choppy feel. Gritty, earthy flavors of leathery plum and berry fruits finish peppery and spicy. Drink through 2022.
Name: Lleiroso 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is very much a cowboy wine, with rustic aromas of campfire smoke, warm leather and black-plum pie fresh out of the oven. Baked mulberry and elderflower show on the fruity sip, but it's cut by a leathery texture and burnt brioche, making for a unique fulfilling sip.
Name: Rabble 2015 Mossfire Ranch Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Cheesy oak and raw cherry and plum aromas create a nose that needs time in the glass to show its best. This Rioja feels fresh and tight, with pulling tannins. Zesty plum and cherry flavors carry a peppery side note prior to a snappy finish with similar flavors.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Cosme Palacio 1894  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy black cherry and blackberry aromas are moderately spicy and complex. This wine feels plump and round, without the tannic clamp that some RDD wines display. Savory black-fruit flavors reflect the nose. It finishes smooth and with medium length.
Name: Viña Mayor 2014 Barrel Aged  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Savory notes of olive and rubber share space on the nose with dark berry aromas. This wine feels thick and fleshy, and ultimately a touch heavy and collapsed. Dark, spicy, slightly bitter blackberry flavors finish with a reprise of savory accents. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tierra Aranda 2012  Ribera del Duero

Description: Spicy plum aromas are accompanied by appealing oak scents. While this wine doesn't show the greatest of ease and flow on the palate, flavors of plum, cassis, clove and cinnamon are persuasive. A blocky, rubbery, tannic finish with roasted notes is more about power than finesse. Drink through 2023.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2009 Glorioso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe, spicy berry aromas are a touch reduced. This warm-vintage reserva feels jammy and wide, with rugged, pulling tannins. Peppery dark-fruit flavors turn more savory on a tannic, rocky finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2012 Cosme Palacio Viñedos Viejos Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy aromas hint at stewed fruit, while this wine is beefy and not very bright on the nose. Rubbery tannins and flavors of roasted, meaty berry fruits finish dense, brooding and dark, with residual tannins. This wine reflects the warm, dry conditions of 2012; drink through 2023.
Name: De Bardos 2012 Mítica Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, earthy berry and cassis aromas smell damp at first but unfold nicely. Bright acidity and abrupt tannins make for a packed palate. Lightly oaky flavors of plum and berry show a note of vanilla. It finishes crisp and choppy due to the aforementioned bold acidity. Drink through 2022.
Name: R+ 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry, black cherry and leather aromas come together nicely in front of a creamy palate with just enough acid-tannin tension. Lightly herbal, spicy blackberry flavors are savory rather than dark and fruity. The wine tastes spicy and peppery on a finish that feels right.
Name: Catania 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Floral red-berry and cassis aromas are steady and fresh. In the mouth, this wine turns raw and jagged. Cranberry, currant and red-plum flavors show very little oak before a lean, powerful finish. This cool-vintage wine will last for years but probably not improve.
Designation: Cosme Palacio Viñedos en Altitud Crianza
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2013 Cosme Palacio Viñedos en Altitud Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Baking spice and smoky wood-grain aromas are classy but dominate fruit scents. This wine feels crisp and snappy, with hard tannins. Spicy, woody flavors match the nose and are backed by chocolate and berry fruit notes, carrying through to the spicy, oaky finish.
Name: Bodegas Perica 2009 Viña Olagosa Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Lightly charred aromas of coffee, wood smoke and chocolate outweigh berry and plum scents. A tight palate shows firm tannins and carries roasted berry and plum flavors.
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Brambly berry aromas are woody and a bit fiery. This roble feels sinewy, with structure and intensity. Black-fruit flavors are toasty but not charred or burnt. The finish is full and dark but short.
Name: 12 Linajes 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With fruit from Funk, Dugger Creek and Watermill Estate vineyards, this delivers funky peat, olive and fresh tobacco aromas. The flavors are light, soft and palate-coating, gliding into the finish. A subtle rendition of the variety.
Name: Saviah 2014 Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Unusual but not unpleasant aromas of cinnamon and coffee cake lead to a saturated palate with rugged tannins. Flavors of fig paste, chocolate and baking spices confirm the wine's ripeness, while blackened flavors and rock-hard tannins drive the finish.
Name: Conde de Siruela 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Berry, cola and chocolate aromas are pretty. In the mouth, this wine is bright and brash, with rough tannins and high acidity. Flavors of plum and wild berry are a touch salty and then comes a hard-pounding finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2013 Glorioso Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Smooth, floral berry aromas are easy to like. This crianza feels whole and plump. Lightly herbal tomato flavors blend with richer plum and berry notes in front of a balanced, mostly ripe finish.
Name: Luis Cañas 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Grapy berry aromas are a bit reduced and jammy. In the mouth, this wine is dense and saturated, with solid tannins and a sense of thickness. Savory blackberry and cassis flavors finish earthy and slightly baked, with drying tannins.
Name: De Bardos 2015 Epica Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rooty aromas of licorice and sarsparilla are out front, followed by a big wave of barrel char. This wine feels good but a little abrupt and choppy. Savory flavors of barbecue and meaty berry fruits finish blackened and peppery, with a lasting note of charred wood.
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2014 Conde de San Cristóbal  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Roasted aromas of tomato and red plum are spicy. This has a chunky, blocky mouthfeel that's searching for its groove. Herbal plum and tomato flavors finish a bit raw in feel and salty in flavor.
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Full, round aromas of berry fruits are oaky and appealing. In the mouth, this wine is ultradry, tannic and raw. Flavors of blackberry, plum and coffee finish hard and abrasive due to scraping tannins.
Name: Viña Mayor 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe aromas of baked berry and plum offer a window into this slightly jumpy, acidic Tempranillo. Roasted, blackened berry flavors show the “roble,” meaning this is a bit oaky. On the finish, this is short but solid and fruity.
Name: Viña Mayor 2015 Tinto Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of creamy vanilla and mixed berry fruits are a bit jumbled. This has a full, grabby, chunky palate, with spicy plum and peppery flavors that don't show a lot of variation or complexity. On the finish, there's heat and oak to cut through.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of spicy oak and dried berry fruits lead to a clampy, rubbery palate. Plum and berry flavors are slightly saucy, while the finish, which is still fresh for a 2009, is tannic and pulling.
Name: Mileto 2009 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Floral black-fruit aromas share space on the nose with olive and rubber notes. This Tempranillo feels rubbery and a touch collapsed, however its baked plum and jammy berry flavors are pleasing. Drink this easygoing wine now.
Name: Raimat 2013 Castell de Raimat Tempranillo (Costers del Segre)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine shows vanilla, celery root, mesquite and herb aromas on the nose. Its baking spice flavors are quite sweet, suggesting heavy-handed oak. Vanilla flavors take over on the finish, leaving a disjointed impression.
Name: Liberty Lake 2013 Tempranillo (Red Mountain)

Description: Savory, spicy, herbal berry aromas lead to a sinewy palate that's full of acidity and chop. Oaky plum flavors are woody and a bit muddled, while this wine tastes of oaky red fruits on a fiery finish.
Name: Valdelacierva 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Burnt coffee, vanilla bean, green wood and tobacco aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit and barrel flavors in this wine. It's enjoyable despite the intense oak influence.
Name: Stottle 2013 6 Prong Vineyard Tempranillo (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Saucy plum and berry aromas are a touch stewy and gritty. This wine shows a blocky body with sinewy tannins. Savory, saucy flavors match the bouquet, and it feels supple and tastes roasted on the finish.
Name: Viña Mayor 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Reserved aromas of plum, raisin and oak lead to a pinched palate that pulls to the center like a magnet. Peppery blackberry and cassis flavors are raw and without volume prior to a collapsed finish.
Name: Finca del Marquesado 2009 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This young, oaky Tinto Fino opens with charred aromas, but soon scents transition to cheesy and chocolaty. This wine is bullish in texture, with a ton of oak-driven clove, spice and burnt flavors. For the most part, fruit is not a big factor, as the “roble” in this wine drives the car.
Name: Portia 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Spicy berry fruit aromas are straightforward and pretty good. This wine feels firm and centered, with plum, berry and cherry flavors. A reasonably deep finish offers residual berry notes and peppery spice.
Name: Tarantas 2016 Organic Tempranillo (Utiel-Requena)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A heavily oaked nose of berry fruits quickly gets taken over by creamy milk chocolate and clove scents. An overextracted tannic palate holds flavors of burnt wood and blackened spices. On the finish, this wine is so charred and woody that it tastes bitter.
Name: Protos 2015  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This rustic, herbal Tinto Fino has tarry blackberry and cassis aromas that turn horsey, minty and herbal on a nose that struggles to hold up. After hinting at savory berries, flavors turn green, bitter and underripe. It finishes with rough tannins and heat.
Name: Rios de Tinta 2015  Ribera del Duero

Description: Stale, stewy aromas lack vitality and suggest compost. This wine is edgy as well as creamy in feel, while flavors of cottage cheese and broken-down berry fruits finish with rooty, tomatoey notes. This is now eight years old and fading.
Name: Urbina 2009 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This clipped, sharp wine leads with berry and plum scents. In the mouth, it's all acid and no fruit, tasting extremely sour.
Name: Pagos de Valcerracin 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: And now for something completely different, this wine explodes in whole-cluster, carbonic freshness and surprise. It's a light cerebral take on the variety that delights at every turn. Stainless-steel fermented and aged, it's loaded in raspberry and cherry-jam flavors and dipped in black licorice. It's fresh, fruity and entirely memorable.
Name: Sheldon 2016 Springloaded Monkey Paw Luc's Vineyard Tempranillo (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Alluring aromas of moist earth, cassis bud, olive, nori, pipe tobacco, charcoal, funk and mineral give way to lithe fruit and savory flavors with an ultra soft feel. The texture is absolutely dazzling.
Name: Cayuse 2014 Impulsivo En Chamberlain Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a reserve level Tempranillo—the third ever bottling produced by the winery. Packed with cassis and black cherry fruit, it also delivers intense smoke, charred wood and espresso scents and flavors. It's a powerful wine, with further notes of spice and graphite, finishing tongue-scrapingly dry and ready for a juicy steak.
Name: Abacela 2013 Paramour Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas rise up from the glass, with notes of pepper, violet, cigar box, peat, smoke, braised meat and an earthy funk. The palate is considerably lighter in style than the aromas might suggest, bringing notes of cherry, earth and herb that linger, with citrus twist notes on the finish.
Name: No Girls 2014 Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: Reedy, fiery, lightly green berry aromas suggest a wild pasture with horses. This is a chunky, big-boned Argentinean version of Tempranillo with saucy berry flavors and hints of tomato to go with plenty of oak. On the finish, resiny wood notes and mocha flavors prevail.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2013 Reserva de Familia Tempranillo (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Made predominantly from Tempranillo, with 10% Pinot Noir and a splash of Syrah, this is a simple, generic red wine, with light berry flavors and touch of cracker but no specific varietal character.
Name: South Stage 2013 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sardon de Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Few wines offer as much as this for under $30, but this extracted, bullish Tempranillo blend is not for everyone. Blackberry, cola and savory herbal aromas are strong and pure. This feels wide and cushioned, yet is still a driller. Blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors finish rich and ripe. Drink through 2024.
Name: Abadia Retuerta 2012 Estate Grown Selección Especial Red (Sardon de Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This dark, concentrated number is new from the García family, known for the wines of San Román and Mauro. Like most reds from this clan, this is loaded with blackberry and toasty oak aromas. A massive, raw palate shows abrasive tannins. Oak-forward flavors of blackberry, cassis and coconut finish woody and powerful. Drink from 2018–2028.
Name: Garmón 2014  Ribera del Duero

Description: An attractive mix of spiced plum, fresh tomato, herb, tobacco and vanilla aromas are the intro to this excellent wine from a not-good vintage. The palate is creamy but vital, with roasted plum, integrated oak and savory flavors. A smooth but intense finish brings this home. Drink through 2019.
Name: Maetierra Dominum 2008 QP Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Interest is stirred right away by tarry aromas of wild berry fruits and rooty spices. The solid palate is creamy while also showing its teeth. Toasty, spicy baked-berry flavors are integrated and finish long and dry, with a touch of latent oak. Drink at any point through 2032.
Name: Coto de Imaz 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Rooty aromas of licorice and sarsparilla are oaky and toasty, like burnt bread crust. This reserva feels weighty, but well balanced. Spicy currant and plum flavors are racy and improve on an elegant finish that doesn't overreach. Drink through 2026.
Name: Consejo de la Alta 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Slightly overripe aromas of raisin and prune dominate the nose on this jammy, spongy-feeling gran reserva. Soft, ripe cassis and plum flavors come with spice and tobacco accents. On a savory finish, prune comes back into play, thus cementing a ripe, jammy essence. Drink through 2025.
Designation: Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2010 Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe cassis and berry aromas come with common Rioja side notes of vanilla, cedar and tobacco. This wine feels flush, with plenty of weight but also balance. Flavors of raisin, prune, cassis, chocolate and vanilla finish full, toasty and warm. This is a ripe reserva made in the classic Rioja style; drink through 2025.
Name: Valdelacierva 2011 Alfar Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Description: Dense, dark aromas of minty oak, blackberry, pencil lead and chocolate set up a broad, hard-bodied palate with firm, gripping tannins. Toasty blackberry and pronounced oak flavors culminate on a big, lush and grabby finish. This is excellent, though a bit bold and burly; drink through 2022.
Name: Teso La Monja 2014 Victorino  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Milagros means “miracles,” and the marvel is how good this wine is considering how rough in general 2013 was in the Ribera del Duero region. Oaky aromas of root beer and blackberry are smooth and heady. This wine is intense, with big tannins and firm acidity. Faith will be rewarded down the line with potent berry and chocolaty oak flavors. Bottle age should help this soften up; drink from 2020–2030.
Name: García Figuero 2013 Milagros  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Intense, rubbery aromas of blackberry, cassis and raisin lead off. This Tinto Fino is full bodied, saturated and ripe in feel. Blackberry, cassis, toast and chocolate flavors finish with a covering of burnt oak and spice. Drink through 2026.
Name: Tionio 2014  Ribera del Duero

Description: A mix of earthy berry, cassis and leather aromas sets up a grabby, rubbery palate that isn't very lush or cushioned. Flavors of roast plum, savory spice, olive and tobacco are more earthy than ripe, staying steady on a savory, roasted-tasting finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Remírez de Ganuza 2008 Reserva Old Vines Unfiltered  (Rioja)

Description: Richly oaked aromas of maple and mocha accent earthy, rubbery berry scents. This is muscled-up and edgy on the palate, with flavors of tobacco, mocha, plum and berry fruits. A grabby, slightly collapsed finish contains earthy, savory flavor remnants. Drink through 2020.
Name: Remírez de Ganuza 2008 Viña Coqueta  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy aromas of olive, tobacco, prune and oak set up a palate with drawing tannins. This tastes of coffee, mocha and earthy mixed berries. The finish is meaty in texture, with compatible oak spice and berry-fruit notes.
Name: Sonsierra 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Charred, toasty oak aromas lend a note of maple to the nose of this pulling, tannic, high-acid Tinto Fino. Lemony oak, plum, wild berry and savory, saucy flavors finish with scraping tannins. Drink this single-vineyard ball of power 2019–2030.
Name: Protos 2014 Selección Finca El Grajo Viejo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Black-fruit scents combined with cheesy oak aromas are common for Toro. This wine has a wide, pulpy, grabby palate and flavors of black plum, herbal blackberry and savory meat. There's plenty of weight and substance, but it's also a bit stretched and bumpy along the way.
Name: Maurodos 2014 Prima  (Toro)

Description: Woody aromas of maple and raw oak shroud core berry aromas. This wine is edgy on the palate, with tomatoey acidity and choppy tannins. Flavors of plum and tomato come with vanilla and oak accents. It hollows out on the finish, leaving rubbery tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Numanthia 2013 Termes  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A nose with jammy red-fruit and scented-soap notes is milder than the raw, rugged palate this shows, but that's what 2013 was about in Ribera del Duero: tough wines. Plum, blackberry and savory oak flavors are raw on the finish, with a note of fine tobacco. Time can only help; drink through 2025.
Name: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2013 Gran Tábula  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Heavily oaked and charred aromas of saucy berry fruits and espresso lead to a choppy, astringent palate. Reedy plum and berry flavors are a touch herbal and saucy. It feels tannic and drawing on an oaky finish that sports a clove note. Drink from 2018–2026.
Name: Carlos Moro 2014 Finca Valdehierro 16 Meses Barrica Tempranillo (Cigales)

Description: Front-loaded aromas of oak and vanilla lead tobacco, plum and berry scents on this classic-style Rioja reserva that's perky and grabby on the palate. Vanilla, cocoa and woodspice flavors are as prominent as those of cherry and plum, while mocha is the key flavor on a long, oaky finish. Drink this high-energy Rioja through 2025.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2011 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of tobacco, wood grain, plum and cherry set up a plucky, lively palate with hard tannins. Spicy plum and berry flavors finish steady and drawing. Drunk now through 2023.
Name: Eduardo Garrido García 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Oak and related vanilla aromas are prominent. This is a high-acid Rioja with starchy tannins. Resiny, oaky flavors of berry fruits are topped with pepper, clove and other spice notes. This tastes toasty on the finish, with persistent acidity creating length.
Name: Izadi 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Gritty, herbal berry aromas smell much like asphalt. Following the nose, this is tight and raw in feel. Burnt, herbal, gritty plum flavors finish clipped and drawing, with pinching tannins and dark spice notes.
Name: Contino 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Fig and raisin aromas blend with damp earth and animal notes on the nose of this grippy, bumpy crianza lacks focus but is still quite good. Black cherry, herbal plum and toasty oak flavors finish sticky and with lasting oak. Drink through 2025.
Name: Pagos de Valcerracin 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Briary, oaky, stalky berry aromas lead to a full-bodied palate with tomatoey acidity. Savory plum and berry flavors include notes of oak grain and tomato that lead to a steady finish. Overall, this is a classic Rioja from an excellent vintage. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde de Valdemar Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Some years, even the top wines suffer, and in a cold 2013, Alion is not what it normally is. For starters, this is far more tight, tannic, raw and pulling than its track record. Toasty oak is a big player, creating creamy aromas and toast on the finish. In between are crisp, peppery blackberry flavors. This wine may improve with time. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Alion 2013 Alion  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Savory oak aromas and related spice notes blend with earthy berry scents. This wine has a racy mouthfeel tempered by creamy oak. Woody, spicy, earthy flavors of berry fruits and tomato conclude with a note of vanilla on a traditional Rioja-style finish.
Name: Vallobera 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Savory berry aromas are accompanied by spice notes and a hint of latex. This feels wide rather than precisely shaped. Baked, earthy, oaky flavors envelop stewed berry notes, and the wine feels wayward on the finish.
Name: Fernández de Piérola 2008 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of raw oak, vanilla and cherry settle with airing, but this Rioja feels a bit wiry and choppy. Plum, berry and oak flavors finish well, with bright acidity paving the way.
Name: Viña Herminia 2014 Herminia  (Rioja)

Description: Cherry, plum and balsam-wood aromas make for a good opening. This wine feels full, with cheek-grabbing tannins. Flavors of woodspice, cherry and plum hold appeal, but this feels a bit hot on the finish, with residual oak.
Name: Viñestral 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Plum, raspberry and floral aromas create an appealing nose. This everyday Rioja feels tight and pulling, with scratchy tannins. A flavor profile dominated by red berries feels tannic and rubbery on the finish.
Name: Viña Eguía 2014  Rioja

Description: Plum and berry aromas are made more savory and spicy by overt wood notes. This wine feels fresh, crisp and edgy, with acidic snap. Raspberry, plum, currant and oak flavors finish dry and slightly abrasive.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2014  Rioja

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, aromas of vanilla, caramel, toast, char and wood spice lead to wood-forward fruit flavors backed by tart acids. The oak seems out of check but it still brings some appeal.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2014 Rosebud Vineyard Red Wine Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Rusty in color and lacking fruit aromas on the nose, this is just good enough for a gran reserva. Leathery, roasted-plum flavors taste more like black olive than bright fruit. It's tannic and a bit dull on the finish.
Name: Castillo Clavijo 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Compact, rubbery aromas of plum and berry come with notes of cheesy oak and cowhide. A tight, fresh palate is balanced, tasting of plum, berry fruits and oaky spice. A straightforward finish echoes the palate.
Name: Pingao 2014  Rioja

Description: Dry, hot, scratchy berry -fruit aromas are earthy as well. A solid but abrasive palate shows hard, rubbery tannins. Flavors of plum, berry fruits and prune finish a bit stewed.
Name: Launa 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A dark color and stewy aromas of earthy berry fruits lead to a lush, lazy palate that tastes of toasty oak and roasted berries. A hot, minty and charred finish feels heavy.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Roasted, leathery and rubbery berry aromas are gritty and short on brightness. This feels rugged but good. Jammy cassis and cherry flavors show notes of cocoa and herbs.
Name: Bodega Classica 2015 Hacienda Lopez de Haro  (Rioja)

Description: Herbal blackberry and jammy black-plum aromas are forceful and brutish. This Toro has a hard, collapsed, jammy palate and overripe berry fruit flavors. A dense, chewy, baked finish is solid but lacks elegance.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2015 Dehesa Gago  (Toro)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, intriguing aromas of cedar, mushroom, orange peel, smoke and cigar box are followed by somewhat faint elegantly styled red-fruit and spice flavors. It falls a bit flat on the palate.
Name: The Walls 2014 Wonderful Nightmare Stoney Vine Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Medicinal, grapy berry aromas come with a hint of latex and Band-Aid. This flush, fruity Toro feels grabby and tannic. Uncomplicated, bold flavors of plum, blackberry and cherry are brash on the finish.
Name: Pagos del Rey 2015 Bajoz  (Toro)

Description: Light red-fruit aromas include a note of chewing gum. This wine is medium in body and solid in feel. Currant and nectarine flavors are basic and snappy, persisting on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Camina Rosé Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cheesy oak aromas and murky fruit scents are less than what Atauta usually offers. Chalk it up to the rough conditions of chilly 2013. In the mouth, this is choppy. Roasted berry and earthy notes precede a tannic, rubbery finish.
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2013 Parada de Atauta  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Open-grained oak aromas dominate a toasty nose with heat. This feels lean and tomatoey. Flavors of tart plum and pie cherry are almost sour and feel edgy due to severe wood tannins.
Name: Palacio del Burgo 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Heavy aromas of raisin, oak and chocolate are copied on the palate that tastes of oak, vanilla and raisiny fruit. It has a woody finish.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Plum, berry and spice aromas are a touch volatile. A hard, flush palate is loaded with rubbery tannins. Baked berry, cassis and prune flavors fall off on a finish that tastes slightly cooked.
Name: Matsu 2015 El Picaro  (Toro)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Grapy aromas of black cherry are young and fruity but unsophisticated. This everyday Tempranillo is more superficial than deep in build. Sweet as well as peppery black-fruit flavors finish mild.
Name: Dominio de Punctum 2016 Lobetia Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Underripe berry aromas are leathery and briny. This wine is bulky and chewy in feel, with herbal berry and rubbery flavors. A rustic finish with good mouthfeel delivers animal-like flavor notes.
Name: Rejadorada 2014 Reja  (Toro)

Description: Cassis and raisin aromas lead to a rubbery, grabby and pinching palate. This wine tastes of herbal, leafy berry and plum, while the savory finish lingers.
Name: Bodegas Martinez Corta 2015 Cepas Antiguas Selección Privada  (Rioja)

Description: This Tempranillo smells a bit chemical as well as jammy. A tannic palate is slightly astringent but softens with airing. Medicinal plum and berry flavors stick out on a rough finish.
Name: Arrumaco 2015 Tempranillo (Spain)

Description: Aromas of wet cement, spicy oak and generic berry fruits make for a rubbery, earthy whole. This wine is jammy and flabby in feel, with peppery berry and oak spice flavors. It lacks character.
Name: Camina 2016 Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Jumpy raspberry and candied plum aromas are akin to Kool-Aid. A rubbery, grabby palate and foxy, medicinal flavors of latex and berry fruits culminate on a strained finish.
Name: Conde de Altava 2015  Rioja

Description: Although 2012 was a ripe, warm year, this wine is tomatoey and herbal. Stalky, salty flavors are barely acceptable.
Name: Loriñon 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: While this Tempranillo smells rustic and horsey, it performs better on the palate, which is thick but flat in feel. Rustic, leathery black-fruit flavors finish hot.
Name: Venta Morales 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Stewy, raisiny and baked on the nose, this wine feels rough and tannic. Soupy, stewed black-fruit flavors finish raisiny.
Name: Gil Luna 2015 Sin Complejos  (Toro)

Description: Jabbing red-berry aromas are a bit dusty and yeasty. This wine feels rubbery and astringent. Raw flavors of tomato and herbs finish hard.
Name: Arrumaco 2016 Tempranillo (Spain)

Description: An undeniable raisiny nose leads to a soupy, flat, raisiny wine that's flawed and barely drinkable.
Name: Familia Montaña 2015 Montaña Tinto  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas suggest compost, murky grit and olive. In the mouth, this wine is heavy and flat. Roasted, underripe berry-fruit flavors finish hot and gritty.
Name: T 2015  Toro

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lightly charred, toasty berry aromas come with a full covering of clove and baking spice scents in this plush wine. The palate is edged with drying tannins, bolstering exotic berry, spice and herbal flavors. Its long, balanced finish features chocolate and unabsorbed oak. Drink through 2022.
Name: Vega Sicilia 2012 Valbuena 5  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Full-throttle oak, vanilla, tobacco and smoky blackberry aromas feed into a full, grippy but surprisingly fresh palate. Toasty oak, blackberry and spice flavors finish long and steady. Drink this excellent Tempranillo from a powerful vintage through 2025.
Name: Protos 2011 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This wine leads with tire rubber, bacon, forest floor, juniper and blackberry aromas, requiring as much air or time as you can give. In the mouth, it's hard, tannic and almost astringent. A mix of oak and herb-laced black fruit flavors finishes long, with plenty of energy and power in reserve. Drink 2018–2027.
Name: Bodegas Fuentespina 2012 F  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe with mocha, baking spice and heady berry fruit aromas, this is an excellent wine from a great vintage. Its firm, tight palate delivers oak, toasty spice and ripe fruit flavors while coffee and spice accents close out the long finish. Drink through 2027.
Name: Livius 2010  Rioja

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's compact, lightly toasted berry aromas are reticent but also slyly complex. The palate is packed with firm, abrasive tannins. Dark berry, spice, toast and chocolate flavors finish long and harmonious, with equal amounts of herbal, exotic, oak and berry flavors. Drink through 2026.
Name: Arrocal 2012 Selección  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Maple, mocha and raisin aromas announce an oaky, fully ripe wine with roasted tomato notes. The palate is saturated with mixed berry, spice and chocolatey oak flavors, finishing with heavy residual tannins. Drink this oaky powerhouse through 2028.
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2010 Selección Privada  (Rioja)

Description: Open-grained oak aromas lend molasses and vanilla to the nose of this well-built Rioja. It's lively and choppy on the palate, with roasted plum and berry flavors, finishing dark and toasty with oak and graphite notes. Drink through 2026.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2012 Selección  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's ripe berry, vanilla, toast, raisin and cedar aromas set the stage for an intense palate with choppy tannins. Its blackberry, caramel and vanilla flavors are rich and ripe, tasting pure on the finish, with a strong punch of chocolaty oak. Drink through 2024.
Name: Marqués del Puerto 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, baked black-fruit aromas go heavy on the raisin and prune, with a hint of spice cake thrown in. On the palate, this is saturated and a bit thick. Baked berry, cassis and creamy oak flavors finish lush and chewy, with flavors of oak grain and chocolate. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Valduero 2012 I Unacepa  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Toro is known for its massive wines, and this fits the bill. Oak, tobacco and mocha aromas share space on the nose with cassis and berry scents. Fully extracted tannins and resiny oak create a sizable palate of plum, cassis and vanilla flavors. Oak-derived spice notes inflect the intense black fruit flavors on the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Matsu 2014 EL Viejo  (Toro)

Description: Vanilla, oak spice, tea, berry, olive and herb aromas signal a classic Rioja. Its crisp palate and choppy tannins form the canvas for spicy berry and cassis flavors. More spice powers the finish, which has the fruit to absorb and support the high level of oak. Drink through 2025.
Name: La Gitana 2014 Gold Label  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky hickory and meat aromas overshadow this wine's berry scents. On the palate, it rattles about like an untied load. Berry and black plum flavors come with more than enough oak, which is reflected on the toasty, char-laced finish. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: García Figuero 2013 Tinto Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This delicious wine is fresher and more lively than typical California Tempranillos. Cola, red cherry and vanilla aromas combine for a beautiful nose while the palate shows tart sour cherry and slight hints of leather. Both the acidity and tannic grip are strong but expertly measured.
Name: Curran 2012 Tempranillo (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Murrieta's wines have been on a good run in recent years, as evidenced by this saturated, fleshy Reserva. The nose delivers berry and cherry aromas, with ample oak. The palate is a full-volume bonanza of berry flavors framed by briary spice and toasty oak. A naturally spicy, ripe finish confirms its excellence; drink 2018–2026.
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2012 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: The intensely ripe berry and cassis aromas in this single-vineyard Toro come with strong tobacco and baking spice side notes. The palate is loaded to the brim with tobacco, coconut, blackberry and cassis flavors, finishing rich and chocolatey. Drink through 2028.
Name: Carlos Moro 2014 Finca Valmediano 16 Meses Barrica  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This heavily oaked Ribera del Duero features maple, barrel char, dried cheese, licorice and boysenberry jam aromas. The palate is so concentrated it's syrupy, its blackened oak, crème de cassis and chocolate flavors feeling heavy on the finish. Drink this saturated bruiser through 2022.
Name: Dominio Basconcillos 2011 Viña Magna Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This Tempranillo from little-known Cigales opens with potent crushed brick, spice, toasty oak and berry aromas. The palate has a juicy, fresh outlook and no excess weight or overextraction. Its plum, berry, spice and vanilla flavors finish with a note of mature, sweet tobacco. Drink through 2020.
Name: Museum 2011 Reserva Tempranillo (Cigales)

Description: This firm, tannic wine's plum and black cherry aromas are matched by oaky maple and spice scents. Toasty, spicy black fruit and mocha flavors finish with a wave of toast, chocolate and spice. This is more bullish than elegant; drink through 2021.
Name: Matsu 2013 El Recio  (Toro)

Description: This wine's ripe berry aromas are accompanied by creamy oak, pepper and licorice notes. It feels choppy yet built to last, with spicy, lightly herbal berry and plum flavors and an abrasive but fresh finish, suggesting it will not suffer from further aging. Drink through 2024.
Name: Marqués del Puerto 2014 Bentus  (Rioja)

Description: This full-size, oak-heavy Toro smells of baked berry, prune and wood grain. Lush and chunky on the palate, with mild acidity and bulky tannins, this tastes mostly of toasty, blackened oak, cassis and blackberry. A choppy but long finish tastes chocolaty and rich. At 15.5%, this is extracted, with fleeting balance. Drink through 2020.
Name: Vatan 2014  Toro

Description: An opaque purple color and charred, smoky aromas render this ripe-vintage Toro dark from the outset. Sandpaper tannins frame its dominant char and burnt toast flavors, while a base of black fruit holds it together. It's all about oak and slamming tannins now, so cellar and drink from 2020–2030.
Name: Vega Sicilia 2012 Pintia  (Toro)

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas precede a racy, high-acid palate that's fresh and sharp. Snappy red plum and wild berry flavors finish tannic, with oak spice and mild chocolate notes. This is a power-packed wine that will last a long time; drink through 2028.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Tierra del Viños de Zamora, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Heavy oak gives this Tempranillo from Zamora an inky, resiny, charred set of aromas. Its muscular palate is softened somewhat by creamy oak. Woody mocha, blackberry, vanilla and spice flavors linger into the finish, feeling rich but also punchy and tannic. Drink through 2024.
Name: Viñas del Cenit 2013 Via Cenit Tempranillo (Tierra del Viños de Zamora)

Description: A dense, dark color and ripe and raisinated black fruit aromas welcome one into this multi-vineyard Rioja. On the palate, it's loaded with berry and vanilla flavors, its textured finish showing a hint of toast. Drink through 2021.
Name: Artadi 2014 Viñas de Laguardia  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's ripe plum and berry aromas feature an oaky note of bacon. On the palate, it's choppy and aggressive with tannic bite. Dark fruit flavors are bolstered by oaky spice, tobacco and chocolate hints that persist long on the finish. A texbook Toro wine.
Designation: Flor de Vetus Vino de Finca
Name: Vetus 2014 Flor de Vetus Vino de Finca  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Tempranillo's red berry jam and oak aromas lean savory and saucy. On the palate, lip-smacking, tomato-like acidity sends a jolt through plum, currant and oak spice flavors, the oak lingering on the finish. Drink over the next 15 years.
Name: Alidis 2011 VS  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This wine's rubbery latex, briary plum and berry aromas are potent. Its plum, berry and vanilla flavors finish with shrill acidity, hard, choppy tannins and long-lasting dark berry notes. Drink through 2028.
Designation: Fincas de Ganuza Reserva Old Vines Unfilitered
Name: Remírez de Ganuza 2010 Fincas de Ganuza Reserva Old Vines Unfilitered  (Rioja)

Description: This intense Tempranillo burns with alcohol and charred oak on the nose. Its almost-burnt black fruit flavors finish with rough, rugged, drying tannins as well as briary, oaky berry notes. Drink 2019–2035.
Name: Remírez de Ganuza 2010 Trasnocho Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Despite showing reduced black plum and blackberry aromas, this displays grippy tannins and tension on the palate. Its blackberry and boysenberry flavors are lush, and the oak is mild and integrated on the finish.
Name: Teso La Monja 2014 Romanico  (Toro)

Description: Oak dominates the nose of this wine, leading to maple, molasses and mint aromas. It's broad and grippy on the palate, with herbal plum and toasty oak flavors. Its big, tannic finish is bold, but somewhat one-note.
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2013 Selección Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's ripe, raisiny aromas include vanilla and a hint of animal hide. Its dense, oaky palate is generally in balance, with plum, tomato, spice and vanilla flavors typical of Rioja. It flattens out on the finish, tasting slightly baked.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Cerro Añon Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: The baked berry, raisin and vanilla aromas in this Tempranillo and Garnacha blend are a touch soupy. It's tannic and firm on the palate, with tomato, berry and mildly oxidized flavors.
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Añares Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Júcar, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's ripe berry aromas include integrated oak, tar and vanilla notes. Its plum, raspberry, vanilla and cream flavors are appealing, yet it finishes raw, jagged and a bit shrill.
Name: Sueño 2014 Tempranillo (Ribera del Júcar)

Description: This wine's ripe berry aromas include a hint of iodine. Its chunky palate lacks precision, tasting of coffee and nondescript berry fruit flavors. The finish is dense and round but lacks focus.
Name: Artadi 2014  Rioja

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: High-toned aromatics emphasize baking spices (the wine spent two years in mostly neutral oak). Light red fruits fill in the rest. The flavors recall a morning glory breakfast muffin done as a red wine.
Name: Jaxon 2014 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Spicy oak aromas accent foxy red berry scents in this pinchy, wayward wine. Its chocolatey black fruit and peppery spice flavors finish jammy, with a lot of unresolved oak.
Name: Damalisco 2014 Roble  (Toro)

Description: This wine's heavy oak aromas are toasty but not overdone, while bacon and tobacco notes lurk in the background. Its raw, supremely tannic palate delivers woody, spicy berry flavors.
Name: Bodegas Bilbainas 2014 Viña Zaco  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy but basic berry and plum flavors introduce this bumpy, rugged Tempranillo. Its tight mouthfeel is governed by rough tannins and tomato-like acidity, its lightly herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finishing choppy, rugged and abrasive.
Name: Finca Villacreces 2014 Pruno  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leather, smoked meat, crushed rock, stewed black cherry and dried oregano notes show on the rustic nose of this bottling from the team at Cru Wine Company. It's light bodied, making for easy quaffing, with red plum, beef jerky and baking spice flavors.
Name: Mariposa 2014 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: This Crianza has leathery aromas, a tannic mouthfeel and roasted, spicy red berry flavors. It's dry, oaky and not particularly ripe.
Name: Quasar 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This Tempranillo's oaky berry aromas are solid but standard. It shows moderate buttery oak and plum flavors, tasting mostly of creamy oak on a finish propped up by acidity.
Name: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2014 Ea! Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: The earthy berry and plum aromas in this full-bodied wine include cinnamon and spice notes. Its ripe black fruit comes with a tea-like note and a rubbery mouthfeel, finishing rugged with meaty black fruit and spice flavors.
Name: Alegra 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A dark purple color and reduced, funky stewed fruit and leather aromas open this tannic, hard-bodied Tempranillo. Its mix of tea and stewed berry flavors finishes rough, with a meaty note.
Name: Arroyo 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This blocky Tempranillo smells dense and damp, with curry and earthy berry notes. Its chunky palate deals in heavy berry flavors that are low on elegance and high on tannin, and its finish is earthy and flat.
Name: Yemanueva 2014 La Tercia Bodega Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This everyday Tempranillo opens with spicy aromas and herbal black plum and prune notes. Its palate is ruled by rubbery tannins, tasting of berries, plums and mild oak spice. A roasted flavor closes the finish.
Name: R+ 2014  Ribera del Duero

Description: This wine's creamy, woody maple and tobacco aromas are within Rioja norms. On the palate, it's blocky and thick, with vanilla and marshmallow flavors that taste sweet, finishing with little structure.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Puerta Vieja Crianza Selección  (Rioja)

Description: This wine's charred nose suggests over-the-top oak. The palate is a rough road of hard grape skin tannins. Char and clove flavors blanket its savory, meaty berry fruit, finishing woody and redolent of clove.
Name: Volver 2014 Single Vineyard Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Ribera del Duero smells more forced than natural, dominated by oak and clove scents. Its tough, woody palate matches the nose, with resiny berry and plum flavors. On the finish, a strong clove flavor is backed by modest berry fruit.
Name: Pradorey 2014 Adaro  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This Rioja's rubbery aromas are so strong they suggest industrial tires. It has grippy tannins and a blackened flavor profile that includes bacon fat. Drying tannins make for a rough finish.
Name: Conde de Altava 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a generic red, with no varietal particularity. Slightly sweaty and drying out, it's simple and short with a quick tart finish.
Name: Catman 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy, foxy, volatile aromas do little to draw one into this subpar Tempranillo. Its underripe, underwhelming roasted berry flavors finish dull and hollow.
Name: Trencalòs 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Ripe aromas of fig, blackberry and cassis are softened and sweetened by a slathering of oaky chocolate and vanilla. This is full, layered, intense and cushioned on the palate, with rich flavors of chocolaty black fruits and baking spices. A toasty, everlasting finish is heady but ideally balanced. Drink through 2023.
Name: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2012 Carodorum Selección Especial Reserva  (Toro)

Description: Deep, dense and pure from the opening bell, this Toro is a winner. Aromas of dark ripe black fruits are cool and moderately oaked. This feels massive on the palate but sensationally balanced. Flavors of blackberry, coffee, mocha and toasty oak finish spicy, smooth and heady. Drink this exemplary Toro through 2023.
Name: Numanthia 2012 Numanthia  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Nicely oaked blackberry, licorice, vanilla and charred aromas are smooth and sultry. This is an outstanding wine from an excellent year. Forward barrel-spice and mocha flavors adorn core blackberry and raspberry fruit, while this runs long and tastes vaguely chocolaty on the velvety finish. Enjoy this top-notch Tempranillo through 2030.
Name: Valduero 2010 6 Años Reserva Premium  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Slightly gritty black-fruit aromas include a sweet note of pastry along with a hint of prune. Wall-to-wall saturation ensures that all corners of one's mouth are covered. Flavors of blackberry, mocha and chocolate are highly impressive and expressive, while this settles nicely on a long finish. Drink now through 2024.
Name: Maurodos 2012 San Román  (Toro)

Description: Lush cedary black-fruit aromas are luxe and offer notes of marzipan and vanilla. This bruiser is massive and tannic on the palate, but still lush and friendly. Chocolate is a key flavor, while baked berry and cassis flavors are hardly wallflowers. On the finish, this is tannic and deep as a sea trench. Drink this saturated black-colored Toro through 2023.
Name: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2012 Carodorum Único Crianza  (Toro)

Description: Alluring, complex and powerful aromas of grilled meat, berries, tea, smoke, vanilla and spice cover every base. An intense palate is concentrated but still elegant. Blackberry, molasses and mocha flavors finish with chocolaty oak notes, fine tannins and overall cohesion. Drink this special Rioja from 2020 through 2035.
Name: Muga 2009 Prado Enea Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Tarry blackberry and cheesy oak aromas are appropriate for a wine of this size and magnitude. In the mouth, this Tinta de Toro is expansive and grabby, with bullish tannins. Slightly salty earthy accents come with core blackberry flavors and notes of baking spices and chocolate, while on the finish this is long, chocolaty, delicious and not too hard or tannic. Drink through 2023.
Name: Numanthia 2012 Termanthia  (Toro)

Description: Spicy yet sweet aromas of sarsaparilla root, saddle leather and earthy berry fruits precede a rich dense palate. This tastes of dark cherry and berry fruit, with an herbal shading adding complexity. Chocolaty oak takes hold on a solid long finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Maetierra Dominum 2009 QP  (Rioja)

Description: A ripe fruity set of berry and cassis aromas shows a slight hint of raisin. This is a stacked saturated wine with raw tannins and plenty of power. Blackberry and earthy notes finish stout and compact: this doesn't vary or waver on the back end. Best from 2019–2026.
Name: CVNE 2012 Imperial Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Deep dark berry aromas come with notes of vanilla, gritty spice and tobacco. Hard tannins require cushion and this has just enough to handle things. Blackberry, cassis, barrel spice and molasses flavors finish with savory oak notes, chocolate and lingering blackberry fruit. Drink through 2030.
Name: Lleiroso 2011 Reserva Edición Especial Sergio Hernández  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of roasted earth, leather and fine oak are more out-front than berry fruit, and that's the way it should be for a Gran Reserva. This feels bold, lively and still a touch bumpy. Chocolaty oak and vanilla notes rest comfortably on top of ripe berry and black-plum flavors, while the finish is persistently earthy and chocolaty. Drink through 2028.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2009 Monte Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This modern-style Tempranillo is registering at max ripeness. Aromas of black fruits, raisin, tire rubber and toasty French oak project a dark outlook. In the mouth, this is tight and gripping. Flavors of blackened oak, cassis and blackberry finish firm and closed, with manageable tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: San Vicente 2012  Rioja

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy berry scents and charred aromas of grilled steak include notes of wood spice and vanilla. On the palate, this is deep, and shows a good mix of bright acidity and meaty depth. Flavors of toasty oak, chocolate, blackberry and pepper finish with persistent chocolaty notes and intense acidity. Drink through 2028.
Name: Aventino 2011 200 Barrels  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Saturated berry, cassis and black-plum aromas are densely packed onto the nose of this tightly built iron-fisted Rioja. Berry, plum and cassis flavors are lightly toasted and spicy, while this is juicy and bold on the finish. Best from 2020–2024.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2012 Gaudium Gran Vino  (Rioja)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh-pressed strawberry, sugar beet, lavender and rose petal aromas show in this botting, which is a complex take on Tempranillo. Black plum and mulberry flavors are delicately presented, leading the intriguing and buoyant palate, which is light in body but full of elegant flavor.
Name: Rexford 2014 Meador Estate Vineyard Tempranillo (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Char and wood grain are prominent on a smoky nose with blackberry and black-currant aromas. Intense tannins and layered depth make for a full palate, while this tastes ripe and toasty, with blackberry and chocolate flavors. On the finish, mild herbal complexity mixed with latent oak are stirring. Drink through 2026.
Name: Bodegas Fariña 2011 Gran Colegiata Campus  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Strong classy oak aromas lead blackberry and baking-spice scents on a potent but textbook RDD nose. This old-vines wine from a benchmark year is tight-fisted and linear in feel, with lemony acidity. Fully oaked flavors of blackberry and cassis sit comfortably on a bed of herb and spice notes, while this is oaky, spicy, steady and integrated on the finish. Drink through 2027.
Name: Alidis 2010 VS  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Toasty, oaky aromas of graphite, pepper, barrel char and black fruits properly announce a palate of chewy tannins and several layers of blackberry, cassis, barrel-spice, toast and chocolate flavors. Chocolaty depth on the finish only adds to the package. Drink through 2030.
Name: Lleiroso 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark smoky, stout aromas of licorice, molasses and blackberry feed into a jammy palate with rock-hard, clamping tannins. Plum, blackberry and blueberry flavors are loud and intense, while this finishes with density, complexity, chewy tannins and a jammy essence. Drink through 2028.
Name: Alidis 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earth, leather and strong but quality oak notes accent berry-fruit aromas. Cheek-sucking tannins make for a rugged mouthfeel. Spicy, peppery berry flavors are fully oaked and toasty, while this tastes dry and minty on the finish. Grilled meat and/or a few years on its side is what this needs. Drink through 2025.
Name: Portia 2012 Trienna  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This 25% whole cluster bottling from the Full Draw Vineyard shows black cherry, leather, cola and sarsaparilla scents on the nose. Cherry cola and vanilla flavors mark the palate, where medium acidity and persistent tannins ensure solid cellaring potential. Drink 2018–2025.
Name: Barton 2012 E Street Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Spicy earthy briary aromas include a note of cola along with requisite berry and cassis scents. A slightly choppy mouthfeel and flavors of blueberry, cardamom, herbs and oak define the palate, while this finishes fruity and open. Drink through 2024.
Name: Valenciso 2009 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: The nose on this ripe Tinta de Toro is dense, bold and brimming with black-fruit aromas. Following the nose, this tastes of blackberry, cassis and various spices, while finishing black-fruit flavors are lightly herbal, spicy and complex. This offers a touch of everything good, and even more when it comes to ripe fruit. Drink through 2024.
Name: Vetus 2011  Toro

Description: Blackberry, brandied cherry and spice aromas lead to a wide palate with tannins that pierce like nails. This tastes a touch foxy and wild, while the finish feels centered and firm. Despite intense, abrasive tannins, this displays depth and complexity. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodegas Fariña 2010 Dama de Toro Reserva  (Toro)

Description: Edgy berry aromas include notes of pencil lead and woody oak. The crisp bouncy acidic palate emphasizes freshness over weight. Plum, currant and oak-based flavors are spicy and snappy, while this maintains a spicy character on a dry finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Federico Paternina  (Rioja)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Approachable and jubilant rose petal, root beer, charred meat and ripe cherry aromas show on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The flavors are tighter and more focused, recalling red cherry, rust, tobacco and lava rock minerality. Tannins coat the palate with a delicate grip.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2014 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Description: Baked berry and cherry aromas are ripe and come with accents of mocha, leather and caramel. This feels full but not heavy, with balance and cushion to the palate. Spiced black-fruit flavors show a tea-like note, while this is dry, spicy and a touch chocolaty on the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Montecillo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: This massive heavily oaked blend of 94% Tinta de Toro and 6% Garnacha smells like a cross between café mocha and a sawmill, with baking spices thrown in for good measure. The palate is rough and tannic, while oaky flavors of clove dominate blackberry fruit. On the finish, more clove is apparent, while the tannic clamp is severe. Drink through 2024.
Name: Bodegas Fariña 2011 Gran Dama de Toro  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oaky aromas of maple, blackberry and chimney grit set up a raw tannic palate. This tastes toasty and oaky, but with enough black-fruit flavor to support all that wood. Mild herb and spice flavors mix with tea and berry notes on the finish of this off-vintage Tempranillo. Drink through 2022.
Name: Ankal 2013 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty tarry slightly gaseous aromas of jammy black fruits are a bit less than precise. This feels flush but soft around the edges. Blackened berry and black-plum flavors are lightly charred and chocolaty, while this tastes of black pepper and shows some heat on the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Pradorey 2010 Elite  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Edgy cherry and currant aromas are more crisp than rich, while this old-vines Rioja also shows an aromatic note of dusty earth. High acidity tethered to a medium body creates some midpalate emptiness, while plum, currant and berry flavors are fresh on a pointy finish. Drink through 2024.
